story:
Sparkplug Comics is ready to take on new publishing projects and we'd like to ask your help!

This campaign is a fundraiser for three of Sparkplug Books’ upcoming publishing projects.  Our soonest release, scheduled for April of 2012, is the graphic novel Nurse Nurse, by Katie Skelly.  This book compiles the previously self-published first seven issues of Katie’s ongoing sci-fi saga of nurses traversing the planets of our solar system.  The new book includes an eighth chapter to conclude the story.  The book has a two-color cover and black and white interior.

Our next two projects come from artists with whom Sparkplug has worked on multiple books in our past.  Reich, a series by Elijah Brubaker, is the ongoing biography of eminent sexologist Wilhelm Reich; this will be issue 9.  Olga Volozova, who has released Rock That Never Sleeps (a collaboration with Juliacks) and The Airy Tales through Sparkplug, brings us The Golem of Gabirol.  Each of these will have full color covers and black and white interior pages.

These books are of special import not only because they are amazing in themselves, but because they are the last projects on which Sparkplug founder Dylan Williams was working before he died of cancer in September 2011.  We are honored to see these through to completion and work with such great talent.

Sparkplug has had a long working relationship with Portland company Brown Printing and we intend to use them again to get these books printed out.  Currently the layouts are complete for each project and finishing touches are being made before they are sent to Brown.  The money from this fundraiser will go towards printing costs of each book, as well as shipping costs for the books and other gifts we are offering as perks. 

Please join us in making these books a reality!  Donate to the Sparkplug fundraiser today!

DONATION PERKS!

  • $5 New mini comic Brad Trip, published in collaboration with other Portland small press companies,  plus postcards & sticker
  • $15 All of above, plus Nurse Nurse book
  • $25 All of above, plus Reich #9 (printing in June 2012)
  • $35 All of above, plus Golem of Gabirol (printing in August 2012)
  • $55 All of above, plus one grab bag Sparkplug title
  • $65 All of above, plus tee shirt (choose from Renee French, Dylan Williams or Austin English designs while styles and sizes last)
  • $100 All of above, plus three Sparkplug grab bag items & poster
  • $200 All of above, plus original signed artwork by Sparkplug artists Chris Cilla, Aron Nels Steinke, Trevor Alixopoulos, Jeff Levine, and others.
  • $300 All of above, plus invite to movie night party at Sparkplug Headquarters.  Pick out a movie, get tour of our facilities and drink beer / eat snacks with us.

story:
My name is Omani Hanmer, I am a Special effects make-up graduate of July 2012, graduating with a 2:1 Bdes Degree. I have a background of six years with Body painting, Make-up artistry and Special effects make-up. I discovered body art and Special effects make-up at the age of 15, where I developed a passion for expressing , self inspired art on the body of a human.

Once I had left school, my heart knew where my destiny laid. I attended college for two years studying Media make-up, Beauty and Hair. Throughout college, I excelled within my body painting and became the only member, to compete in an outside competition for prosthetic make-up. I won student of the year 2008. This motivated me further to continue with Higher Education. I Attended Bolton University for three years and left feeling that I had already found my purpose and future prospects in life.

After graduating, I spent my summer networking with artists and working with productions I gained contact with at University. I contributed my skills at London, Notting hill Carnival 2012, I’ve worked on numerous TF Music Videos, Short films, location and studio shoots. I have recently been preparing as a freelancer offering services to production students and their projects, focusing on building my skills and portfolio, networking, grabbing opportunities and a lot of Messy Make-up.

I have been gaining savings from selling sketched portraits, painted canvases, face painting and money made from taking photographs. The money is used to build up my resources, my professionalism, and achieve my ideas to their fullest potential. I am Building as an artist and I am building within my Dream

I have been searching for good opportunities since July 2012 and now its October all my hard work has finally paid off, i have been offered an internship in Beijing, 5th January 2013. the internship is to work within International marketing. This will provide me with the experience and knowledge to develop Messy Make-up into a business throughout 2013. As a self employed 21 year old female I feel the future before me is bright, I will at any extent aim for my ambition to achieve quality work and this opportunity is just another step in the progression.

I need £6000 ($10000)

£2000 to provide me with the flights

£2000 to pay for the cost of living, daily transport, and back up emergency funds.

£1995 to pay Lincoln WU Consulting as they provide me with...

Guaranteed Internship (unpaid but what i will learn will pay off in time)

high quality accommodation in central Beijing

24 hour support speaking staff

Chinese language lessons

accompaniment to intern host company

Airport pick up and orientation

visa assistance and pre departure guidance

exclusively arranged social networking and sight seeing events in Beijing.

 

I will be working 40 hours a week, in a full time position as well as teaching students English Language in my spare time.

No Salary, the Cast of living is cheap however it is better to be safe than sorry

the money will be sent to a uk registered company bank account, therefore i will not lose my rights as the money is not sent outside of the uk.

 

With your help you can provide me with accomplishing my Dream, a real once in a life time opportunity that will create a starting point in my future career. i have a real passion for what i do. i take it extremely seriously and with a prepared business plan this will kick start my Gaol in life. my goal in life is to succeed in

If you can't Donate. then please please please please please spread the word, share the link on facebook or twitter. i will forever be grateful and i probably won't stop crying for days. THANK YOU!! xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

story:
Ice Cream Gallery and Toys

Hi, my name is Ronnie Mack Edison, I am a father, chef, musician and art lover, and I have a passion to bring all these thing together under one roof: A lowbrow gallery and designer toys, something very unique for the Midwest and especially unique for our city. Add to that an ice cream bar with exotic homemade ice cream and we have a destination fun for everyone.

The gallery and toy store are now in it's 6th month in business and the response has been great, a gallery where anyone would feel at home and an outlet for local artists to show and grow their ideas... but it is not complete.

With the help of the art community, art supporters, and food enthusiasts, we can construct an ice cream bar, get the proper licences and begin to serve our unique brand of ice cream and continue to break down the snooty walls of contempary galleries. Even bigger: We can begin to supply our unique ice cream blends to an even wider culinary audience, perhaps the World!

We are located on the Avenue for the Arts in beauitful Grand Rapids: a city which thrives on it's art and music scene. In the last 6 months we have estabished ourselves as an important part of that scene, with over many shows and openings rich with visual art, great food, and great bands.

 

 

We wish to continue working with local and reginal artists, expand our hours and make awesome homemade ice cream with hopes of expanding to retail and local restaurants.

We would also like to create reusable artist-designed collectible packaging, with art from artists Worldwide in limited edition batches: something we feel will set us even further apart from the rest.

- Thank you so much for your support,

Ronnie Mack Edison

story:
Before you pledge....

While our goal is to raise funds, we are offering a rarely seen phenomenon in campaigns, because the perks and rewards we offer are equal in value to the donation you make!  In other words, what you donate, you get returned in equal value in rewards!

STEPS:

  1. See the perks
  2. Pick an amount
  3. Donate Now
  4. Get Rewards

 

DETAILS

The Purpose of This Campaign

 

We would like to fund a gallery event exhibit, but we need pieces to create.  Therefore we have thought of a clever way of raising funds for new material while giving back to the backers!

Get involved now and take part in a movement to create new and fresh art and expand it to the masses.  New talent and rising stars usually encounter difficulties along the way, and sometimes, their well-being depends on a successful campaign.

Help promote new art by 'chipping in' to be able to raise funds for the following reasons:

  • To be able to afford high quality printing and create magnificent prints that can be matted and framed to be sold at affordable prices (for those that cannot purchase the original piece but still appreciate the art).
  • For the creation of full-size Giclée reproductions of some selected works.
  • To raise funds for the continued creation of new works from the artist.
  • For the promotion of the art throughout the States and other countries.
  • To create new material for upcoming art shows and events.

Art has increasingly become less attainable due to the economic hardships many are facing, causing a monopoly of high-quality work obtainability.

YOUR participation will help us reach beyond our own limits and restrictions.  The magnitude of your support will make it possible for American Artists who are undiscovered, to reach beyond their own limits.

What You Get

Contribution levels have different rewards.  With these funds we will also be able to create the rewards that you will receive for your donation.  By giving you will receive.

Each of the contribution categories has a unique gift(s) as a token of our gratitude.

Please use the following Main List for pieces to choose from, for those Perks that our backers will have a choice of preference to make.

  • Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Portrait 18" X 24"
  • The Last Cube 31″ X 31″
  • Infrastructure: Visual Explanation 4' X 2'
  • The Crossings 29″ X 19.5″
  • Billie Dearest 20″ X 16″

View all the artwork at: http://www.amorshowcase.wordpress.com
 
*For perks that will include Giclées of the actual size art work, please use the sizes above to determine your choice.  For example, if you choose the Jackie O Portrait and are backing up Perk # 5 ($500-$1000), you will receive a Giclee on canvas that will be apprx. 18" X 24", and all previous perks as well.

The Impact

We will not only be broadening our reach by giving back great gifts to all our backers nationwide, but once we finish, it's time to get to work.  With the remaining contribution funds we will be attending art events to gain recognition.  We are simply looking for L-O-V-E !! (Love Of Visual Experience)

Remaining funds (after backers are fullfilled) will be used to create more promotional material to help spread the art.  Any remaining materials that can be used for profit will go right back into the arts.  (I.E. buying more materials, paints, inks, paper, ETC).

 

We have gained much awareness for other events we have raised funds for, like recycling programs, and now have a great opportunity to keep it going with your help.

If we hit 35% ABOVE our goal, we will use half those proceeds to buy drawing and school supplies to send to kids in less fortunate countries.  If a trip has not been arranged to one of these countries within 3 months after the funds are available, then we will donate it to at-risk-youth and inner city school Arts programs.

We will post ALL of our progress on the blog so you can see the results after June 28th 2013 in REAL-TIME!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Re-post on Facebook, Twitter, your websites, and other social media outlets.
  • Direct possible backers to this campaign by copying the URL above and emailing, texting it, and posting it for others to see.
  • Email your contacts.
  • Share like you Care!
  • Become a partner of this campaign and get involved, raise your own funds at work, school, and friends to contribute.
  • Collaborate.

Now, we understand that not everyone has the same taste in Art, that is why we offer other ways to help.

You can still pledge and choose to forego accepting rewards, or, donate them.

And that’s all there is to it!  Get pledging and thanks in advance for your involvement and support!

story:
Who I am

My name is Indigo.  I'm a visual artist, dancer, writer and curator based in Vancouver BC.  I currently work in many mediums including stencils, posters, acrylics, oils, photography, printmaking and more; creating art for inside and outside.  My artwork is an exploration of human emotion, personal story and the weight of memory.  Influenced by my own history, that of the people around me and the imagined histories of strangers, my work often carries a poetic sense of melancholy, the kind of thoughtful sadness that persists long after the tears are gone.  From my lifetime of dance training comes a deep-rooted knowledge and understanding of the human figure, of movement and stillness and the brief eternity that lies between.


I was raised in a log home in Northern BC in a space of solitude and bright stars, of deep forests and shallow lakes.  Born into a family of artists and activists, my creative practice has always been interdisciplinary.  Upon moving to the Lower Mainland in 2000, I studied contemporary dance at Simon Fraser University.  I spent the years after graduation working as a choreographer, performer and instructor in Canada and the United States, both independently and as a part of multiple companies and collectives.  Following a more recent transition into the visual arts, my work has been shown at galleries, art festivals and on the streets in Canada, the United States, the UK and across Europe.

What I'm Doing

One of my upcoming projects is a 6 week residency with A WORD OF ART, based in Cape Town, South Africa; scheduled for April 1st-May 15th, 2011.  During that time I will be creating a body of work for a gallery exhibit, painting murals around the city, and participating in community workshops with Write on Africa.


A WORD OF ART is an organization dedicated to celebrating new art and emerging local and international artists.  It aims to create art projects and experiences rather then white-wall gallery shows, building the creative community through art projects that make use of its studio, project space and art gallery.  


Write on Africa is an initiative of A WORD OF ART that mobilizes creativity for inspiration, social change and urban rejuvenation.  Their aim is to rejuvenate the urban environment with color and inspire the youth, each other and themselves. Write on Africa is a platform for artists to create the change they wish to see, forming lasting connections with communities in order to effect meaningful changes therein. 

The video I've included above is from their most recent project - rejuvenating Percy Bartley House, a home for boys that operates out of an old house in the area. While at PBH, the boys are enrolled in school or skills training programs and are taught life skills before being reunited with their families. Over the years the home has become run down and has lost its sense of life and colour. This collaborative project restored life and colour into the home with wall murals done by well-known local artists.

The Impact

I have big dreams, and a strong belief in the power of community to achieve great things, individually and collectively.  Cultivating a widespread network of like-minded creatives is the first step towards effecting meaningful change on a global level.  I am excited to be working with Write on Africa's community participants during my time in Cape Town, sharing my knowledge and skills to help children and youth find inspiration through the arts.  I am also looking forward to sharing space and ideas with other South African and international artists in residence.  I hope that the impact of this project stretches far past its completion date, forming relationships that will lead to further collaborations in many places around the world, including in my own city of Vancouver.

What I need and what you get

My main costs for this project are flights, accommodation, materials and food.  I am applying for provincial and national travel grants, but I cannot rely on them as my sole source of funding.  Flights to Cape Town are about $1500, accommodation is $1200, and I figure I can get by with about $500 each for materials and food.  All in all it comes to just over $4000, and I'm hoping to raise half of that via this campaign.


As many of you know, I have an ongoing project called Mystery Mail in which you send me your address and I send you something random.  During my time in Cape Town I will be doing an extra special edition of Mystery Mail, with personalized handmade postcards and limited edition artwork available for donations of $25 and up.  (See 'perks' sidebar for details)

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Post this on twitter, on facebook, on your blog; email it to your friends and family.  Have a look through the artwork and merchandise available from my online store, and buy something if it catches your eye. Every little bit helps!  No donation is too small...if you have nothing else to give, please send your positive energy in my direction, and I will send you some in return!

As many of you know, I have an ongoing project called Mystery Mail in which you send me your address and I send you something random.  During my time in Cape Town I will be doing an extra special edition of Mystery Mail, with personalized handmade postcards and limited edition artwork available for donations of $25 and up.  (See 'perks' sidebar for details) 

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word!  Post this on twitter, on facebook, on your blog; email it to your friends and family.  Have a look through the artwork and merchandise available from my online store, and buy something if it catches your eye. Every little bit helps!  No donation is too small...if you have nothing else to give, please send your positive energy in my direction, and I will send you some in return!

story:
W H I T E   E L E P H A N T

Hi my Name is Sipho Mabona and I'm professional origami artist. I've had the opportunity to show my work in galleries and museums all around the world. My pieces mostly focus on large-scale installations.

As an ultimate prove that there are no limits to what can be made out of a uncut square piece of paper I plan to fold a life-size replica of an elephant. Over the course of several weeks the monumental sculpture will be folded at the Art Museum in Beromünster, Switzerland. A team of three assistants will support me on this mission. 

Using a sheet measuring 15 by 15 meters (50 by 50 feet), we will create an elephant standing more than 3 meters (10 feet) tall. Further more we will install two cameras which will be feeding footage to an online live video stream, so you, your friends and family can watch us as we fold. 


WHAT WE NEED

Let me quickly sum up what your funding contribution will help us with:

  1. The production of a 125 sqm or 2500 sqft sheet of paper

  2. The support structure to ensure the sculpture will stand upright.

  3. The sealing with acrylic paint

  4. The camera that will feed the online live stream showing how I fold the piece

  5. The camera documenting the process in time-lapse

  6. And off course the helping hands of my three assistants.

If we do exceed our initial funding goal we plan to fold a whole series of life-size origami animals in different galleries and museums around the world. It will be a great experience for us to share with you.


WHAT YOU GET

Here is a list of some of the awesome perks you can receive when supporting our campaign: 


INSTRUCTIONAL VIDEOS OF HOW TO FOLD AN ORIGAMI FOX, SWAN, ROSE OR ELEPHANT


HUMAN, BEAR AND ELEPHANT INSTRUCTION


FOLDABLE KIRIGAMI LANTERNS WITH CREASE PATTERN MOTIVS 


SMALL SHOJI SCREENS WITH CREASE PATTERN MOTIVES


FINE ART PIGMENT PRINTS ON ARCHIVAL QUALITY MATTE PAPER 

CERAMIC CASTS OF ORIGAMI CREASE PATTERNS

COLORED AND WHITE KOI


KOHAKU KOI

If you are interested to have any other of my creations become a custom perk for you feel free to contact me. 


The Impact

I believe that Origami and the W H I T E  E L E P H A N T are so fascinating due to the prevalent belief that the use of only one piece of paper is very limiting. But actually the very contrary is the case. In the art form of origami a simple piece of paper can be transformed into anything imaginable. It’s exactly this transformation, which in my opinion stands for many struggles we have to overcome in life. This project will be a great experience for us to share with you. Hopefully it will change public’s perception of origami and make people realize what a powerful art form it can be. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not all of you may able to contribute financially but you can help us never the less. Please spread the word about the  W H I T E  E L E P H A N T !!!

Share on Facebook, Twitter, Printrest, Tumbler or just tell as many people as possible. 


Here are some of the BLOGS that featured the WHITE ELEPHANT so far!!! 


SLATE 

HUFFINGTONPOST

FASTCODEDESIGN

COMPLEX

COLOSSAL

CORE77


WWW.MABONAORIGAMI.COM

story:
The Jist!

  • Most of you probably know me! But for those who do not, my name is Sean Wozniak or Swoz. I am a growing photographer who is looking for assistance. I am not looking for handouts, I am looking to earn your help. I shoot mostly portraiture and cosplay, but I shoot anything that I find interesting.

  • This campaign is basically two things: Help me immediately replace my aging, extremely well used (and now defective) D80, and simultaneously continue my learning and progression in Photography.

  • Essentially right now, you all hold the power to make or break photography in the foreseeable future for me. Without your contributions, I cannot effectively do photoshoots and pursue the projects and learning activities I have in mind.

Details:

  • 100% of the funding from this will go into purchasing a camera, lenses and peripherals needed in buying a new camera.

  • Hopefully the perks are worthwhile to you!

  • The perks are simple, but at the same time I hope that they are significant enough to justify your extremely generous donations.

Regardless of the amount given, I will be putting it towards a new camera and lens. The product of that will be more photographs!

 

My website where my galleries are displayed:

  • My Facebook Page

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jenn Desmarais. I'm a surrealist who creates drawings and digital art that centers around mood. My art can be both fun and serious.  Art is medicine. It is a means of introspection, stress reduction, and a coping mechanism. 

It is my hope that the viewer can relate to the imagery, and if not, gain a sympathetic understanding of mood disorders. As a child, the Swiss surrealist H.R.Giger was extremely influential to my work. It gave me a broader understanding of myself, challenged my sense of isolation, and intrigued me with his unique style. If I could do the same for even a small group of people, I would consider that a success.

I would like to put on a solo art show that is professional and fun. This will give me an opportunity to meet wonderful people, and get seen. It will also give me an opportunity to learn how I can improve as an artist. The exhibit will take place in Toronto, but a venue has not yet been chosen.


What We Need & What You Get

The amount of money that I'm asking for help for include the costs of a venue, artist materials (including printing costs, frames, etc), food and wine for the event, brochures, and business cards.

I want to create an exhibit where people are openly social, and enjoy themselves. In doing so, I hope to gain enough support that I can give as well as receive. During my show, I would like to donate a percentage of what I make from art that I sell to CAMH. Should I not reach my full goal, and cannot afford an exhibit as a result, the money will go to artists materials.

This is an opportunity to support an emerging artist, and by extension the community. 

The Impact

A common question I am asked is why I don't create more positive imagery. I focus on dark subjects because those are the themes I deal with personally. Art is a positive, introspective, and healthy means of coping. Doing otherwise would be disingenuous. Dishonesty is the last thing I want to see in my own creations. There are plenty of artist who focus on the obvious beauty of the world, and they don't need more competition. I would rather focus on the beauty people avoid seeing. That is meaningful to me. 

 I feel that like me, there are viewers who upon seeing such work would be able to relate. I wish to challenge isolation and loneliness, and offer solidarity.

Other Ways You Can Help


If you are not interested in this campaign, I would like to ask you to consider donating to CAMH.


Please remember you can do a lot with word of mouth. If you like my work, or know somebody that would, please spread the word!

http://jenniferdesmarais93.wix.com/graphics

https://www.facebook.com/artofjenndesmarais

story:
Short Summary

I came up with this idea while I was still in school studying to be a mechanical engineer. I wanted a way to take notes digitally with my cellphone. After 9 prototypes, I finally came up with the Infinity Binder. It works by writing with a dry erase marker, then photographing the notes with a cellphone or tablet, and finally erasing the notes so the pages can be reused an infinite number of times.

The concept works extremely well. All of my notes from my last two semesters are stored on my google drive account, and backed up on a flashdrive. Recently I even discovered that had I uploaded them all to my Evernote account, I would have been able to do word searches within my notes via evernote's character recognition feature.

Ultimately, it simply works. It's a robust and efficient way for anyone to completely stop using paper. Furthermore, it overcomes the hurdles that current tablets face, which are battery life and an ease of use that resembles pencil and paper. There is zero learning curve with the Infinity Binder. If you already know how to write with a pencil and paper, and you know how to take a picture with a cellphone, then you know more than enough to enter the world of digital note taking.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I currently have a provisional patent on this design, however this will expire soon. The funding that I receive from you guys will go straight toward paying for the full patent on this idea, and it will assist in paying for the cost of materials and labor that it takes to make these binders. Ultimately, I want to sell the idea to a larger company that can manufacture the Infinity Binders on a more grand scale. But until that day comes, I will be trying to invest in technology that will help me manufacture these at a faster and cheaper rate. If tests prove successful, some of the funding will most likely go towards purchasing a steel rule die cut aparatus for cutting the inner pages, which could potentially cut the manufacturing time in half for each binder.

Perks:

$5 - Membership - You will be become an official member of the Infinity Binder Team, and we will send you emails keeping you updated on any progress that we make.

$35 - 1 Infinity Binder - You will be taking a giant leap towards a paperless future. Before shipment, you will be asked what color you will want your binder to be.

$60 - 2 Infinity Binders - Go paperless and share the love with a friend. Before shipment, you will be asked what colors you will want your binders to be.

$1000 - The BIG ONE - You will receive 10 Infinity Binders and I will make a video in which I will do 10 handstands, and blow 1000 kisses to you. 

 

The Impact

The future is closer than we think when it comes to paperless note taking. Your contribution will speed up this bright future and allow this generation to enjoy the benefits of going digital. Furthermore, it will enable people to be less wasteful and reduce their environmental impact, which means we will be providing a better world for the next generation.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who cannot contribute, you can still help out by sharing this with your friends and family.

 

Thanks for reading and I hope you will enjoy going paperless as much as I have.

(Note: please don't let the $10,000 goal scare you. It is a little high for what I actually need, which is closer to $3,000 for the patent application. I chose it as an arbitrary number and I am unable to edit it now.)

story:
THE BOOK OF BEEZUS

Black Rock City: the land of dust and honey. Amid the sin and suffering, Beezus rises to grant sweet salvation, offering you his flesh and blood in the form of honey and mead. He has saved you once before and, in 2014, he is resurrected so that you may thirst not.

But seriously: Beezus Christ, Super Car is a bee mutant vehicle born in 2013 from the mind of Michelle "Smallfry" Lessans with help from an amazing group of friends. He currently lives at NIMBY, a fantastic maker space in East Oakland. We serve honey from Burners around the globe at our fabulous honey bar, along with homebrewed mead for those seeking a little more levity. Last year, we brought honey from Ireland, Poland, and beyond!

It seems like it's already built. Why should I back this project?

Otherwise, he will SMITE you! Actually, we’ve planned upgrades of biblical proportions to make Beezus bigger, better, and more bee-autiful than ever before. There's a lot to fund, and we appreciate all the support we can get. Here’s the breakdown:

• A new base! This year, Beezus' base will be covered by a flower, so he can pollinate 24/7.

• Moving wings! We're putting in a motor and giving Beezus the power to really fly.

• Sound! We're adding internal and external speakers to make the ride even more enjoyable.

• Transport! Beezus will have his very own trailer to get him home safely.

• Generator and extra batteries!This way, we can keep Beezus buzzing all day and night!

If we don’t meet our overall goal, Beezus will still grace us with his presence on the playa! But the closer we get, the more money we’ll have to make him as efficient and mobile as possible. 

PLUS: THE REWARDS OF FOLLOWING BEEZUS

We’ve got stellar gifts for all who donate! Stickers! Handwritten poems! Bandanas! Mead kits! Excessive enthusiasm, eternal gratitude, and infinite exclamation points! We've got it ALL!

Whether or not you’re able to donate, help us spread the gospel of our savior! Tell your friends, tell your mom, tell your weird neighbor. Tell your boss. Tell that guy on the bus. Write about it in your family newsletter. Blog about it, tweet about it, share our link on Facebook. Let everyone know that Beezus is here to save them! #BeezusSaves


*Special thanks to Jazz Tigan for making our video, Robin McKenna for giving us some footage from the playa, and NIMBY for being such an amazing space to build in!

story:
IdentityProductions is run by IdentityPollution and IdentityFox. We're P cool, we make geeky shit and sell things online, also I draw things. 

This is our first shirt printing run and that shit is expensive, we need to make sure you bitches are ready to put a ring on it. 



Levi AND Jean (thanks to our sponsor Jjagerbombastic) AND Mikasa AND Armin AND Ewin AND Hanji are getting made into sweet-ass swag. We want to be all inclusive and shit so we're bringing you this swag in mens AND womens cuts and in XS-2X for women and SM-3X for men. Don't tell me that shit don't fit you.

Levi and Armin are printed on the front AND back! Stretch goals could allow for others to be back printed as well!

Men's shirts are 100% cotton, charcoal color, 5.1oz fabric, pre-shrunk, NAFTA compliant and have tear-away labels.

Men's Sizes (Width across front): S=18", M=20", L=22", XL=24", 2XL=26”, 3XL=28”

Women's shirts are 100% ring-spun cotton, charcoal color, 4.5oz fabric, side-seamed for curvaceousness and have tear-away labels.

Women's Sizes (Width across front): XS=16", S=16.5", M=17.5", L=18.5", XL=19.5", 2X=20.5"

Art is subject to minor change, color may very by monitor, image shown is an example.

*graph not accurate at all but pretty to look at

ALL $15+ REWARD LEVELS NOW ALSO INCLUDE A FREE HANJI MINI-PRINT!

ALL $15-$25 REWARD LEVELS NOW INCLUDE A FREE MARCO MINI-PRINT

ALL $35+ REWARD LEVELS NOW INCLUDE A FREE 11"x17" MARCO POSTER

All shipping prices are listed under reward details and are required to be added in order for us to ship your reward to you (yes, even to the US), this may also be done after the project ends via paypal. 

We will be sending out emails after the project ends for your shirt/print choice(s) and sizing! We are adding designs and the likes as we go so we want to make sure everyone has a chance at everything available~!

These are the choices for 11X17" posters and postcard size prints. These are also the potential designs for additional shirt prints, designs made into a shirt will be altered for screen printing.




UNLOCKED: If our first stretch goal of $1500 is met we will invest the extra funds in printing all Levi shirts on the front AND back (with the back version)! This will help you to be extra boss as you walk out on bitches.

UNLOCKED: If our second stretch goal of $2200 is met we will have a vote on the designs and the winner will be made available on mens and womens shirts for everyone! All shirt rewards will have 1 more shirt design option

UNLOCKED: At our third stretch goal of $3000 we will print Armin! 

UNLOCKED: At our 4th stretch goal of $4000 we will bring sexy back (to a shirt)! We will hold a vote and the winner gets back printed!

UNLOCKED: If we reach our 5th stretch goal of $4500 I will draw a sassy flower crowned Hanji and include a free Hanji mini-print in all $15 and higher reward levels! 

UNLOCKED: Our 6th stretch at $5000 unlocks Marco Bodt art! All $15-$25 rewards get a Marco mini-print included free, $35+ reward levels will get a full size 11X17" Marco poster~!

UNLOCKED: Our 7th stretch is at $6000, if we hit this stretch goal we will print Erwin smith shirts!

UNLOCKED: Goal 8 is at $6500, if we hit this goal everyone with a $15+ reward gets a free SNK button!

UNLOCKED: Our 9th goal at $7000 gets Hanji Zoe printed and available on a shirt!

UNLOCKED: 10th goal of $7,500, Ven Tsun Cosplay (MindxCrash on Tumblr) will do a sexy Levi video or photoshoot featuring our shirt designs! 

UNLOCKED: HOLY CRAP! Our 11th stretch goal! Jean's back get's printed!

Lets see if we can get one more! 12th stretch goal! Bonus sassy mini-print art!

We know that not everyone has the muny-bucks and we're cool with that, why not help a home-fry out by hollering at your followers or watchers or whatever to check us out? 

Q: How do I chose the shirt/design/size I want?

A: We will be sending out an email to everyone who has pledged asking for their choices after the project ends (June 1st) in order to give everyone a shot at all designs added along the way.

Q: I live in the US do I have to pay the shipping?

A: Yes. The shipping is a flat fee for everyone, everywhere to make things fair and easy.

Q: I forgot to add shipping, what should I do?

A: We are sending out emails after the project ends for details and to collect unpaid shipping fees through paypal, please wait for email instruction.

Q: If I go with a 2 or 3 shirt option can I chose any design combo or do they all have to be the same?

A: You can pick any combination of our available designs in different sizes and cuts or all the same, we're not holding you back!

Q: I already pledged but I want to up my contribution for a higher reward level how can I do that?

A: Send us a message letting us know so that we can keep track and then pledge a 2nd contribution (unfortunately you can not alter past contributions) with the DIFFERENCE between what you already paid and the reward you would like to upgrade to including any difference in shipping as well. 

Example: I pledged $28 ($20 +$8shipping) for the Survey Corps Soldier reward (1 shirt) but want to upgrade to the Rivaille reward (2 shirts) which is $45 ($35 +$10shipping). I pledge a 2nd contribution of $17 for the difference between the 2 and send a note saying "I have upgraded from my previous reward 'survey corps soldier' to 'rivaille' and have pledged the difference". 

I am now upgraded to the Rivaille reward!

Q: How do I know Indiegogo/this project isn't a scam? What is indiegogo?

A: Indigogo is a great platform for small artists (like myself) and people who want to create things but don't have a bunch of money sitting around (also myself). Basically it allows artists to preemptively sell their products so that they don't end up with a bunch of overstock sitting around and out a ton of money which means you are purchasing the item as a pre-order at a discounted price that helps us to pay for the printing costs! 

We are 100% obligated to make sure you get what you pledge for and you are protected by BOTH indigogo and paypal and/or bank/credit company so there is piece of mind in that. Indigogo is a very reputable website that has been used to back hundreds of thousands of projects by literally millions of people, it has been around for over 6 years!  

The waiting time is because these have to be ordered after the project ends for us to know how many to print of each design we need this time so that we can finalize everything with our printing company and have them print out hundreds of shirts, then we have to wait on the shipment to come in from the USA (where they are being screen printed), then they all have to be carefully counted, sorted and packaged and have time to arrive! 

We assure you we will be updating on tumblr along the way as we have been so far with pictures of the shirts and the likes so there won't be any black outs in communication, you can also feel free to contact myself or my partner at any time for more information or details!  Also, as for our personal reputability you can check out our previous project on kickstarter (which is essentially the same as indigogo) which was successfully backed and not a single complaint of anyone not recieving their rewards, also we have 2 shops here and here which we run that maintain excellent 5 star reviews :)
story_txt:
IdentityProductions is run by IdentityPollution and IdentityFox. We're P cool, we make geeky shit and sell things online, also I draw things. This is our first shirt printing run and that shit is expensive, we need to make sure you bitches are ready to put a ring on it. Levi AND Jean (thanks to our sponsor Jjagerbombastic) AND Mikasa AND Armin AND Ewin AND Hanji are getting made into sweet-ass swag. We want to be all inclusive and shit so we're bringing you this swag in mens AND womens cuts and in XS-2X for women and SM-3X for men. Don't tell me that shit don't fit you.Levi and Armin are printed on the front AND back! Stretch goals could allow for others to be back printed as well!Men's shirts are 100% cotton, charcoal color, 5.1oz fabric, pre-shrunk, NAFTA compliant and have tear-away labels.Men's Sizes (Width across front): S=18", M=20", L=22", XL=24", 2XL=26”, 3XL=28”Women's shirts are 100% ring-spun cotton, charcoal color, 4.5oz fabric, side-seamed for curvaceousness and have tear-away labels.Women's Sizes (Width across front): XS=16", S=16.5", M=17.5", L=18.5", XL=19.5", 2X=20.5"Art is subject to minor change, color may very by monitor, image shown is an example.*graph not accurate at all but pretty to look atALL $15+ REWARD LEVELS NOW ALSO INCLUDE A FREE HANJI MINI-PRINT!ALL $15-$25 REWARD LEVELS NOW INCLUDE A FREE MARCO MINI-PRINTALL $35+ REWARD LEVELS NOW INCLUDE A FREE 11"x17" MARCO POSTERAll shipping prices are listed under reward details and are required to be added in order for us to ship your reward to you (yes, even to the US), this may also be done after the project ends via paypal. We will be sending out emails after the project ends for your shirt/print choice(s) and sizing! We are adding designs and the likes as we go so we want to make sure everyone has a chance at everything available~!These are the choices for 11X17" posters and postcard size prints. These are also the potential designs for additional shirt prints, designs made into a shirt will be altered for screen printing.

This will help you to be extra boss as you walk out on bitches.UNLOCKED: If our second stretch goal of $2200 is met we will have a vote on the designs and the winner will be made available on mens and womens shirts for everyone! story:
Blind Beggar Press, Inc.

Since 1977 we have published emerging and established writers and artists fro m throughout the U.S. as well as the Caribbean, Europe and Africa. We are a non-profit corporation registered with New York State Charities (50517) and a 501(c)3 registered with the federal government (EIN 13-3054182). Contributions are tax-deductible.

Our board of directors and staff are all volunteers; we have no paid staff or board. We often hire artists and other professionals at fair market value fees for certain services and provide the artists we publish with complementary copies of our publications. In addition  to publishing, we offer free advice and  workshops for writers.

Over the 37 years of our existence, any profits we have made from book sales and events goes towards continuing our mission of publishing and supporting writers and artists. In the past we have been supported by Bronx Council on the Arts, JP Morgan Chase Bank, Chemical  Bank, the Edler G. Hawkins Foundation and private contributions. Due to the current economic slow down, we have lost what little funding we may have had and need funds BADLY to continue to pursue our mssion.


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking a minimum of $5000 to enable us to publish more writers and provide resources for writers and artists. Funds we receive will go only toward these activities and, again, no individual associated  with the company will gain financially from the funds raised.

For those who contribute at least $25.00, we will send them a copy of our 112-page 35th anniversary journal which contains poetry by 30 well-established writers along with photos and archival material covering the first 35 years of our existence. A contribution of $100 or more will receive the anthology along with four additional publications from our inventory.

Whether or not we reach our goal of $5000, whatever we receive will go toward publishing and programming.

The Impact

Of the many alternative presses which began in the 1970s, we are one of only a very few which have survived. We serve  a wide range of constituents, especially those which are underserved, e.g. African American, Latino, Asian, Native American, immigrants, the disabled, seniors and the incarcerated. To date we have published over 300 writers and artists of all ethnicities. Your contribution will enable us to continue to serve these communities. We are committed to literature and art and we want to continue  providing an outlet for artists of all kinds, Over the years we have proven that our services make a difference in our communities.

Risks & Challenges

The main obstacle we have encountered over the years is getting the word out about our publications and services. We can't afford paid advertising so we depend upon word of mouth and an occasional article or mention in the media. However, we have somehow managed to  spread the word nation-wide and, as a result have published people from states all across the country. Somehow we have been able to get the word out anyway through dogged perseverance and we constantly pursue additional opportunities to spread the word.

Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome contributions of any size because "every little bit helps." Whether you're able to give only a little or a lot, we ask that you spread the word and encourage others to check us out. Our website, www.blindbeggarpress.org, is under reconstruction, but it will give a detailed background with listing of our publications and other vital information. PLEASE HELP US CONTINUE OUR WORK!

story:
Hey there!

My name is Shannon, I'm a California native artist currently based in Baltimore, where I am working toward my MFA in Photographic and Electronic Media at the Maryland Institute College of Art. During my time in graduate school, I have been working on a series called Between Us, which will be exhibited for the first time in April 2015. You can get a sneak peak of the series here. The intention of this campaign is to pre-sell some of my work at-cost in order to cover some of the expenses for the exhibition. 

A Little About My Work..
I use the image-making process as a way of navigating the emotional landscape of love and separation. As a young person and seasoned traveler, I have grown accustomed to the process of close, intimate bonds coming and going at a rapid pace. Through making these photographs, I have been exploring transition and transformation, both between people and within a physical space. 

Here's What I'm Asking...

For the exhibition, I am making Chromira prints (C-Prints). This is a wet, true-photographic process. I will be mounting the prints to 3mm DiBond with metal float frames, and sealing the them with laminate for extra protection. The prices in the "perks" section are subsidized and include the cost of shipping. 

  • Cost of Chromira prints mounted to 3mm DiBond with Protective Laminate and Metal Float Frame (for the entire exhibition): $2723 - I've mapped out the expenses in the chart bellow 

What You Can Get: 

  • Artwork At-Cost: I'm selling all of my exhibition prints at cost - the price of the perks reflect the cost of printing, framing, mounting, material, tax, packaging, and shipping 
  • Limited Edition Artist Book: I'm excited to offer a limited edition hard cover artist book - which will only be available for the duration of this campaign. The book is a collection of words and photographs from the series - many of which will not be included in the exhibition
  • Pigment Prints: Select any image you want from the series and I will print and sign it for you on baryta - a fibre based paper

story:
Jori A Lacy's Story My name is Jori Lacy, the daughter of Angela Shaw. I was 10 years old when my mom transition to heaven.  She was diagnosed with Leukemia on September 26, 2012 and I would never forget that day she received the word on my birthday from her physician.

Jori Lacy (2002 #throwback)

It was the most shocking news to receive that my mother was ill, yet I did not quite understand her illness. My mother was looking just amazing, and then I was told that my birthday party had to be delayed. At the moment, I realized something was wrong. Within 3 months of finding out that my mom had cancer, she perished. As time passes by, I do believe my mother was chosen by our Heavenly Father.  "He who has ears to hear, let him hear." Matthew 11:15.  I am so blessed to have realized my faith in Christ at an early age, being taught by my mom to look to Christ for my salvation and to Him alone. New Faith Baptist church in Matteson, IL is where I attend worship service.

I am also the CEO of Soar Couture founded by my mother. I PRAY is our on-line retail store, a division of Soar Couture Limited distinctly and divinely designed to offer you fashion and faith...in perfect harmony. We are committed to "elevate the spirit" and commission to spread the Gospel of our Lord and King, Jesus Christ through our dynamic fashion collection and gift accessories. My father (Otha Lacy) whom I love dearly, have given me the insight to stay focus with my deepest admiration. He teaches me not to just start something, but to finish it too. My mom started this business and I am going to try my best to keep her business up and running.

When I was a little girl, around six I had my own plan to start a business too. It was me, my granny, my auntie, and my mom. My mom was explaining her business to my aunt and granny when I interrupted and said “Hey, I have a business too.” My mom thinks I’m just saying whatever, but my aunt said “Hold on. I think she’s on to something here."

So I explain my business plan. I told them that I was going to sell batteries. I would buy them from the dollar store for $1 and resell them for a higher price. My aunt asked “Why batteries?" And I said, "because little kids need batteries for their toys.” My aunt, interested in my plan asked, Who is going to work for you though? Well, my mommy is going to have a baby and when my little sister grows up she’s going to work for me. My mom replied, with a smile “that’s my baby. I am so proud of you.” So that was my little plan. I had it all figured out. But now I want to invest in other things. I would like to carry on my mom’s dream but would also like to be a lawyer or a writer. (Read more) http://www.iprayjc.com/About-Us

A Special Invitation! Expocomer 2015 Panama City, Panama

I am so grateful to have received an invitation from Mrs. Melida Harris-Barrow, the Universal Peace Ambassador of Panama (CERCLE) and President & Chief Executive Officer of Panama World Trade & Investment Foundation (PWTIF) to showcase my mom's artwork and gift collections.  The event will be held at the Expocomer in Panama City, Panama on March 11-15, 2015. 

We've a January 16th deadline to make final travel arrangements.  However, we need additional funds to attend the event.  Your contribution can make this happen!  

­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­Soar Couture Needs Your Help! 

Check out the perks and gallery page of my mom’s artwork.  Or visit our website www.iprayjc.com to purchase any products which the proceeds would help me continue my mother's legacy and promote Soar Couture internationally, the vision my mom had for the company.

Get the Word Out!

Thank you for your contribution to help me continue my mother, Angela Shaw's legacy! Please share your comments or email iprayjc@gmail.com.

~ Jori Lacy, CEO Soar Couture

 "His mercy goes on from generation to generation, to all who fear him." Luke 1:50NLT

story:
WHAT IS HAPPENING?

I am overjoyed to announce that I’ve decided to pursue my artistic career full-time! I've already begun working towards opening a shared art gallery and studio space to help showcase painting, photography, and mixed-media creations produced by myself and others.  

Through this endeavor we will uncover new experiences and inspiration, along with collaborative opportunities with and for other local artists. 
 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need to hit the ground running and secure a space to house our wonderful work.

  • We need funds to secure an amazing yet cost effective space (security deposits, insurance premiums, etc.) not to mention the supplies that artists will use for both storage and showcasing their work - printers, frames, shelving, lighting, etc. 

You have the chance to support local artists and to make a positive change in our community.

  • AFFORDABLE art for you
  • CUSTOM art just for you
  • Make AFFORDABLE and CUSTOM art more available to EVERYONE

 

YOUR IMPACT

Through your support, we'll be able to make artwork more readily available to everyone. Boutiques and big-box stores are selling highly duplicated and unoriginal paintings all over the world.  People are starting to see the artwork in their homes at their friend's and neighbor's. We want to change this. 

Via collaboration and broader opportunities for all artists, rather than a handful of selected few, we'd like to provide a venue for people to see and purchase REAL ART for themselves. No more guessing online and seeing a print that 10,000 people have already purchased. You'll be able to pick and choose what works for you and your space in a hands-on environment.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share this campaign!  Go find art fairs and shows in your city and neighborhood! Develop your skills and teach others to see something new and wonderful!

 

Come find me!

www.chavamancera.com

Instagram: chava_mancera

Make AFFORDABLE and CUSTOM art more available to EVERYONE


 
YOUR IMPACT
Through your support, we'll be able to make artwork more readily available to everyone. Boutiques and big-box stores are selling highly duplicated and unoriginal paintings all over the world.  People are starting to see the artwork in their homes at their friend's and neighbor's. We want to change this. 
Via collaboration and broader opportunities for all artists, rather than a handful of selected few, we'd like to provide a venue for people to see and purchase REAL ART for themselves. No more guessing online and seeing a print that 10,000 people have already purchased. You'll be able to pick and choose what works for you and your space in a hands-on environment.
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Share this campaign!  Go find art fairs and shows in your city and neighborhood! Develop your skills and teach others to see something new and wonderful!
 
Come find me!
www.chavamancera.com
Instagram: chava_mancera

story:
<<english below>>

A Bigger Splash : C’est quoi ?

C’est une exposition collective qui réunit des artistes internationaux autour du thème de l’eau.

A Bigger Splash a le projet de mettre en relation différents univers artistiques pour nous plonger au coeur de cet élément et pour donner l’occasion de porter un nouveau regard sur cet élément pourtant omniprésent. 

Qui sommes-nous ? 

Nous sommes 5 étudiantes en Arts et Management culturel à IESA (Institut d’études supérieures des arts) à Paris. 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez 

Artistes comme commissaires d’expositions se sont réunis pour donner vie à cette exposition. 

Nous vous invitons à prendre part au projet en faisant une petite, mais précieuse contribution pour la réalisation de cette exposition.

Cliquez sur « Back it » et choisissez de faire une participation simple ou bien sélectionnez un t-shirt ou un tote bag en remerciement de votre don. 

Vous pourrez les récupérer lors du vernissage ou tout au long de la semaine d’exposition.

<<English>>

What is A Bigger Splash?

A Bigger Splash is a group exhibition that gathers together works surrounding
the subject of water. We will be showcasing an assemblage of international artists whose practices dive deep into this element.

Who are we?

We are bringing this exhibition to you as five international Students at IESA (Institut d’études supérieurs des arts) based in Paris, majoring in Art and Cultural Management.

What We Need & What You Get

Both the artists and curators within this project are unified in giving life to this exhibition.
We invite you to take part in the realisation of our exhibition by supporting the arts in a small but precious way. 
As part of your donation we offer you products for purchase, all revenues of sales and donations will be put to use for the production of the project and nothing else. 
Your items will be available for pick up at our vernissage and throughout the duration of the exhibition. 

Follow us

You can follow us on:
Facebook 

Instagram

Website

For any inquirers, please feel free to contact us at abiggersplash2018@gmail.com.

story:
MPT: Focus on Dead Women Poets

Help us publish a special issue of Modern Poetry in Translation, produced in partnership with Dead [Women] Poets Society.

By necessity, we have to raise money for every edition of Modern Poetry in Translation  we produce – usually partnering with embassies or cultural foundations.

For a focus such as this, which aims to transgress boundaries of space and time, our usual international funding sources are unavailable.

We're asking our friends and supporters to help us bring this issue to life!

If you want to contribute to this issue, you can submit your work on the Modern Poetry in Translation website.

We're raising money so we can:

  • Publish this special issue and pay contributors and the guest editors properly
  • Produce an A5 postcard to commemorate the issue
  • Host an online séance to launch the issue in style

 

Illustration: Lily Arnold

 

Who are the Dead Women Poets? 

           slovenly needlewomen, (all
           our sewing came apart), dancers,
           players upon pipes: we have been 
           the queens of the whole world!

          - Marina Tsvetaeva, 'We Shall Not Escape Hell' (tr. Elaine Feinstein)

Who are the Dead Women Poets? How dead are they? And what is our relationship to them, as contemporary women, poets, artists, ‘queens of the whole world’?

Since 2015, Dead [Women] Poets Society has been resurrecting women and non-binary poets of the past. In live events (which they call séances) and online, they highlight women's astonishing but too-often forgotten literary heritage, and open up conversation between living writers and their great-great-grandmothers. Poets such as Astra Papachristodoulou, Warda Yassin, Rachel Long and Caroline Bird have communed with Mina Loy, Lucille Clifton, Audre Lorde, Anna Wickham and more, reading their poems to a candle-lit audience and reflecting on how their chosen Dead Women Poets have influenced them. 

Many of the D[W]PS guest poets have heard the call of Dead Women Poets of other languages - from Nadia Anjuman to Gisèle Prassinos - and translation has always been integral to the D[W]PS mission, After all, isn't translation a kind of resurrection? And isn't the role of the medium to communicate with the living what the dead still have to say? Having paused their Arts Council England funded tour, the D[W]PS team can't wait to guest-edit this issue of MPT and bring women and non-binary poets from all corners of the world back to life in its pages.

 

Not enough women poets get translated

Modern Poetry in Translation also realises the importance of interrogating the canon, and asking who gets to be translated and why. 

The lack of women poets in translated anthologies is often even more glaring than in English-language ones. So we are very excited indeed to be working on a special autumnal issue in which Helen Bowell and Jasmine Simms of the D[W]PS team will guest-edit the focus, bringing to your attention astonishing female poets from around the world. MPT has to fundraise towards every issue and for all events, something harder than ever in the current climate, and are committed to fairly pay all artists and contributors involved. 

For a themed focus such as this our usual international funding sources are unavailable, and we are reaching out to the community to support us in producing what we think will be an important issue, along with a Halloween launch. (Also, there are cool bags).

We encourage those of all genders and none to #JoinTheSéance.

 

Risks & Challenges

Production-related risks are very low. Modern Poetry in Translation (MPT) will be overseeing this project, with a 50+ year publishing history.

Any potential delays would likely be related to the supply chain and/or warehousing as a result of Covid 19. We have spent the last few months working through this, so a major change to our schedule is very unlikely.

Of course, resurrection, like translation, carries a degree of existential risk. We will work with experts in both fields as we bring this issue carefully to life.

We will not disturb the spirits or their estates or copyright holders.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our campaign!

Or you can support the project by taking out a regular subscription to Modern Poetry in Translation. Postage is free in the UK, and subscriptions start from just £23 for three issues, annually.

story:
Latest Jewelry Additions!

Get these amazing new sparkly fused glass pendants by Elfriede. Just select which ever style you like, then contact us and let us know which ones you want upon payment. Thanks!

Ear Studs - $20.
Dangle Earrings - $30
Pendants - $30




Our Stretch Goal:

At the basic level, we are shooting for raising $3500 for equipment we can use right now the most. This will get us the equipment, tools, and materials to raise our bar to the next level. Our stretch goal however is set at $10,000, which will help us buy more torches, another even larger kiln, and the tools and materials that will launch us into glass-working epicness. Photography equipment such as a professional camera and lighting kit will help us big time to make sure every piece of art and lighting gets represented in the most professional way possible. Also, the extra funds will allow us to create more spec glass lighting units (Chandeliers, sconces, hanging pendant lights) that we can use for showing to galleries, interior designer/decorators, and private clients as examples of our work. 

This is ultimately where we want to arrive, and appreciate your generosity in helping us achieve this.

Short Summary

Aloha! We are Elfriede and Tim Friesen. We live on the Big Island of Hawaii and we make beautiful Glass Art. Inspired by the work we made for galleries and custom clients, we are asked to make high end art such as glass lighting. Our studio is basic and requires a tune up: a new torch, bigger kiln and an oxygen generator. We are used to do it all by ourselves, but in this case we need to ask for your help. In return we will make all that you want. If you give, we’ll give!
With the holiday season coming soon, we are sure you and your loved ones will be excited to see those packages with glass art from Hawaii coming in.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for the minimum of what we figure we will need to help for this upgrade. So rest assured that every dollar you spend will go DIRECTLY to helping make this happen. If  we should exceed our goal, all the better: our stretch goal will allow us to REALLY get going, with more fancy tools and an assortment of glass we can build our DREAM STUDIO.

In return for your help we'll have everything from a Personal Postcard from us here in Hawaii written and sent to YOU! Single fused pendants by Elfriede and single flame-worked pendants by Tim. We also are offering these Hawaiian Style fused glass and flame-worked pendants in sets so you can have plenty for your personal wearing, or gift giving to others!   And for those who want the finest in hand blown Hawaiian Holiday Tree Ornaments, they are ready to adorn your tree.

BELOW are the items that are offered in "Perks" on the right side. Check them out to see what you will be getting when you purchase! The fused glass pendants, flame-worked pendants and ornaments are all available as single items as well as package sets. 


Elfriede's Finest Hawaiian Style Fused Glass Pendants. Available separately or as a package set (Pictured Below):


Tim's Fantastic Hawaiian Style Flame-Worked Marine Life Pendants. Available separately or as a package set (Pictured Below):



Tim's Glimmering Glass Ornaments. Available separately or as a package set (Pictured Below):



The Impact

The impact of your contribution of even a few dollars would be monumental to us. Our talents and experience of over 40 years are so ready to take it to the next level. With the right equipment we can fly, we can fulfill the requests of galleries, interior decorators/designers and private clients, and propel our art careers to unlimited levels!

Other Ways You Can Help

Believe us. If you are unable to contribute monetarily, we understand. But if you are a fan of what we are trying to accomplish, use the Indiegogo SHARE tools or pass this link along to help out. We sincerely thank all of you for taking the time to hear us out. ALOHA, may you be eternally blessed.

*Want to donate an alternate amount without receiving any perks? Click "contribute," and at the bottom of the perk options there will be a button to contribute the exact amount you wish!

story:
Welcome to the fundraising pledge for my forthcoming solo exhibition curated by the Estemporaneo Collective and hosted by the non-profit organization Casello 13 in the premises of the Copertino railway station (Opening on 2 August 2014).

The exhibition is meant to be an independent opportunity to share my latest works with a wider audience in my hometown. The project has been made possible thanks to the hard work and dedication of the Estemporaneo Team, a group of friends with a passion for art as a democratic form of expression and fruition. 

What We Need & What You Get

As part of our fundraising efforts, we are asking for pledges in order to fund the whole organization of what will be our first show.

The money will go towards framing of the work to the highest professional standards; printing, shipping and postage costs; exhibition space installation and equipment; online and print publicity. 

Works From The Series In The Exhibition

The Impact

The impact of your patronage will  allow you to participate, own paintings and other rewards. By donating, or even sharing our pitch you will be helping to further the exposure of the exhibition and contribute to future art initiatives.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are unable to donate please share our campaign and come to the exhibition!

story:
...this will not be your everyday travel guide, cookbook, or novel. More like an elaborately illustrated journal of the lesser-known side of a tropical ecosystem called "The Florida Keys". This archipelago has a popular and well-documented history, but my intention is to give a visual voice to the uncelebrated, unappreciated, unseen inhabitants of this so-called "paradise".

   My name is Ashley, Floridian artist, Nature lover, bohemian crafter.  I am doing a series of paintings depicting the beautiful(some endangered) fauna and flora of the Keys, which shall be used in the upcoming "Book of Keys".  This "book" will be filled with delectable recipes using local ingredients, healing remedies using native herbs, tales of the downtrodden, and embellished with FULL-PAGE WATERCOLOR PAINTINGS!

    Please help bring the magickal, mystical "Book of Keys" to fruition! In addition to offering  artwork in gratitude for your patronage, some pieces will be donated to help raise funds for organizations such as the Florida Keys Wild Bird Center, the Sea Turtle Hospital, the Dolphin Research Center, etc..  My underlying and ever-present desire is to help raise awareness of both the beauty and the plight of our many endangered(and threatened) species through art.

     A significant portion of funds raised will be devoted to art supplies and processing(papers, paints, brushes, printing, packaging, shipping, etc.), while some of the funds will help with basic travel and living expenses incurred throughout this endeavor. Your support would aid in the creation of the fine art which will enliven the pages of a fabulous, informative book! (All of my patrons will have sneak peeks and first dibs on it, as well!)

                                                                                                                                                                                                      I offer my heartfelt gratitude for ALL of your kind support(monetary, spiritual, or otherwise)!

                                                                                    NAMASTE

story:
I am back in Berlin as a grant recipient for TAKT Residency and Tapir Gallery crafting a performance work approached from a Jungian psychology perspective. It is wonderful to have the opportunity to return here to work, however, I am short on funds for needed materials. I would be so appreciative of any outside funding that came along in order to complete my project and fulfill my grant. Please read the project description below and if you feel inspired or curious then follow the link to donate. Thank you!

This work will be created on site, however, not site specific. I will change the structure of the room to have the distant wall more narrow than the opposing wall to give a greater sense of depth and the discomfort of walls closing in. The room should be entirely white. I will aim two projectors to converge at the same point. While I stand in the light of one projector my shadow will cast and text will be legible streaming from the second projector. The text will be about the relationship  between me and my shadow. The voice consistent with one person recounting conversations and actions with the other. Similar to a diary talking about a best friend. As I move around the room different text will appear and the distance from me to the projector will determine how much the viewer can read at a time. Movement will play a primary role in the work although I do not anticipate this as dance driven in a conventional way. I will instead craft phrase work by use of text and tactile references from memory. I will also use Jung’s ideas of forward and  backward movement in relation to consciousness to create choreography. The sound will be speech, however, it will not match the text. The speech will be two voices, the psychologist and myself, in a Jungian therapy session. In the end, I reach the point where the projector lights converge, the text disappears, and I realize the shadow/shadow self is me. That these two personalities coexist within my body. 

In between performances the work will be interactive with the sound on loop allowing the viewers to experience their shadow selves, their darkness.

Although I will be creating all elements myself, research is being done with a Jungian analyst from the C.G. Jung Foundation for Analytical Psychology in New York to ensure accuracy and respect the theories.

You can check out past work at erikabb.com

The sound will be speech, however, it will not match the text. The speech will be two voices, the psychologist and myself, in a Jungian therapy session. In the end, I reach the point where the projector lights converge, the text disappears, and I realize the shadow/shadow self is me. That these two personalities coexist within my body. 

In between performances the work will be interactive with the sound on loop allowing the viewers to experience their shadow selves, their darkness.

Although I will be creating all elements myself, research is being done with a Jungian analyst from the C.G. Jung Foundation for Analytical Psychology in New York to ensure accuracy and respect the theories.You can check out past work at erikabb.com

story:
Help me get to Paris

This December, the 21st United Nations conference on climate change (COP21) in Paris aims to achieve major global agreements in addressing the single biggest threat to human and environmental health. At the same time ArtCOP21, a city-wide series of arts events, installations, performances, workshops, and actions, will inspire the cultural shifts necessary to support real climate change action.

Paris represents a flashpoint moment for how we think, act, and cooperate on climate change. Action is URGENT.  We can no longer afford to pretend climate change isn't happening or imagine it away. What we CAN do is imagine new solutions and create meaningful actions to shift it! 

I want to be part of that imagining and action! Please help to get me get to ArtCOP21, where I'll meet and interact with international artists, scientists, and policymakers and participate in real-time arts activism. I'll come home with new ideas and plans for how we can work together here in the United States to address climate change in artistic, meaningful, and effective ways. As an official Cultural Ambassador, I will blog and post about my experiences on social media and share my experiences in a public talk upon my return.

I'll be hosted in Paris (for part of my stay) by homegrown Tucson artist, writer Shannon Cain, now representing the U.S. with a resident artist’s visa in Paris. Your perks for funding me include hand-made artwork (visit www.KimiEiseleArtwork.com to view some of it) and knowing you're playing a role in addressing climate change, beyond what you already do.

    The impact

    As our region grows ever hotter and drier, we will need more creative solutions, creative thinkers, and community involvement. I've invested in training to learn how to work more effectively with civic partners to use arts-based practices to address critical issues. I will incorporate what I learn in Paris to create new works at home to help us respond to, mitigate, and adapt to existing (and fast-coming) environmental changes in Southern Arizona. I'm in conversation with Diana Liverman (geographer, climate change response expert, and my former graduate thesis adviser) who will attend the UN talks, and Julie's Bicycle (a cool nonprofit that helps creative industries measure, manage and reduce their environmental impacts) about attending COP21 sessions and assisting with ArtCOP21 events.

    Other ways you can help

    If you are unable to contribute to my campaign, please SHARE it with others who can. Also, please do YOUR part to address climate change. Advocate for clean energy technologies and legislation capping C02 emissions. Sign petitions and support activists. Support small-scale local agriculture. Tell your office manager to turn down the air conditioning. Tune up your bicycle and ride it more.

    About me

    I’m a Tucson-based multidisciplinary artist working in dance, literary, and visual arts. I am the recipient of the 2014 Established Artist “Lumie” Award from the Tucson Pima Arts Council and a 2012 Artist Project Award from the Arizona Commission on the Arts. My work addresses human-enviroment themes through movement, story, and image. www.KimiEisele.com

    Thank you so much!

    Any questions? Please email me at kimieisele@gmail.com

    Here's a sampling of some of my visual artwork. See more at: www.KimiEiseleArtwork.com

story:
The Ebola crisis in Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone persists. Donate to help and receive uniquely created pieces of art for your contribution.

HURRY! ONLY 300 DOMINOES AVAILABLE! Once all these dominoes are given as perks, only monetary donations will be accepted.

The Ebola Domino Project is a creative humanitarian experiment originating at Pacific University near Portland, Oregon that converts the talents of visual artists into donor dollars. Briefly, artists create dominoes, we collect and display them in an interactive exhibit, and then give them as perks for donations that will go to AmeriCares, an aid organization working in Ebola-stricken west Africa. At the core of the project is the hope of providing some measure of relief for the families and communities of west Africa still suffering from Ebola's long-lasting physical and socioeconomic impact. Here's how the project works:

Dominoes: Domino forms were chosen because, as they are lined up together, they illustrate the potential chain reaction that can occur as disease is spread or health care is provided. Each 5-inch wood domino has two sides, representing both the negative spread of the disease and the hopeful eradication or cure. Over 150 professional and amateur artists from across the country have participated, including artists from California, Oregon, Washington, Colorado, Montana, Illinois, New York, Pennsylvania and New Jersey. All have graciously invested their time and energy to learn about Ebola-stricken west Africa, creating these unique dominoes with intention and empathy using a variety of media and styles. As of May 5th, we have 300 dominoes available, and we will choose them for you as perks for your donations. Once all of the dominoes have been claimed, only monetary donations for this project will be accepted!

Exhibition: The collection of dominoes received will be featured in an interactive exhibit on May 13th at Pacific University in Forest Grove, Oregon, where visitors can play with the dominoes, lining them up and cascading them down to represent the tipping point of either disease or health. At the conclusion of the exhibition on May 20th, the dominoes will be mailed to donors.

Donation: Make a donation to aid and rebuild Ebola-stricken west Africa and receive art in return! Donate with a perk, and we choose dominoes to send to you. Or donate without a perk, and then money will go straight to AmeriCares. All domino perks will be mailed out after the exhibition, with the donations sent directly to AmeriCares, with the money specifically earmarked for Ebola aid. And thanks to AmeriCares' matching corporate donors, every $1 donated to them results in $20 of aid to west Africa. For every $25 "purchase" of a domino, we expect to donate around $20, after Indiegogo fees and the cost of mailing the domino to you. So, buy one domino and the resulting $20 donation equals $400 in aid. Our goal is to sell all 300 available dominoes as perks, totaling $6,000 sent to AmeriCares, which would equal an effective matching donation of $120,000!

Impact: Although the epidemic seems to be almost under control, the long-lasting socioeconomic impact of Ebola will be devastating to the affected countries. Beyond the over-burdened regional healthcare systems are thousands of new orphans, broken families, neglected fields, and food shortages. While this project can generate only a fraction of what is needed to help aid in this crisis, it can allow us to reflect on our interdependence as global citizens and responsibility to one another we share as human beings. Visit our website at www.eboladominoproject.org for more information.

Ways to help: Buy a domino! Better yet, buy a set of dominoes! If you can't afford to help in this way, just donate $5 or $10 through this site; remember, that small gift equals a donation of $100 or $200! Or, just share this fundraising page on social media. You can find our website at EbolaDominoProject.org, our Facebook page at The Ebola Domino Project, and on Instagram or Twitter at #eboladominoproject.
