story:
Daughters of Mercury @PSPS

Opening: August 19, 2016 6-8pm
Exhibit: August 20-21, 2016 12-6pm (google) (facebook)

@  Prince St. Project Space 127-B Prince St. New York, NY 10012

Programming administered by: Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art
leslielohman.org


Daughters of Mercury is a series of full-length oil paintings exploring the diversity of presentations, beauty, and personality of trans women and AMAB (assigned male at birth) trans people. Each portrait is driven by how its subject wants to be seen and the collaboration of artist and subject. I am a cis woman who wants to support and advocate for people I love and admire, using the medium I know best.


Sybil Lamb, oil on canvas, 36x48in, June 2015

This is the second fundraiser for this project, and has been ported over from Kickstarter, where you can read more about the past and upcoming models in the updates. The first was enough to fund a cycle of 12 portraits for a 2016 calendar, but I couldn't help but paint more, and have spent beyond the money raised from the first cycle. 18 paintings in the series are done already, which is 6 paintings ready for a 2017 calendar, with 6 models waiting who I can't pay without this funding. I need to cover what I have paid and will pay the new models, cover art supplies ready for the last 6, print the 2017 calendar, and pay exhibition expenses. That's really way more than $3000, but the goal is based on what I know I can raise.

Project and product oriented fundraisers remain the best way I know to sell things like these calendars and prints. This is much more an organized way for you to buy art than it is a way for me to raise money. I hold myself to high ethical standards concerning both fulfillment and treatment of those I work with, especially on this project, and my track record (Teleportraiture, Daughters of Mercury, Blind Reproduction, St. Mark's Bookshop on the Move) shows that.


Casey Plett, oils on canvas, 24x48in.

Trans visibility has been particularly strong in the past few years, and as a visual art project that isolates trans women as a category, this series is part of it. That visibility is not inherently a positive thing. For every trans woman who is made to feel less alone or stuck and see more opportunities for themselves, there are as many violent cissexists and transmisogynists who target people they would not have seen, or who seek to make explicit previously ambiguous discrimination.

As much as it is possible to be not just another cis artist exploiting the trend, I seek to amplify the voices of trans women. Each portrait is accompanied by text by and about the subject, and I promote their work and that of the many more awesome trans women that for some reason or another I don't paint. The majority of this money goes toward paying trans women for modeling and other work, as well as toward living costs fundraisers. I feel it is the obligation of cis people to pay attention and help the many trans women who are struggling, and I hope that by introducing you to so many outstanding trans women you can confront your internalized notions about them and see greater possibilities.

Aisling Fae, September 2015, oils on linen, 30x48in.

Daughters of Mercury views the effort of non-masculine presentation as a form of art in itself. It recognizes the problems of “blending” and “transition” narratives and collaborates with subjects with diverse presentations and backgrounds, with binary and non-binary genders. The subjects have a range of comfort with their appearance, and the live process of painting engages the dynamics of flattery, altering by the subject’s direction. Most of the portraits so far are nudes, or near so, because subject and artist wanted to engage with the historical tropes of the oil portrait medium and its relationship to depictions of female bodies.


Mya, 48x30in, oil on canvas, May 2015


Daughters of Mercury engages with cissexist assumptions about female bodies in representational painting, and advocates for more depiction of trans female bodies in fine art. There is increasingly better representation in art with greater prominence of trans artists, including projects like Trans-pose by Catherine Graffam. This project hopes to continue to avoid unwanted sexualization and transition away from trans female bodies being a novelty while supporting increased respectful representation.


Andromeda, oil on canvas, 36x60in, April 2015


The title of the series is an embrace of mutability, deriving from alchemical concepts of Mercury as the mother of metals and the essence of femaleness and fluidity, rather than a literal reference to mythology or astrology. (The rewards are named after suggested stages in alchemy's Magnum Opus, because mapping schemes are fun.) Minds, bodies, and society can and should change; culture, artifice, and shifting images are truth. Oil painting’s plasticity and friendliness to flesh works as a kind of magic transmutation from metal and organic pigment into a projection of living personality. Daughters of Mercury celebrates the possibilities of better living through chemistry, through medical science and speedy communication, and a more cyborg feminist future.



Serene, oil on canvas, 32x64in, May 2015


More:

pdf portfolio of first cycle+

Daughters of Mercury gallery on my site

Facebook Page

Press:

Huffington Post:
Artist Resolves to Insert Trans Women Into Art History (10/10/14)

We Need More Trans Women Represented in Art History (7/8/15)

Unicorn Booty:
Daughters of Mercury: Challenging Assumptions Through Oil Portraits of Trans Women (6/30/15)

BUST Magazine:
These Gorgeous Oil Paintings Celebrate the Beauty of Trans Women (9/28/15)

story:
Qing Snake– An Immersive Performance ‘Taster’ is an exquisite 60 minutes performance attempting to blend Chinese cultural heritage with physical theatre. 

The project has been consistently developed and put into practice from September 2018 with several confirmed performances between January to September 2019. These are the performance on Folkestone on 28th to 30th of April, Queen Mary University IPP Festival between 11th to 12th of May, and Edinburgh Festival Fringe on 12th to 17th of August. 

This project is adapted from one of the four Chinese prominent folklore Legend of the White Snake, where in the past the lore has been presented in various huge Chinese operas, movies, and TV series. The uniqueness of the show lies on the deep cointegration between the performer and audience where number of audiences could participate inside the show to enhance the experience of audiences while also ensuring the would be no risk for the audience in participating inside the show.

The committee of this project consisted of Master Students of University of Queen Mary, University of Warwick, University of Hull, and two professors of Xiao Bai Art Company, all members of the committee has been working endlessly to ensure the success of the project. 

Besides promoting intangible cultural heritage to the world by our performance, 50% of all the sales income of the merchandises would be donated to Theatre Troupe as one of our main vision as an organization is to give back to the community especially the one that share the same interest with our organization, this donation is targeted specially to empower young children passion in art projects. Theatre Troupe try the best to improve the lives of young people, who experience emotional and social difficulties and mental health problems with art and drama therapy. 

The fund earned from every platform would be used to help us accommodate our necessity needs such as food and place to live in Edinburgh as all of the committees and artist are not based on Edinburgh. While also some funding would be allocated for the initial production of the merchandise.

We are very grateful for any donators out there, and the least we can do is to provide the donators with our limited edition merchandise that is currently under process of designs and soon be produced therefore any sort of help will tremendously help us to produce a cutting edge performance while alsohelp young children on Theatre Troupe!

Please visit us on: qingsnake.online for further info about our exciting project!

Special Thanks To:
Theatre Troupe
Win at the Beginning Art Consult Co.Ltd
Queen Mary University of London
Katherine Borchesnius
Eleanor Jenyns
Manuel Vason
 

Team Member:
Dian Li - Creator
Kennedy Lawrance - Producer
Seda Yi - Producer
Zixin Li - Stage Manager
Tianshu Wang - Project Music Creator
Shaofeng Sun - Sponsor
Chunqi Shi - Project Assistant
Huijun Dong - Project Assistant
Seda Yi - Film Editor
Shan Pu - Project Singer

story:
The "What"

My name is Alex Huninghake. I'm an emerging artist from Louisville, KY.  I graduated this past winter from the University of Louisville with a BFA in printmaking and drawing. (My website here ALEX HUNINGHAKE). I was recently invited to be the artist-in-residence at the Fundación Áce printmaking studio in Buenos Aires, Argentina this August. (Their website here: PROYECTO ACE). In order to be accepted, I proposed a body of work called "Spirit of Man." Here's the concept:
I intend to use visual signs and symbols to address the spiritual nature of modern man. I have become extremely interested in Buddhist meditation, exploring many Buddhist and mystical texts and recently carrying out a self-guided meditation retreat in the woods of Bardstown, KY. I’m interested in how traditional Eastern spiritual ideals have been adapted to 21st-century Western thought. Through my work, I intend to reflect on what the reemergence of these ancient ideas can tell us about the advancement of philosophical and metaphysical understanding. I will be using the classical male figure in dream-like scenes, juxtaposed with various historical and religious imagery. My process will consist of drawing, photography, silkscreen, and woodcutting.

The "Why"

Artist-in-residence programs like this one are invaluable for young artists because they provide meaningful cultural exchange and an opportunity to explore and shape one's art practice in a new environment. At Áce, I'll be creating a special new body of work uniquely inspired by the sights, sounds, and people of Buenos Aires. This would be an exciting beginning to my creative career. It's a chance to make international contacts, work closely alongside artists from all over the world, and build my portfolio.

The "How"

I'm looking to raise $4,000 folks! I can't make this happen without your help!
So... where does your money go? The fee for the residency itself is around $3000 (not including the cost of airfare). This pays for my accommodation, studio space, instruction, (some) transportation, and weekly meals. $4,000 is the absolute minimum I'd have to raise to be able to go. But let's not stop there! Anything above that goal would not go to waste! I'll have to pay for weekend meals and travel, as well as art supplies and a plane ticket  ($1200 or so).  And if I'm lucky, I'll be able to combine my time at the residency with a brief backpacking trip around South America.
I have two months to raise the money. If I'm successful, I'll leave Louisville around August 20th and return sometime in late September or early October. Help me get on that plane!

The "What('s in it for me?)"

For each level of donation, I'll be offering a specific "perk" - a unique gift designed to match the value of your donation by the warmth it brings to your soul (as determined by me). Check 'em out!
A note:
I'll also be raising money by selling prints and accepting donations privately (not through Indiegogo). If you're interested, please email me at alexhuninghake8@gmail.com

THANK YOU!

story:
Art for Trip is a campaign to fund my trip to remote places in Indonesia. 

Who am i?
My name is Eric Wirjanata, i work and live in Jakarta as a visual artist, toys designer, web designer and i spent some of my earnings to visit places. 
•
Why i started this?
I have a plan to visit the Eastern part of Indonesia this October 2015. During my trip i wish to meet with kids and people in hope to find more local wisdom. 
Before this, I've been to several remote villages in Indonesia and found that most of them not only need access to clean water, food, electricity or education but they need knowledge. 

A knowledge that will let them know that they have choices. They have choices to choose their own paths.  They're mostly underprivileged, i'm hoping to be able to fuel their dream to change the world.
And now i have an idea about making arts to support this simple cause. 
•
more.
I was once have a small conversation with a little boy, he told me that he wished that he's a girl.
Why? 
Because as a boy, when i grew up i should be a fisherman. I don't want to be a fisherman, i want to be a singer. 
I told him "You can be a singer actually, even if you're a fisherman" "Just keep learning to sing"
Before we left the village, he sang his heart away. 
During another trip, a boy told me that he wished to know more English words so that he can be an international class guide. Then he spent the evening learning a few more words with great enthusiasm from a Nederland's  lecturer from my trip entourage.
Those are some of the reason why i want to meet more kids, in hope to inspire them and hopefully gave more fuels to their aspirations.

•

Why making avatars?

The avatars series that i'm currently building are designed using a very simple but bold line. They all coming from the same template with just a few tweaks. A few small strokes will add identity and showing who they are, and if you read the story of each avatars you'll find that every person have their own stories. Some paths are crossed some are just unique. 

It's time for us to help fuel the kids in remote area to own their own stories too.

•
What will you get if you help?
The perks. And be part of an art project with stories to tell. 
•
Do you really can draw?
please check http://www.thespacewanderer.com/artfortrip/#sthash.GlgOlyn4.dpbs
for avatars samples.


Monica Harvriza
A doctor that currently assigned to a remote part in Nusa Tenggara Timur. Always looks happy while serving the community for a healthier living. Widhiari Murti
An avid traveller, been wandering for many years to many places.
One of the brightest girl i've met. Ryan Silvan
A serial entrepreneur with brain that swarmed with wild ideas. David The Killer
He's a killer.
A killer with an AJ1. Paulus Hyu
An enthusiastic coffee lovers, toys collector, succulent grower and one of the most sought after photographer in town.
His daughter is one of the cutest little girl in instagram. His wife run a pastry company. Joshua Artono
One of the most awesome person i've ever know. He's multitalented and blessed to lead masses as a Pastor. A warm hearted husband and father.
Did i mentioned that he's also one of the owner of Plastic Culture?

story:
Hello!

My name is Chris Meier and I am a Midwest Maker. I study graphic design at the Kansas City Art Institute and on the side I like to print using printmaking/screen printing techniques. I like to think that in the future I will be able to work for myself and run my own professional printing operation using the principles of graphic design and techniques of printmaking. 
And this is the big first step. 

So What's the Plan?

To keep it short and sweet, we want create a small print workspace complete with a four color press for shirts, a poster printing station for paper prints,  an exposure unit/light table for exposing screens and making designs, as well as a dark room for storage of screens and coating screens.
We want to put this all in my apartment and turn the space into something productive and useful. Efficient and personal. New and Exciting.
A partner of mine DJ Morris will be aiding me in building and printing as well. He knows the in's and out's of construction, making things work, and properly, efficiently, and safely building everything.

What We Print

We print a lot of different things, and we would be using the space and equipment to print even more! Shirts, blocks, posters, anything we can we will try to print when we get this new equipment!

Below is some stuff we used to print when our press was up and running.

   

  

 


Here are some refined prints that are more recent.

   


Experimentation

We really want this space so that we can experiment with print techniques! Shirts, posters, postcards, etc. We have a lot of ideas cooking in the oven and can't wait to start trying to print on different fabrics, papers, surfaces, etc. 

Establishing a Brand

We also want to establish a brand and grow. We would want to print Midwest themed clothes, fun iconic imagery, catchy slogans and sayings, typographic compositions, and establish some Midwest pride and continue to make this area proud! The Midwest is the next big place to be and right now it is the best kept secret. 

What We Have

We already have the four color press actually! So check that one off the list. BUT it does need some repairs for it has taken some damage over the years and we need to tune it up a little.
We also already have some screens, inks, squeegees, and the other basic printmaking equipment. As well as tools for building everything, but we can always use more.


(this is our current press)

What We Need

Recently I was awarded 400 dollars from a grant from KCAI. This 400 is a really good starting point for us. But it is going to cost more than that, especially if we want to do it the right way! 

We are asking for another 600 dollars so we can make sure we have enough money for professional equipment for our exposure unit and dark room, as well as all the other little things like materials that tend to add up in the long run.

Some other things that would be helpful for us and are factored in the 600

  • more screens - the more the merrier. (100)
  • power washer - for washing screens and cleaning screens. (75)
  • paper/shirts - what's the point of having a print space if we don't have anything to print on?! (tbd)
  • inks (50)
  • lights - you can't expose screens without any lights (100)
  • lumber - we are going to need a good amount to build everything (100)
  • shop vacuum (50)
  • general supplies - tape, rags, spatulas, spreaders, spray bottles, (75)
  • emulsion (50)
  • emulsion remover (50)
poster press we want to build (below)

exposure unit (below)


Why Should YOU Care?

Currently I live in Kansas City, and the special thing about KC (the midwest in general) is that it runs off the blood, sweat, and tears of hard working makers. There is a huge community of artists and makers that believe in a better future. People here are eco-friendly, helpful, generous, humble, hardworking, crazy creative, and pride themselves on that. KC is getting bigger and better and more creative every year.

This would be a space for other artists and creatives to use if they need some quick printing or help exposing a screen or printing anything. We will have the stuff you need to print what you want.

So if you're an artist who knows the struggle of working extra hard just for the small reward then you can relate to this challenge and huge responsibility of supporting local artists everywhere.
If you live in KC hopefully you understand what we are all about and helping out the maker community and wanting to make this city and the Midwest a better place and different from everywhere else.
And if you have ever wanted something and knew that you were just going to have to give it everything you got and make it for yourself, then you can relate as well.

Risks & Challenges

Our main risks and challenges are making sure we have enough funding. Everything else we can make work and fit in our space.


It's Okay If You Can't Donate!

We understand money issues, obviously, and for us it is rewarding to just have people interested in our project and wanting to help us out.
You can still get the word out! Share the project, give us a shout out, social media and everything else. We are in an age of infinite technology and news travels fast so any sort of publicity is good publicity!
We highly appreciate your time, money, and interest. Thank you so much.

I like to think that in the future I will be able to work for myself and run my own professional printing operation using the principles of graphic design and techniques of printmaking.

story:
Greetings from Madelyn & Scott of 2011 World Champion Team LivingBrush Bodypainting

Hello, dear friends and fans of our work. 

Many of you are here because you know us personally, in real life or by virtue of the web. If you have arrived by other means, we encourage you to view LivingBrush Bodypainting's work and familiarize yourself with the joy & beauty we bring forth on our living, human canvases.

As a team, we have achieved notoriety as American Artists on a global stage in our brief, but illustrious competitive career. This includes capturing a 2010 2nd Place at The World Bodypainting Festival in our second ever competition, then winning it ALL in 2011, with 1st Place honors at both The North American Bodypaint Competition and The World Bodypainting Festival in Portschach, Austria.

It has been an AMAZING year representing our chosen artistic passion as World Champions of the discipline and the opportunities that title has afforded, as a result. Encouraged to excel, we have devoted study and energy toward competing in a NEW category (Special Effects) and have truly felt universal confirmation of this choice, as incredible new friends and teachers have arrived in our lives to lend a hand toward this goal.

This brings us to YOU and why we've invited you here.

In 2010, our good fortune brought us a benefactor who could help defray the (otherwise prohibitively expensive) cost of travel in our bid to become the new World Champions. This person believed fully in the quality of our art and our heart-and-soul dedication to our craft and wanted us to have the chance to prove it. I am extremely grateful to be able to say we did it!

This year, we similarly need a financial boost, not necessarily from one person, but spread among many who believe in us. It will be your belief that carries us forward, on a tide of faith and good feelings, to bring our art to the world! With your help, we can return to Austria for The 2012 World Bodypainting Festival in July and also travel to Daegu, South Korea for The 2012 Daegu International Bodypainting Festival in August/September.

 

What we need/What you get

We have set our campaign goal at an achievable $2500, a figure that covers one-forth of our expenses associated with the international travel costs of both competitions. Certainly, we need help to realize our dream, but are covering as much as we can with Scott's full-time job and Madelyn's four part-time ones.

EVERYONE who donates at ANY level is invited to a big celebration featuring photography, video, music, live storytelling detailing our adventures and featuring a live bodypainting. This will happen in NC, USA, date/time TBA.

READ ON for perks at other donation levels - fun for everyone!!!

 

Our joy multiplied by you, impacts everyone!

Have you enjoyed our work in a live performance setting? In a gallery? On the web?

Have you been painted by us or know someone who has?

Have you ever heard one of our real stories of how bodypainting has literally and powerfully changed someone's perception of themselves, bringing a gift of self-worth and healing, not previously conceived of.

If you feel our creativity adds value to our society, your life, or the lives of others, please help foster our growth into the world and feel good about your contribution.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but like what you see? Please help us spread the word and make some noise about this campaign using your social media connections! Indiegogo has great share tools for this purpose.

story:
What is the subject of your creative production?

The subject of our creation is a reconstruction of the masterpiece by French painter Theodor Gericault - The raft of the Medusa by using new techniques - combination of 3D graphics, photography, digital retouching and photomontage (matte painting).

Radoxist studio was established in 2009 by Radoslav Žilinský, a founder of the project. Radoslav has been already dealing with 3D graphics, retouching, photomontage, photography and digital production for 13 years now. He made use of his experience and sense of detail, colour and composition and became successful in his commercial career. However, after more than 60 commercial projects he would like to create something unique, something more focused on the art and collaboration with other artistic industries and help the students get into a proffesional creative process.

 

TEAM:

Radoslav Žilinský, fascinated with the art and the document about the French painter Theodor Gericault, decided to reconstruct the painter’s masterpiece The Raft of the Medusa. This masterpiece from 19th century depicts real story, which deserves more attention but unfortunately got behind the shadow of more famous Titanic. Using new techniques of the 21st century (photographing, 3D graphics, photomontage), our goal is to make this situation more realistic and appealing, without harming original conception in the sense of “learning from old maestros”.

Radoslav leads this project as an art director and organizer of it all. In the end, he will put everything together into one digital piece.

 

It is impossible to create such a massive reconstruction, so he invited other artists to participate on this project   

Peter Spurný – Slovak photographer, who provides his atelier for this complicated photo shooting and also contributes with his experience and advice.

 

Martin Jankovič – professional film make-up artist, who has more than 10-year experience in his work. His task is to make-up our models/sailors to look the most realistic in the photography – from scars, skin toning, fake beards and wigs to bruises and sunburns. He will also have an assistant – his long-standing colleague and a student of visage at the Academy of Performing Arts in Bratislava.

 

Ateliér 307 – Michaela Mokrá, Hana Ciglanová, Gabriela Pachová and Veronika Keresztesová – 4 fresh graduates of costume design at the Academy of Performing Arts will be responsible for making and arranging the contemporary costumes of “sailors” for the purposes of photography.

 

Ján Smarž – He is a 3D graphic designer, who will be responsible for modelling of the whole raft in 3D digital form. This talented man has been already working as a graphic designer for several years. His most successful work is a well-known model of 3D humanoid robot for the Slovak company ESET - which became successful all over the world due to its anti-virus program NOD.

 

Ľubomír Bercel – works as an art director in the foremost advertising agencies. In this project he will be the person covering the whole art direction.

Samuel Bednár – a talented web and 2D graphic designer. Samuel works in one of the most progressive advertising agencies in Slovakia - MADE BY VACULIK. He is responsible for the creation of a web page, which will serve as a presentation of the whole project on the internet.

Students and other participants:

Barbora Pieštanská, Anna Zatkalíková, Adam Šakový,Martina Golianová, Miroslav Kuruc, Petra Vlčková, Ivan Uličný, Andrej Kolenčík,Katka Mihalkovičová, Katarína Žúžiová

 

How will be the students involved?

The students represent the next part of philosophy of “learning from old maestros”. They will assist in their specialization and they will have the chance to learn from the professionals participating in this project. It would be great experience for them to work on a real project and they can reach/get more knowledge useful in their future.

 

How will the creative process run?

Immediately after fulfilling the budget, the project will run  according to on the basis of these points:

1 – Selection of models - One of the most important steps in the project is the selection of the right men, who will embody individual sailors in the picture. Selection will be realized through casting and choosing in several competent classes of men - fencers, dancers, etc. Our intention is to find men with realistic attributes of models - muscularity, gracility, sinewiness, long hair and beard.

2 – Costume production – after finding the adequate models, the creation of suitable costumes follow. Sewing and arranging is very important - patination of clothes and costume fitting.

3 – Photo-shooting – due to the great amount of sailors in the picture, the photography is divided into four installments/days, each day for five people. The particular photography always consists of:

- Film make-up, patination, hair dressing, putting scars, bruises, sunburns, beards and so on

- Costume fitting, dressing and arranging

- Preparation of lights, perspective and composition of models according to the picture

- Photography itself and the recording on quality digital cameras

4 – Making the 3D model of the raft– It starts during previous phases of the project. It consists of 3D modelling of the raft and sails, lighting, texturing and making of realistic materials. Final photorealistic picture will be prepared for composition with photographed material.

5 – Composition of the final artwork – The final composition of the sailors photographed together with the realistic 3D model of raft and other photos will serve as a basis for the creation of sea and sky. This phase includes colour grading, cutting the models from photos, retouching, photomontage and matte painting in using 2D composition software.

 

What is the output of your creative process and what use does it have?

 

The final output of our creative process will be a digital picture in high resolution, usable in large-size print. Our primary purpose is to place the picture in a large format to one of the modern galleries in Slovakia or in the world. The picture can be used also in whatever size or format in different ways - whether in post-cards, posters, canvases or walls.

 

What is the final budget ?

15000 Dollars whitch it includes :

-presentation video for the project

-rental of the atelier for 4 days

-rental of professional light equipment for 4 days

-symbolic payment for main photographer

-costumes - material + 200hours of work of costume designers

-casting for models

-payment for 20 men as models / sailors

-2xfilm make-up artist work for 4 days

- film make-up material (fake beards, scars, body toning, wigs, sunburns)

- film make-up asistent

- making a 3D model of the raft +- 15 days of work

- website dedicated to this project

- production help and organization

- making a documentary movie about the project

 

Are there any finacial sources other than indiegogo ?

Yes we have applied for the grant "More art" at Tatra bank foundation for 6500 dollars and searching hard for other funding sources.

We are putting our own 2500 dollars into the project.

 

What will be the contribution of this project in the artistic sphere?

 

The contribution consists of broadening the awareness of the alternative techniques of art production and their combining in creative process formed by young and contemporary artists. It also shifts the borders of creative photography from the commercial advertisement sphere to the sphere of imagination, ideas and their realisations.

 

Have you worked on something like this before ?


Actually yes, one of my most sucessfull project I have done so far was an post apocaliptic vision of the modern world.

Along with tremendous success over the internet  - over 0,5mil. viewers and more than 3000 comments. It was also included in [Expose 6] book - Ballistic publishing.

It is called "Worth enough?" and you can have a closer look at it HERE.

 

 

So if you wish to see the final piece of Raft of the Medusa, you are welcome on the board ! Thank you.

And do not forget to share it with your friends.

And do not forget to visit our porfolios to discover more from our work.

Commercial work portfolio

Personal protoflio

story:
Hey guys!

I'm running a half marathon really soon to help to raise some funds for the Curtin 2012 Fine Art Degree Show (of which I am a participant - exciting). The show runs every year for graduating art students and raising money to pull it off is always an enormous task, so every little bit makes all the difference. The show is almost entirely student funded and money goes towards designing and printing the grad show yearbook, installation costs and catering.

Since fine art students tirelessly pour their hearts and souls into their work, for generally very little financial gain while enriching the cultural capital of our city, I think it is a great opportunity to show our appreciation to these wonderfully creative people. Please help by making a small contribution and give them a leg up as they attempt to enter the extremely competitive art world careers.

Of course you are all invited to come and see the art show show which takes place in November at Curtin University. More details soon!

Best of all, you get to see me work my guts out over a pretty hilly half marathon course on the 26th August.
story_txt:
Hey guys!
I'm running a half marathon really soon to help to raise some funds for the Curtin 2012 Fine Art Degree Show (of which I am a participant - exciting). The show runs every year for graduating art students and raising money to pull it off is always an enormous task, so every little bit makes all the difference. The show is almost entirely student funded and money goes towards designing and printing the grad show yearbook, installation costs and catering.
Since fine art students tirelessly pour their hearts and souls into their work, for generally very little financial gain while enriching the cultural capital of our city, I think it is a great opportunity to show our appreciation to these wonderfully creative people. Please help by making a small contribution and give them a leg up as they attempt to enter the extremely competitive art world careers.
Of course you are all invited to come and see the art show show which takes place in November at Curtin University. More details soon!
Best of all, you get to see me work my guts out over a pretty hilly half marathon course on the 26th August.

story:
Coaccession... lets you have your Monet and money, too!!



Coaccession's Story

Especially today, arts funding falls far short of fully supporting the arts... but then, arts funding hasn't begun fully mobilizing the value of artworks.  Sure, arts funding has used the cultural value of artworks to attract cash donations, but those donations hardly ever fully endow programs.  For full endowments, arts funding has to use the financial value of artworks as well as their cultural value.  The challenge is mobilizing their financial value to enhance their cultural value, not diminish it.  Coaccession meets that challenge.


Coaccession lets community members invest in artworks held by cultural institutions.  An artwork investment gives a community member the right to store that artwork for the institution whenever the institution decides to store it.  The institution has all rights other than storage, so it's as free to exhibit, research and conserve the artwork as it ever was, but instead of the stored artwork taking up space in the institution's basement, it's proudly out in the community at a member's home or office or church or school -- wherever the member and guests can enjoy it most while securing its longevity.


Community member investments in artworks fund the institution's cash endowment, adding to the capital income that supports its mission.  The institution no longer gets much capital appreciation from the artwork -- nearly all that goes to the community member making the investment -- but then, capital appreciation doesn't pay the bills that institutions have to pay and doesn't fund the programs that enhance the artwork's cultural value.  Capital appreciation does, however, let the community member save for the future with great social responsibility -- after all, when you invest in gold you stimulate gold mining, but when you invest in artworks you stimulate artistry, and when you invest in artworks whose cultural rights belong to cultural institutions, your investment provides capital income that lets them enhance the cultural value of your artworks.


If you want the arts fully funded in your community, and your community's cultural institutions have important artwork collections, your best donation now goes to start Coaccession up so those institutions can mobilize the financial value of those collections to enhance their cultural value to the community.  That financial value leverages your donation so it has an impact far in excess of its own cash value.  


Coaccession's Impact

Coaccession, as a new financial tool for cultural institutions, can increase exhibition, publication and conservation funding for artworks, giving communities greater opportunities for cultural appreciation.   Coaccession, as a new storage tool for cultural institutions, can increase community access to artworks at homes, offices, churches, schools, etc., also giving communities greater opportunities for cultural appreciation with community access to museum pieces that might otherwise go years, even decades, buried in basements without being seen.  Given the tight arts funding since the financial crisis began, the lack of these novel tools contributes to decreased exhibitions, publications and conservation.  You can help turn that around because cultural institutions really do have a lot more resources available than the ones they currently use.  Give them the tools to cultivate all their resources, rather than leaving the bulk of their financial and community resources sterilized.  Then enjoy what they do with their expanded capacity!


What Coaccession Needs & What You Get

Coaccession is just starting up.  More than anything, it needs a big client able to intelligently sort through the many options for implementation to set standards for itself and follow-on institutions.  It needs Detroit and the Detroit Institute of Arts collection, where a year of capital appreciation runs into tens of millions of dollars and the corresponding capital income can fund arts programs throughout the city and its schools.  Having that client leads to standards, a recognized registry, legal briefs, court enforcement, etc., etc.   Coaccession needs $7500 so its inventor, Mark White, can effectively commit to be in Detroit often enough and long enough to give Coaccession the visibility that can restore arts funding in that city.  This is serious.  The mayor has proposed zeroing out city funding for the DIA.  With Coaccession, the City and DIA could generate enough capital income to not only replace city funding, but fund new exhibitions, publications, and conservation as well as arts outreach to bring Detroiters to DIA's programs, and on top of that, fund the essential city services that help Detroiters stay in the city to benefit from the programs.  That's the kind of leverage your donations can generate when Coaccession lets artworks fund the arts in a city with a museum as wealthy as the DIA.


Pro bono services have already created draft legal documents encoding the Coaccession vision.  Now it's time to take that vision where it's clearly needed, and that starts with Detroit and then expands to your community with established standards. The money will still go to Coaccession outreach in Detroit if Coaccession supporters don't fund the entire $7500 goal, but it's far less likely to move Detroit in the right direction.


Other Ways You Can Help


Funding here gets Coaccession to Detroit, but Detroit still has to decide to use Coaccession to expand DIA's funding for collections and programs and outreach.  You can let Detroit's elected officials and Michigan's elected officials know that their prior investments in rescuing and helping fund the Detroit Institute of Arts now put the Detroit Institute of Arts in a position to return the favor.  If they say yes to Coaccession, your contributions here get levered many thousand times over in one city alone, and there are museums -- art and otherwise -- all across America.

If you know Detroit and know civic outreach, join the team!  Mark White knows Coaccession like no one else, but he needs your help to unleash this great new tool in Detroit.  Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  Remember the share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone. My name is Timothy "T-DUBB" White. Im here to ask for your help in getting me money raised so I can get major promotions done for my music. Im from Newport News, Virginia where there is little to do and the hope is at a all time high. I happened to be an artist that alot of people in my area believe in and they want to see me succeed in the music business. I know if I was to get a major record deal or even major placement on things with my music people in my state/city will be joyful and start to believe in themselves. I know belief is a powerful tool. I want to lead by example and showing them if I did it you can do it too. 

here is a little biography of what I have down on my own grind and money.

T-DUBB, born Timothy White is a native of Newport News, Virginia, he is a rap artist with a very unique rap style. His style is a blend of Southern and East Coast Hip Hop. He has a very energetic rap style that will get you out of your seat and have you saying "I'm Fresh" or have you glad you're "Back In Da Hood". He tells finely detailed stories with his rhymes. DJ Jack of Spade from 103 Jamz has quoted this about T-DUBB's music, "This is the type of music we make in V.A.". 

T-DUBB has had multiple songs such as Haters Gone Hate, They Tell Me, I'm Fresh, Do You Love Me, Bad Newz Connections, Show Me, From the Block to the Top, We Like the Cars, Gone Shake It Girl, They Know, Back On My B.S, and Blow That Money aired on a few of his local radio stations, such as 103 Jamz (VA), 91.1 (VA), Hot 102.1 (VA), 89.9 (Elizabeth City, NC), 101.1 The Fam (VA) & World Wide Radio (wwradio.net). He's currently getting radio play in clubs, online and fm radio stations around the world. T-DUBB has won multiple talent contests in Virginia which led to the opportunity to open up for The Keyshia Cole's "This Is Me Tour", Yung LA, Boyz II Men, Young Leek, Lil Scrappy, Dem Franchise Boyz, Young Buck, and The SMES Awards. T-DUBB has been featured on web sites such as VASwagger.com, VATalent.com, mp3waxx.com, wwradio.net, RocktheMic.ning.com, CorlinaAllDay.com, Coast2coastmixtapes.com, Dmusic.com, covebiz.webs.com, www.ddotomen.com, www.nme.com, and more.

In the year 2007, T-DUBB was nominated at the Blendzville Awards for Best Producer, nominated at the Hood Platinum Awards for Best Group when he was grouped with Black Spadez, and Best Record Label with Lightz Out Entertainment at the VA Unity Awards. He won "Best Hit Single" at the 2009 Blendzville Awards and was nominated for 4 others. He also performs at the East End Day Parade every year in the East End area of Newport News which is an event that celebrates the achievements of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and promote unity within the community of East End Newport News. 

Not only is T-DUBB a rap artist he is also a CEO of his own music company and management company to help other artist get exposure, engineer of a recording studio, graphic designer, and produce instrumentals from time to time. He sets out to be the person that shows the world that Virginia has a lot of talent no longer waiting to be seen and heard. He feels there are some very talented entertainers from Virginia that made it mainstream, but there is still so many other talented individuals looking for the opportunity to make it to the major scene. To him Lightz Out Entertainment and T&C Management are tools to showcase what Virginia has to offer within his team of people. Not only does he want to get into the mainstream music industry, but he also has a clothing line in the works which will open up opportunities for models and designers to be showcased and help out their careers. He also plans to venture out into other opportunities when the time is right. 

In the year 2013, T-DUBB was offered a position on 101.1 The Fam (Internet Radio) based in Richmond,VA as a radio personality. He gladly accepted the position because he knows it could bring a bigger following to his movement. Since then he has brought a greater audience to the radio station like they never had before. From being a radio personality he has had the opportunity to interview DJ Lord Jazz from The Lords of The Underground, Donald D and Dynamax of Ice-T's Bronx Rhyme Syndicate/Zulu Nation, and many unsigned/independent artist looking game exposure and fans. He even had the chance to do a remix of his song "Haters Gone Hate" with Donald D and Dynamax from being a radio personality. You can catch The Unsigned Power Hour hosted by T-DUBB on air every Monday (9p-10p E.S.T.), Tuesday (9p-10p E.S.T.), and Friday (7p-10p E.S.T.) onwww.1011TheFam.org helping artist get heard on his show. He also host his own events throughout Virginia for unsigned artist to perform at to better their crafts. 

T-DUBB feels music is just another way to tell a story. Who doesn't like to hear a good story? Music is his way of getting the problems he has faced in his life off his chest. He also loves to party so when it comes to party music T-DUBB has it for you. His hard hitting southern style beats and his rap flow just makes you want to get loose in the club. T-DUBB is on a mission to show the world what he has to offer and will not stop until he feels his story is told.


What We Need & What You Get

With your help I can get my music shopped around proffesional with Traskz Entertainment Group (Grammy Nominated). I will be able to get my music in the right hands in order to help my music succeed to the major level. I will never give up on my dreams of being in the majors and inspiring others to follow their dreams. If I dont meet this goal in raising the money I will continue to keep trying and doing other things to raise the money. I believe in myself and I know I can inspire the uninspired.

The Impact

I feel music is the way to your soul and I know I have a story to tell that will make people want to change for the better. Im from the projects so I know what it feels like to not have a role model to believe in locally. I know I will inspire people to do great things with their lives just by seeing me succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute money wise you can always share my campaign to someone you feel can help me out. Prayers and support goes a long way. I really would appreciate your support in helping me succeed.

story:
Hey guys! :)

So, I created this campaign to ask for your help, but also give something in return! I'm not a fan of just asking for money. 

Anyway, here's why I created this campaign.

In January, two teenage males entered my home and stole $450 worth of stuff from me. This included: my brand new Xbox 360 with a 250gb hard drive, power cords, wires, controllers, my Kinect sensor and a game disc. (Black Ops) 

The police have yet to do anything about it, and I have come to believe my hard-earned money that I put into buying all of this equipment is lost. I'm a college student, I don't make much money...it took me a good 5 months to save that money (while having to pay for plenty else), and in all but 10 minutes 2 teenagers took that away from me. 

I've been trying to save up for a new one, or a different system, but just recently one of my horses fell deathly ill. She was in the intensive care unit for days, and we thought she was a goner. She pulled through, but barely. Unfortunately for me, that means a pricey vet bill will be coming in my mail in the next few weeks, which will push back my plans even more.

 

What I'm asking you guys is:

I am asking for donations to help me out here, but I'm going to give back!

I do a lot of artsy stuff, and I hope you have seen it...because that's going to be my way of giving back to you for helping me out. 

Any donation over $10 will be getting a head portrait of themselves from me. 

Any donation over $30 will get a drawing of whatever they want! 

Does that sound alright to you?

If you want something else, we can always talk it over :) I'm open to suggestions! That is, if you think my art is boring or terrible...well....we can figure something out. 

REMEMBER: YOU MUST CLAIM A PERK TO GET A PORTRAIT. If you want to come back and give mocan you can. :) 

I really appreciate you guys taking the time to read this, and I hope you'll help a lady out. If you can only give a few bucks, I'll make sure to find something to do for you. Whether it be a hug or I'll buy you a cheeseburger or something. :P

 

Thanks so much for all your help, and I look forward to hearing from you!!

P.S. I put $600 because IndieGoGo charges a percentage, and I just want to make sure I've got a certain amount! :)

<3 Colleen

story:
Every year we add even more amazing Goddesses to our ranks and it gets harder and harder to figure out how to include as many as possible in the calendar campaign.  Last year our Goddesses Got WET with you and this year we wanted to bring you the best of the best in images and also include as many Goddesses as we could. You know that that means, a new year, A NEW THEME!

These year's theme is Pin-up and Lingerie.  Each of our participating Goddesses is in the works creating an image that best utilizes lingerie and cheesecake pinup poses that continue to represent the character, only sexier! As Yoda would say "An Excellent Calendar, this will be!"

Below you'll find an early submission  ready for viewing from the always awesome Gothic Sushi in a preview of her calendar image.  This is a preview and the final image may vary.  

The 2018 Calendar will be a standard 12 month calendar with a centerfold.  Despite this, we have 21 Goddesses participating in the Calendar Campaign.  Each of these lovely ladies will be shooting and submitting an image for possible inclusion in the calendar, along with a lovely portrait similar to last year.  Each of these images will  be offered as prints for purchase (either through one of our campaign perks or afterwards).  The best of the best, a total of 14 images (12 months, 1 Centerfold, and a Cover image) will be used in the calendar.  This allows us to give everyone a chance to participate and will allow us to provide our fans with some truly amazing prints we wouldn't be able to produce otherwise. 

Our Goal includes the cost of paying models, photographers, photo editors and getting the calendars printed.  Why so much you might ask? This year’s project has 21 Goddesses producing 38+ Images. That's 21 different Goddesses that all need to be paid and nearly as many photographers.  

Being that several of these Goddesses are shooting two girl or in one case THREE girl images, we are trying something new. Not only will the print sets include the standard image set but we will  be doing a solo for each girl giving those full print sets some bonus imagery!

Choose From: Alice Malice, Minnie d'Moocha, Nerdee, Stephanie Marie, Essi

Choose From: Lady Toxica, Alice Malice, Minnie, Nerdee, Stephanie Marie, Essi

Choose From: Alice Malice, Jessica Nova

Choices Available: 

  Goddess 1   Goddess 2   Set
  Alice Malice  Jessica Nova   Wicked Lady and Mistress 9 : Sailor Moon
  Alice Malice  Jessica Nova  Asuka and Misato: Evangelion
  Alice Malice  Jessica Nova   Emma Frost and Jean Grey: Xmen
  Lady Toxica  Jessica Nova  Saeko and Saya: Highschool of the Dead
  Lady Toxica  Nurse Harley  Juri and Grey: Fairy Tail
  Kalika  Stephanie  Daphne and Velma: Scooby Doo

ALL backers will get access to purchase the pillow cases at a special Backer ONLY rate.   All backers over $100 will receive a free case of their choosing from the available options.   

$9,500: NEW LANYARD FOR BACKERS! Backers of $50 or more will all get one of the new lanyards included in their order  

$10,000: GeekGoddess Card Game:  We are working on a GeekGoddess themed card game.  If we reach this level we’ll be able to get the game printed.  Backers will have first access to the game at a special Backer-ONLY Price.   

$10,500: Crop Top Goddesses: Backers of $100 or more will be sent a Polaroid of one of our goddesses modeling our new GeekGoddess Crop Top and Panties 

$11,000: GeekGoddess Posters:  We’ll produce a new GeekGoddess Poster that’s at least 13x19 in size.   All Backers at $35 and up will receive one for free.  

$11,500: GeekGoddess Mousepads:  We’ll produce custom GeekGoddess Mousepads.  All Backers of $200 and up will receive one for free. All other backers will get access to purchase at a special backer only rate.  

$12,000:  Exclusive Backers only Images:  Backers of $40 or more will get access to exclusive images of Jessica Nova from an unreleased set.

$18,000: Backers of $100 or more will receive the full GeekGoddess dice set

story_txt:
Every year we add even more amazing Goddesses to our ranks and it gets harder and harder to figure out how to include as many as possible in the calendar campaign.  Last year our Goddesses Got WET with you and this year we wanted to bring you the best of the best in images and also include as many Goddesses as we could. You know that that means, a new year, A NEW THEME!These year's theme is Pin-up and Lingerie.  Each of our participating Goddesses is in the works creating an image that best utilizes lingerie and cheesecake pinup poses that continue to represent the character, only sexier! As Yoda would say "An Excellent Calendar, this will be!"Below you'll find an early submission  ready for viewing from the always awesome Gothic Sushi in a preview of her calendar image.  This is a preview and the final image may vary.  The 2018 Calendar will be a standard 12 month calendar with a centerfold.  Despite this, we have 21 Goddesses participating in the Calendar Campaign.  Each of these lovely ladies will be shooting and submitting an image for possible inclusion in the calendar, along with a lovely portrait similar to last year.  Each of these images will  be offered as prints for purchase (either through one of our campaign perks or afterwards).  The best of the best, a total of 14 images (12 months, 1 Centerfold, and a Cover image) will be used in the calendar.  This allows us to give everyone a chance to participate and will allow us to provide our fans with some truly amazing prints we wouldn't be able to produce otherwise. Our Goal includes the cost of paying models, photographers, photo editors and getting the calendars printed.  Why so much you might ask? This year’s project has 21 Goddesses producing 38+ Images. That's 21 different Goddesses that all need to be paid and nearly as many photographers.  Being that several of these Goddesses are shooting two girl or in one case THREE girl images, we are trying something new. Not only will the print sets include the standard image set but we will  be doing a solo for each girl giving those full print sets some bonus imagery!Choose From: Alice Malice, Minnie d'Moocha, Nerdee, Stephanie Marie, EssiChoose From: Lady Toxica, Alice Malice, Minnie, Nerdee, Stephanie Marie, EssiChoose From: Alice Malice, Jessica NovaChoices Available:

story:
We are planning a 3 day art event which will evoke an emotional response to the questions of LOVE. The collection of works will run the gamete from classical paintings to digital and video installations. There will be art for all the senses from your eyes and ears to the tactile, with music, performances and experiences beyond your imagination. SHE LOVES is an all encompassing assemblage of multimedia artists, all based on the affairs of the heart.

What’s your plan, and what’s your schedule?  

 The Installation exhibit will take place from February 10-12, 2017 at the Honeypot LA, 212 W 12th St, Los Angeles, CA 90015. February 9th, will be dedicated to the artists installing the exhibits and having light and sound crews do all checks. All three days will feature a different one time only attraction. All backers will receive their incentive gifts by March 1, 2017.

what are we looking for?

We are looking for supporters for this exhibit who can help us to bridge the financial gap of $10,000 to complete this project by securing our location, and to ensure that we can deliver a truly exceptional experience. We have done all in our power to make sure that the event can take place but with your help we can make it a reality. The money will be spent on location of our first 3 day exhibit, materials needed to complete some of the installations and creating a record ( that means video ) that we can use as a tool to represent the collective so this exhibit may travel in the future.

What If We Get More?  

If we were to get more, e.g. $20,000 or 30,000 then the collective would start planning cities to visit, and second stages of the collective

Why should you care? 

Women are faced with making choices of love, for love and about love on a daily basis and are confronted with the contradictions of these choices. SHE LOVES art exhibit provides a platform for these women artists to start a dialogue with the viewer and hence a dialogue with their community on the subject of love. We hope to break gender stereotypes and social expectations for women ( in the arts ) by demonstrating the power of mutual support coupled with compelling artistic expression. With your donation you too can be a patron of the arts and be a part of the conversation.

gratitude

She Loves Collective wishes to thank their videographer, Robert Nazar Arjoyan, their photographer, Jake Hagopian and their music DJ Armen Mesropian.

Special thanks to our loved ones Armen Baghdassarian, Mel Saroyan, Hilma Shahinian, Monique Paredes, Armen Grigorian, Armond Baghdassarian, Josh Gutier, Armen Mesrobian and Kelly Benson.

story:
Art Revival

For those of you who know me, you most likely know about my passion for art. I graduated from college MANY years ago with a Bachelor's of Fine Art, but have never pursued a profit in the world of art.  I worked for ten years in tv journalism, and now I am in my thrid year in social work. I help people with mental illness everyday with long term and day to day solutions. It is a rewarding job, but not a financially rewarding job. (cont. reading after image)

Over the course of the last year I have been rebuilding my art portfolio and have decided to share my work and hopefully make a couple extra dollars in the process.

As many of you know it is extremely difficult to get a project of the ground without the money or resources to begin. I have decided to try crowd sourced funding to help with my project.

I am in need of more watercolor paper, brushes and supplies. The big need however, is a new printer. I need a printer that I can rely on to produce quality prints for my customers and my shows. I have consulted with other local artists and photographers and isolated the what my basic needs are to get going again.

Any donation helps and if you are unable to help financially then please share this project with your friends at work and on social media sites. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and please share!

story:
Since 1998, The Smell has been an all ages, community-based, DIY art and music space in Downtown LA, dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment for a more interactive creative experience for artists and their audience.

One thing that The Smell has always lacked is our own video projector that can be used by musicians and artists to enhance the creative experience, and to provide the means to present video and film screenings on a more regular basis.

story:
Hello there supporters!

In a couple of weeks, on Sunday November 9, I'll be running the Beirut Marathon 10K in support of the Lebanese Autism Society (LAS). 

My goal is to have a blast and help raise awareness and funds for LAS while I'm at it. And here's where I need your support! Right now, my aim is to reach $1000 by the time I race. Any contribution, no matter how little it is, can go a long way!

But wait! Did I mention I won't be running alone!? Karl, Donatella, Anna and a few more surprise Fashion Legends will be joining me on my mission. For every $300 raised, I'll post a photo that has something to do with these Fashion Legends—but I'm not saying what it is just yet.
So help me reach my first $300 to find out what it is I'm up to! ;-)

#DaliaForLAS    #RunForLAS    #RunForAutism    #BeirutMarthon    #PeaceLoveRun #GiveALittleToMakeALot

story:
The first 13 backers will receive additional rewards!
Every tenth (20-30-40-50 ...) will get an extra reward!



HI! My name is Sergiy Tatchyn. I'm Ukrainian artist and poet.

Facebook (public)      II     My site     II     Dzen.UA     II      Facebook (personal)

Large-Scale-Project Presentation!

The goals of my project are to organize and launch a series of exhibitions in   four Ukrainian cities  (Kyiv, Lviv, Kharkiv, and Vinnytsia), and promote my published in September 2013 poetry book "Dzen.UA". I also plan to perform poetry readings at the openings of each exhibition. It will be a big event Ukrainian modern art.

Most of the paintings for the art exhibitions have been already made. They depict some of Ukrainian landscape. The paintings are made in oil on canvas, cardboards, and fibreboards. There are about 100 artworks altogether. I plan to paint 20 – 30 more large landscapes on canvas.

In addition, in my plans – to print a series of exclusive postcards and bookmarks using the themes of my paintings. They will be distributed during the exhibitions and poetic readings. It is prearranged to make the postcards in two sizes – 4х6 inch and 5x7 inch, and bookmarks – 2x7 inch (with autograph, limited edition, entirely handmade).

The exhibitions are planned to be hold during the spring 2014. Specific dates depend on the schedule of the art galleries. Nonetheless, the events will take place in March – May. Therefore, the project should be completed by the end of May. This is a great art event and all the paintings will be used as rewards for backers! Once the exhibitions are completed, everything will be sent to the backers of this project.

It's done! Now when the "Dzen.UA" is almost ready, I need your support to be able to share this ambitious project far and wide. I want to create a global dialog about art. Art should be for everyone. This is a big undertaking but I am up to it. I am obsessive perfectionist.

Nowadays, Ukrainians feel a huge pressure on native language and Ukrainian book publishing. Thus the goal of my project is to draw attention to this problem. Ukraine is an independent country for 22 years. But up to now, national culture does not receive appropriate support from the government. Cultural and art projects and events should highlight such issues and minimize them.

Art is an universal tool for better understanding not only between people but also between nations. The Ukrainian language and art are an important part of development of Ukrainian national consciousness. Ukraine is an European country!




The book was published in September 2013 by the publishing house "Green Dog" in Kyiv. Black and white, hardcover, 248 pages, many illustrations (ISBN 978-966-1515-92-4).



The funds for developing the project required about $17,800

Money will be divided as follows:
1. rent art galleries in four cities - $5200
2. packaging, insurance and transportation artworks - $1200
3. paints and materials for 20 large artworks - $1200
4. travel and accommodation - $800
5. presentation and promotion of poetry book - $500
6. production and dispatch rewards - about 25% of the project.
7. taxes and unplanned expenses - about 25% of the project.

What if I raise more than the funding goal? If more than $17 800 is raised, the extra funds would be used in several ways:

If raised from $20,000 to $30,000
– I buy materials for painting - paint, brushes, canvas, picture frame.
– I'll draw another 5 - 10 artworks for backers.
– I arrange 1 more art exhibition.

And so and so forth...

If raised from $40,000 to $50,000
– I buy materials for painting - paint, brushes, canvas, picture frame.
– I'll draw another 10 - 15 large artworks for backers.
– I arrange 3 more art exhibitions.
– I'll upgrade my art studio.

And so and so forth...

If raised from $60,000 to $70,000
– I buy materials for painting - paint, brushes, canvas, picture frame.
– I'll draw another 20 - 25 large artworks for backers.
– I arrange 5 more art exhibitions.
– I'll build a spacious new art studio (my cherished dream)!

And so and so forth...

A spark of inspiration is everywhere and the more I rise, the more ideas I want to share with you.

Please do not hesitate to share the info about the project in any way you like. 
I need your support and warm words about the project!


1. Desktop wallpapers (up to 24pcs)
2. Set of postcards 4"x6" and 5"x7" (up to 96pcs)
3. Set of bookmarks (up to 24pcs)
4. Oil paintings!

1. Desktop wallpapers – 1920x1080.

2. Pictorial postcards autographed author – hand made – 4''x6'' and 5''x7'' (24+24pcs)  vertical.


3. Pictorial postcards autographed author – hand made – 4''x6'' and 5''x7'' (24+24pcs) horizontal.

4. Pictorial bookmarks autographed author – hand made – 2''x7'' (24pcs).

5. Original artworks – oil paintings (over 100 pcs)!

And now, detail the:

- exclusive pictorial postal cards autographed author (4''x6'') - 2pcs.
- exclusive pictorial bookmarks autographed author (2''x7'') - 1pcs.
- and of course my thanks!

- and of course my thanks!

- exclusive pictorial postcards autographed author (5''x7'') - 2pcs.

- and of course my thanks!

Everyone will receive a reward!

No worries! I prepared ahead of time for prompt fulfillment of this project's rewards. Unlike many other IndieGoGo campaigns that may still be in the idea phase, this project has already been in production for four years.

All paintings will be granted as rewards, depending on the size of contribution. They are all original work executed in oil. I promise that everyone will get their rewards in the timely matter.

If the amount of the project will be exceeded, then it is great, I am counting on it. In that case, I will have spare money to hold several more exhibitions, as well as to improve my art studio, because it is too small for painting large artworks. Or I will have an opportunity to build a new one – bright and spacious!

There are no risks, because almost all paintings are ready, or will be completed soon. Postcards and bookmarks will be printed as soon as the project ends.I assure you that this project will be completed precisely and with high quality.

By contributing money you pursue two goals – supporting the development of art and receiving exclusive artworks. No one will be left without a reward! Unless Genesis Flood might occur! But once the water goes down, I will immediately send rewards to all backers of this project!)

I put at stake my reputation, name, and integrity by bringing this project to your attention!

story_txt:
The first 13 backers will receive additional rewards!Every tenth (20-30-40-50 ...) will get an extra reward!HI! My name is Sergiy Tatchyn. I'm Ukrainian artist and poet.Facebook (public)      II     My site     II     Dzen.UA     II      Facebook (personal)Large-Scale-Project Presentation!

The
goals of my project are to organize and launch a series of exhibitions in   four
Ukrainian cities  (Kyiv, Lviv, Kharkiv,
and Vinnytsia), and promote my published in September 2013 poetry book "Dzen.UA". I also plan to perform poetry
readings at the openings of each exhibition. It will be a big event Ukrainian
modern art.
Most
of the paintings for the art exhibitions have been already made. They depict some
of Ukrainian landscape. The paintings are made in oil on canvas, cardboards,
and fibreboards. There are about 100 artworks altogether. I plan to paint 20
– 30 more large landscapes on canvas.
In
addition, in my plans – to print a series of exclusive postcards and bookmarks
using the themes of my paintings. They will be distributed during the
exhibitions and poetic readings. It is prearranged to make the postcards in two
sizes – 4х6 inch and 5x7 inch, and bookmarks – 2x7 inch (with autograph,
limited edition, entirely handmade).
The
exhibitions are planned to be hold during the spring 2014. Specific dates
depend on the schedule of the art galleries. Nonetheless, the events will take
place in March – May. Therefore, the project should be completed by the end of May.
This is a great art event and all the paintings will be used as rewards for
backers! Once the exhibitions are completed, everything will be sent to the backers
of this project.
It's done! Now when
the "Dzen.UA" is almost
ready, I need your support to be able to share this ambitious project far and
wide. I want to create a global dialog about art. Art should be for everyone.
This is a big undertaking but I am up to it. I am obsessive perfectionist.Nowadays, Ukrainians feel a huge pressure on native language and Ukrainian book publishing.
Thus the goal of my project is to draw attention to this problem. Ukraine is an
independent country for 22 years. But up to now, national culture does not
receive appropriate support from the government. Cultural and art projects and
events should highlight such issues and minimize them. 
Art is an universal tool for better understanding not
only between people but also between nations. The Ukrainian language and art
are an important part of development of Ukrainian national consciousness.
Ukraine is an European country!

The book was published in September 2013 by the publishing house "Green Dog" in Kyiv. Black and white, hardcover, 248 pages, many illustrations (ISBN 978-966-1515-92-4).The funds for developing the project required about $17,800Money will be divided as follows:1. rent art galleries in four cities - $52002. packaging, insurance and transportation artworks - $12003. paints and materials for 20 large artworks - $12004. travel and accommodation - $8005. presentation and promotion of poetry book - $5006. production and dispatch rewards - about 25% of the project.7. taxes and unplanned expenses - about 25% of the project.What if I raise more than the funding goal? If more than $17 800 is raised, the extra funds would be used in several ways:If raised from $20,000 to $30,000– I buy materials for painting - paint, brushes, canvas, picture frame.– I'll draw another 5 - 10 artworks for backers.– I arrange 1 more art exhibition.And so and so forth...If raised from $40,000 to $50,000– I buy materials for painting - paint, brushes, canvas, picture frame.– I'll draw another 10 - 15 large artworks for backers.– I arrange 3 more art exhibitions.– I'll upgrade my art studio.And so and so forth...If raised from $60,000 to $70,000– I buy materials for painting - paint, brushes, canvas, picture frame.– I'll draw another 20 - 25 large artworks for backers.– I arrange 5 more art exhibitions.– I'll build a spacious new art studio (my cherished dream)!And so and so forth...A spark of inspiration is everywhere and the more I rise, the more ideas I want to share with you.Please do not hesitate to share the info about the project in any way you like. I need your support and warm words about the project!1. Desktop wallpapers (up to 24pcs)2. Set of postcards 4"x6" and 5"x7" (up to 96pcs)3. Set of bookmarks (up to 24pcs)4. Oil paintings!1. Desktop wallpapers – 1920x1080.2. Pictorial postcards autographed author – hand made – 4''x6'' and 5''x7'' (24+24pcs)  vertical.3. Pictorial postcards autographed author – hand made – 4''x6'' and 5''x7'' (24+24pcs) horizontal.4. story:
Magic Prank....?

My best friend Tommy has gotten into metal detecting. He's bought his first detector but has yet gotten the chance to use it, my plan is to hide 10.... awww, just watch the video.

  • I'm Tommy's friend (not his enemy). We haven't been enemies for 12 years now. 
  • Making magic is important to me. Let's make Tommy's first metal detecting treasure hunt pure magic.
  • Personally, I hate dildos, metal or otherwise. I hope this shows you the length I will go to make the magic prank a reality.

Have you stopped reading here... will you make a contribution...?

What I Need & What You Get

Ok folks, let me break down the magic:

  • I need $600 for 10 metal dildos and $100 for a ninja outfit.
  • For a $10 donation you will get a link to download a video of the prank, from purchasing supplies, to the midnight mission, and hopefully, to Tommy's revelation... magic this good can't be bought!... well, in this case it can be bought, but usually, it can't be bought.
  • If we don't reach our goal, I will try to put the money towards one big metal dildo and hide that... though this really seems less magically.

Stretch Goals

Should we have the opportunity to make this prank even more magicallyier:

  • OVER $800 and I will also bury an Insane Clown Posse metal lunchbox for Tommy to uncover:

  • OVER $809.99 and I will put "$10,000" in a metal box with a bloody note that says "I'm watching you Thomas":

  • OVER $1000 and I will also bury a metal detector for Tommy to find with his metal detector:


Please help me out with more suggestions - I want to make this a magic experience for my best friend.

Risks & Challenges

There is a chance Tommy will find out about this - but I trust the internet to keep this secret.

  • I have the qualities of a leader and my friendship with Tommy will give me magic strength to accomplish my dildo goal.
  • Currently I am on a paleo diet but I will actually try to eat more gluten and refined sugars to ensure I don't keep a clear head... I believe this is what's required for successfully completing this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe just think about Tommy, or bring him up in conversation throughout the day. These types of things help.

Let's make magic prank together.
