story:
Art For Sport: Save The Court, Create Community

A One Night Art Exhibition and Silent Auction to Benefit the Maravilla Handball Court


Organized by Amanda Perez and Carlin Wing


THE CAUSE


The Maravilla Handball Court was built brick by brick by the local community in 1923.  It is the oldest surviving handball court in East Los Angeles.  For decades, the court and the attached grocery served as a site for sport, recreation, and community gatherings.  Facing the threat of redevelopment, Amanda Perez created the Maravilla Historical Society in 2009 to keep the court in the hands of the community.  (You can read more about the history of the court here and here, and find out about the film nights, art exhibits and poetry readings the society has been hosting at the court here.)

 

The Maravilla Historical Society has been doing great work and has even greater ambitions for the court to serve as a key community resource, but we need your help!  Right now the Maravilla Historical Society is leasing the land that the court and grocery occupy.  The goal of the silent auction and this online campaign is to raise $10,000 to go towards a down payment on the property.  Buying the land is the only way to ensure that the court will be preserved and will pave the way for the longer term goal of transforming the court and the grocery into a site for people of all ages, sexes and backgrounds to gather around sports, art and community.  In our current economic times, preserving and supporting the spaces that communities have created for themselves is more important then ever.  Every dollar donated helps us do this.


THE EVENTS


On Sunday, August 21, artist Carlin Wing is running a free Ball-Making Workshop at the court for Angelenos to come make and test out their own handballs.  Wing will photograph the balls made at the workshop and present these ball portraits alongside other works that have been generously donated by some great Los Angeles artists, at Art for Sport: A One Night Art Exhibition and Silent Auction featuring a special performance by experimental music collaborative Lucky Dragons, on Friday, August 26.



WHAT YOU CAN DO


Come to the events!

Hitting Walls (v.XVIII): Making a Ball, a free workshop on Sunday, August 21 from 5-7pm. 

At the Maravilla Handball Court, 501 Mednik Ave, Los Angeles, CA


Art for Sport: A One Night Art Exhibition and Silent Auction on Friday, August 26 from 7-9pm.  

At the Maravilla Handball Court, 501 Mednik Ave, Los Angeles, CA

Works generously donated by: Ellen Birrell, Danny Boy, John Burtle, CamLab, Sam Durant, Ofelia Esparaza, Harry Gamboa Jr., Alexis Garcia, Joel Garcia, Liz Glynn, Tom Lawson, Sidonie Loiseleux, Elana Mann, Anna Mayer, Maria Molteni, Kurt Mueller, Alejandro Sanchez, Allan Sekula, Marcos Siref, Jade Thacker, David Welzdius, Jemima Wyman


Spread the word!

Pass this campaign on to friends in Los Angeles and to art lovers and sports lovers around the world.  You can use the share tools to post it to your blog, share it on Facebook, Tweet it and so forth.


Donate!

If you can't make it to the auction, you can still receive a ball portrait taken at the workshop as a thanks for your online donation. 


One Ball, One Wall, Handball!
story_txt:
Art For Sport: Save The Court, Create Community
A One Night Art Exhibition and Silent Auction to Benefit the Maravilla Handball Court

Organized by Amanda Perez and Carlin Wing


THE CAUSE


The Maravilla Handball Court was built brick by brick by the 
local community in 1923.  It is the oldest surviving handball court in 
East Los Angeles.  For decades, the court and the attached grocery 
served as a site for sport, recreation, and community gatherings.  Facing the threat of 
redevelopment, Amanda Perez created the Maravilla Historical 
Society
in 2009 to keep the court in the hands of the 
community.  (You
 can read more about the history of the court here and here, and find out about the film nights, art exhibits and poetry readings the society has been hosting at the court here.)

 The
 Maravilla Historical Society has been doing great work and has even 
greater ambitions for the court to serve as a key community resource, but we need
 your help!  Right now the Maravilla Historical Society is leasing the land that the court and grocery occupy.  The goal of the silent auction and this 
online campaign is to raise $10,000 to go towards a down payment on the 
property.  Buying the land is the only way to ensure that the 
court will
 be preserved and will pave the way for the longer term goal
 of transforming the court and the grocery into a site for people of all
 ages, sexes and backgrounds to gather around sports, art and 
community.  In our current economic times, preserving and supporting the
 spaces that 
communities have created for themselves is more important then ever.  Every dollar donated helps us do this. 


THE EVENTS
On Sunday, August 21, artist Carlin Wing is running a free Ball-Making Workshop at the court for Angelenos to come make and test out their own handballs.  Wing will photograph the balls made at the workshop and present these ball portraits alongside other works that have been generously 
donated by some great Los Angeles artists, at Art for Sport: A One Night Art Exhibition and Silent Auction featuring a special performance by experimental music collaborative Lucky Dragons, on Friday, August 26.

WHAT YOU CAN DO


Come to the events!
Hitting Walls (v.XVIII): Making a Ball, a free workshop on Sunday, August 21 from 5-7pm. 
At the Maravilla Handball Court, 501 Mednik Ave, Los Angeles, CA

Art for Sport: A One Night Art Exhibition and Silent Auction on Friday, August 26 from 7-9pm.  
At the Maravilla Handball Court, 501 Mednik Ave, Los Angeles, CA
Works generously donated by: Ellen Birrell, Danny Boy, John Burtle, CamLab, Sam Durant, Ofelia Esparaza, Harry Gamboa Jr., Alexis Garcia, Joel Garcia, Liz Glynn, Tom Lawson, Sidonie Loiseleux, Elana Mann, Anna Mayer, Maria Molteni, Kurt Mueller, Alejandro Sanchez, Allan Sekula, Marcos Siref, Jade Thacker, David Welzdius, Jemima Wyman

Spread the word!
Pass this campaign on to friends in Los Angeles and to art lovers and sports lovers around the world.  You can use the share tools to post it to your blog, share it on Facebook, Tweet it and so forth.

Donate! 
If you can't make it to the auction, you can still receive a ball 
portrait taken at the workshop as a thanks for your online donation.  

One Ball, One Wall, Handball!

story:
Bergen · Nottingham · Nottingham · Bergen


We are a group of final year Fine Art students from Nottingham Trent University, UK. Through our degree we have been put in touch with students from Bergen National Academy of the Arts: an art school in Norway. Our aim is to create artwork with, alongside or in response to the artistic practices of these students by travelling to Bergen.


We intend on visiting their Academy for five days, in which time they have very kindly offered to put us up in their own houses and apartments. We will get to know them both as individuals and as a group and see what kind of art we can create together. This process has already begun through a joint blog entitled WHAT MATTERS? Please feel free to view examples of our current work and an ongoing conversation that is beginning to formulate:


http://whatmatters-matters.tumblr.com/


We will be putting on an exhibition to display the work we create, both in galleries and art spaces whilst we are away as well as possible further exhibitions or publications once we return to the UK. There is a chance we will be able to exhibit in a gallery run by one of our own university tutors, which is in an incredible location in Norway – atop a mountain!


We need enough money to get the 7 students in our UK group return flights to Bergen during April 2011. This will enable this unique project to take place, which will in turn ignite new relationships, a new way of working for many of us, and ultimately a really exciting exhibition(s) for the public to enjoy as the result of our trip.


THANKYOU

The Impact

Being students, unfortunately we cannot all afford the full cost of the trip. As we are kindly being housed by the Norwegian students, our expenses when we are out there will be for food, travel and art materials. The flights are the real cost we are struggling with and therefore asking for your help with. This trip is taking place just over a month before our final deadline for our University degree, which in itself will incur some substantial costs (you can view our degree show website here: http://www.fineartdegreeshow.info/).

Anything you can give us is a massive help in allowing us to make the most of a unique international opportunity.


What We Need & What You Get  

 
The flights are priced at around $133 return each, and so with a group of 7 of us going this comes to $930. These are the cheapest flights we could find for the time the Bergen students could host us. If we don't reach our entire goal the money we have raised will be divided equally between the 7 of us, helping to ease the financial burden of this incredible experience. Each student is currently doing their best to raise funds from family, friends, pennies down the back of the sofa to afford the other costs while we are out there, but this campaign is at the core of our endeavours.

So, to help you along the way in aiding our trip, we are providing some fun and unique incentives in return for your dollars!

 

$5 - Our undying gratitude! [We might even wave out of the plane at you]

$10 - A personal thankyou in your name on our blog http://whatmatters-matters.tumblr.com/

$25 -  A personal thankyou in your name on our blog, plus a postcard bought in Bergen sent to you from us with a personal thankyou message

$50 – A photograph of the NTU and KHIB teams together in Bergen sent to you with our gratitude

$50 - A bottle of real snow collected in Bergen!! sent to you in the post with our gratitude

$100 – A traditional Bergen recipe sent to you in the post, written on a postcard bought in Bergen

$250 – A delicious cupcake, hand-baked by one of our team, sent to you in the post with a personal thankyou letter from the whole team

$500 – An original artwork by one of the team, sent to you in the post with a certificate!

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to donate to our campaign at the moment, and we understand that - but if you feel as passionate about this as we do then please help us spread the word! Let everyone know about our exciting project, how they can help and let them follow our progress too by sharing the following links:

 

Our facebook fundraising page: http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_18725...

 

Our project blog: http://whatmatters-matters.tumblr.com/

 

Our degree show website: http://www.fineartdegreeshow.info/

story:
What We Need

You may saying to yourself "why are they raising money... isn't the Spire of Fire already built?"  

Yes... the Spire of Fire is built and you may have even seen it at one of the following events:

  • Burning Man (Black Rock City, NV 2010)
  • Artown (Reno, NV 2011)
  • Beyond Wonderland (San Bernardino, CA 2012)
  • A&E Shipping Wars Season 2 Episode 9 (2012)
  • Electric Daisy Carnival (Rutherford, NJ 2012)
  • Electric Daisy Carnival (Las Vegas, NV 2012)

So why are we asking for your hard earned cash???  

The simple answer is PROPANE... propane, propane, propane.  She drinks it as fast as the DPW guzzles PBR and Jameson at Early Burn.  When the Spire is in full operation she consumes 3 gallons of propane per minute... you read that right... 3 gallons per "minute".  Last year the price per gallon delivered to the playa was $2.50 per gallon, that means we need $7.50 per minute or $450 per hour to fire her up. To put that in perspective, last year all of the artists, theme camps, mutant vehicles, and infrastructure consumed 20,200 gallons of propane during the event.  We plan to burn 800 gallons per night for 7 nights... that equals 5,600 gallons or 28% of what the entire event consumed last year. 5,600 x $2.50 = $14,000 just for propane!

Also... since 2012 the Spire of Fire has been in pieces scattered around Propaniac's property and is in need of some serious restoration to bring her back to her former glory. Several winters of snow and water freezing and thawing inside the stainless steel inverted pyramids has taken its toll and damaged many of the spot welds and rivets.  The rodents seeking shelter moved in and built their nests lined with the insulation they chewed off of the control wiring. The lighting also suffered water damage and will need to be replaced... needless to say, we have quite a bit of work to get her ready for Burning Man this year.  

Below is a brief list of what your donation will be funding:

  • Propane... lots of propane!
  • 1,000 gallon propane tank
  • 200 gallon per hour propane vaporizer
  • Trucking to and from event
  • Heavy equipment to load/unload outside of event
  • Replacement wiring
  • Replacement solenoid valves
  • Replacement LED lighting
  • Hot surface igniters
  • Generator
  • Insurance

What's In It For You

The satisfaction of contributing to a project that has brought joy to thousands... and perks... lots of perks:

  • Custom made brass pendant hand stamped with the Spire of Fire logo and year
  • Custom made aluminum dog tag/bottle opener hand stamped with the Spire of Fire logo and year
  • Spire of Fire stickers
  • Tee shirts, hoodies, and bandannas with the Spire of Fire logo made by a local Reno Burner. Tee Shirt Measurements  and   Hoodie Measurements 
  • Reserved seating at the Reno Compression Art & Fire event in July, 2016
  • Gift certificate for the Flame Effects for the Artist workshop taught by DaveX and Propaniac.
  • Signed 1st edition Cargo Cult book by world renowned photographer Karen Kuehn
  • Hand made (by Propaniac's father) wall hanging with the Spire of Fire plasma cut into a recycled farm disc 
  • Flameall playa adventure with Spire of Fire artist Steve Atkins
  • Welcome Wagon playa adventure with the infamous OneEyed Dick
  • Custom built steel scale model of the Spire of Fire (24" tall) made by Truckee artist, Matt Parkhurst
  • The joy of pushing the buttons and watching the fiery goodness erupt from the Spire of Fire

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to contribute financially but still want to help?

  • Tell your friends and family about our project
  • Share this campaign on social media
  • Show up on playa and help us wrangle hippies 
  • Hack into the North Korean national bank and transfer $10,000,000 to an offshore bank account and give me the access code

story:
Le Foulosophe...

Le Foulosophe est un homme d'affaire qui a réussi et qui veut aider son prochain. Une réelle et noble motivation de donner aux suivants !

  • Plusieurs dons pour des causes humanitaires
  • Plusieurs heures de bénévolat
  • Des investissements de temps et d'argent pour ces journées spéciales
  • ... son nouveau projet : Une journée sans soucis pour un sans abri !

Un nouveau mouvement dont vous pouvez faire partie !!

Ils ont besoin de vos dons...

Tout l'argent amassé sera distribué à :

  • L'organisme sans but lucratif Le Passant de Granby, qui vient en aide aux hommes dans le besoin (Le Foulosophe n'est pas affilié avec cet organisme)
  • Sébastien, le sans abri du vidéo, pour finaliser sa réintégration
  • et le surplus servira de base pour la prochaine journée, avec un autre sans abri

L'impact que vous pouvez avoir !

L'itinérance n'est pas une cause attrayante pour recueillir des dons et de l'aide ! 

Avec un mouvement comme : Une journée sans soucis pour un sans abri ! nous pourrons faire une différence, une petite victoire à la fois...

  • Les statistiques sont difficiles à collecter pour ceux qui n'ont pas de domicile fixe, mais selon certaines sources il y en aurait plus de 50 000 au Québec seulement.
  • En aidant un itinérant à conserver l'espoir, nous l'aidons dans sa réinsertion et ça inspire concrètement ceux qui le côtoie dans la rue... 
  • Nous aidons aussi toujours l'organisme local qui nous a aidé à identifier l'itinérant qui démontre une réelle volonté de s'en sortir. Ces organismes sont insuffisamment subventionné et aidé.

D'autres façons d'aider...

Vous pouvez aider de plusieurs façons même si vous ne désirez pas donner ici.

  • Partagez ce projet et son vidéo. Faites connaître ce nouveau mouvement afin d'inspirer les gens à contribuer financièrement. Vous avez plusieurs outils de partage présents sur Indiegogo
  • Vous pourrez bientôt vous procurez des objets promotionnels du Foulosophe. Les détails seront sur la page Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/LeVraiFoulosophe
  • ...ou encore mieux, faire Une journée sans soucis pour un sans abris! vous aussi. Partagez votre vidéo avec le Foulosophe :-)   levraifoulosophe@gmail.com

Et ce n'est que le début du mouvement...

story: In September 2012 Paul Bridgewater booked a show of new artwork by Chris Tanner at his new space Smart Clothes Gallery. Chris immediately dove into creating his latest signature glitter works. In the middle of this effort Hurricane Sandy came to town and destroyed everything. You can help! Contribute to Chris Tanner's New Art Show.

story:
A dynamic platform conceived to discover, inspire, support and establish opportunities for talented artists from around the world to create "Cause Art".

 

Three Simple Approches

PORTFOLIO

artist.mayaida.com

With high user experience, it will be easy to upload multiple files, connect and engage with your follower.

1. Online Presence & Connections

 

ART PROJECTS

projects.mayaida.com

Enhance your offline presence with products specifically established to create maximum exposure within the entertainment industry and beyond.

2. Offline Presence & Profit Share

 

CAUSE ART

causes.mayaida.com

Creating groundswell support we can envisage the societies of tomorrow, today, through the power of art.

3. Social Change & Public Presence

 

Maya iDA was established as a democratic platform to source, discover, inspire and support talented artists from around the world. In introducing opportunities for artists to collaborate with other exciting talent, Maya iDA will support its community in harnessing and utilizing their skills and imaginations for positive social action by creating ‘Cause Art’. The resulting publications and activity will explore the issues, fears, hopes and dreams for change that populates the contemporary human condition.  Artists have always been at the forefront of driving change and their desire to explore and understand their own world is key to the advancement of culture and civilization in all forms and this is central to the ethos of Maya iDA.

 

In addition to the Cause Art initiative Maya iDA will offer a number of services and resources including self-publishing tools and access to financial support, all complimented by a vibrant community that supports both fledgling and seasoned artists alike.

Our First Art Book - 2050:REBIRTH

2050:REBIRTH - Art Book

A view of a possible future, topics and themes explored will include - Quantum Physics, Nano bots, Parallel Universe, Beyond Black Holes, Spaceships, Advanced Human Entertainment, Advance Fashion Designs, Major Changes in Human Culture, Alien & Human Collaboration, Advance Communication & Languages, Artificial Intelligence, Singularity, Augmented Reality, Bio-Mechanics and Robots For Daily Life.

Although present in our lives today, 2050 will extrapolate on nascent and emerging technology, providing the blueprint for the future. By 2050, many of our natural instincts and activities, as well as our technology and lifestyle, will have changed. For example, Will men still need women to fulfill their fantasies? Will the natural reproduction of children have altered altogether? Will women still need men for fertilization? Perhaps a bio-mech alternative may take their place.

Imagine the food and entertainment of the future. .. What species will exist in 2050. What path will humanity take? Genetic mutation will certainly be a reality, but will it be a perversion of nature and science or part of evolution.  Within this new world what kind of new species will be born and how does the climate affect their development. What will the effects be on our society? Have robots taken control of our security systems and become our national guard? Will men be needed at all?

Maybe the future will become too much for men to handle, perhaps the changes that will most

certainly occur will be too much for us. What effect would that have on our society?

Imagine if Earth gave up its struggle against mankind and fought back? Would humanity be forced to find a new home? What possible planets will there be? If there was to be an Exodus in 2050 what form would it take? Would the focus be on discovering and developing new technology or the pursuit of a more spiritual path?

What will we be of value in the Year 2050?

 

More Features at Maya iDA

NEAR YOU

artist.mayaida.com

A global feature that will inform you of events, exhibitions and opportunities in your geographic region or further afield. This service is also designed to be a consistently updated service and resource for art schools, art jobs or studios near you.  

CHALLENGES   ART SCHOOLS  STUDIOS

 

SECURE

artist.mayaida.com

With Maya iDA Security features your art will be safer than ever. Each time your work is downloaded or shared, there will be water marks, portfolio links and copyright information alongside it. Security is a key value at Maya iDA and we will be constantly updating these features.

COPYRIGHT   BACKLINK   WATERMARK

 

REPORT

artist.mayaida.com

Unfortunately, scams and fraudulent  clients, as well as artists, have grown within online communities and the professional environment, but now it is going to end with the specially designed REPORT PAGE, where you can report about scammers and easily tell the world about them. As this is a key concern within the community and Maya iDA we will be constantly updating this feature.

REPORT SCAM   REPORT THEFT

 

NEWS FEED

artist.mayaida.com

The news feed feature provides constant updates where the user is informed of the latest and popular posts. Share, like or comment on everything in one place, with the easy and sexy UI.

LATEST POSTS   POPULAR POSTS

 

VOTE

artist.mayaida.com

Inspiration and motivation derives from a vibrant, conducive and competitive environment. Voting lets you choose the best artist, best jury and beyond.

PEOPLE'S CHOICE  BEST OF ALL TIME

 

STORE

store.mayaida.com

Our online store will provide the opportunity for you to BUY or SELL art prints, 3D prints, art books, tutorials, plugins, brushes and much, much more.

BUY  SELL  SHARE  CRITIQUE

 

Who Are We?

The Maya IDA team consists of artists, designers, developers, entrepreneurs, writers, enthusiasts and lovers of art. We live what we preach; priding ourselves on our imaginative and creative brains that strive to develop art and artist communities through the multiple opportunities and avenues. With many of the team being creators in their own right we understand the need for a community such as Maya IDA and it is these values that we put at the forefront of all we do, our simple ethos the Creator comes first. We are a community that totals more than 49K fans including artists, futurists and many more.

 

What is Maya iDA platform ?

Simply, Maya iDA has been established as an online platform to bridge the gap between artists and their fans as well as identifying and providing opportunities in the diverse markets that make up the consistently evolving Entertainment Landscape of today. As envisioned by Founder/ Manager of the Maya IDA Facebook Page “Prakash Dalai” through a unique approach the team will provide support and resources for aspiring artists upon each step of his/her career.

 

Preview - "M.iDA Artist Profile"

 


Feed Page

Project Collaboration

Cause Art Page

 

 

FAQ ?

Who can join Mayaida?

Anyone can join mayaida.com, but for artists there is a review process. The process starts after the artist creates a portfolio at mayaida.com; the resultant portfolio will be subject to review and approval by one of our existing members or admins. The same rule is applied for any submission by studios or businesses.

If you join Maya iDA as a supporter/fan, there is no need for the review process, however a supporter/fan is unable make portfolios, but rather boards where he/she can pin their favorite artists and art, as well as supporting cause arts.

Can i join mayaida.com with my facebook or twitter account ?

YES, and if you wish to disconnect your account from Facebook or Twitter you can at anytime.

Who can submit artworks for The Art Book or Project ?

In order to submit artworks for an Art Book or Project, you need to first collaborate with the same Art Book or Project. You can start submitting art works once you selected as a successful collaborator. You cannot collaborate for more than 3 projects.

Who is the jury for the Art Books ?

For specific art books the jury will consist of specific industry masters and experts from different parts of the art and digital art world.

Who can start a Cause Art ?

AnyOne.

What do you mean by 'Profit Share' ?

When one or more art projects becomes a "Production," it means that Maya iDA is planning to publish/distribute the Production for money. A resulting project could be realized as an art book, educational book or short film! Once produced, MayaiDA.com splits the money it makes on the monetization of Productions 50-50 with the Contributing Artists whose art works and materials are included within the Production.

Example: If MayaiDA.com manages to turn a project into a money-making production, such as an Coffee Table Art Book. Fifty percent of the Profits would go to Maya iDA, our official business entity, which maintains the Site, funds future projects, and pays a small team of professionals whose job it is to design, produce, and direct Maya iDA Productions. The remaining fifty percent of Profits goes to all the Contributing Artists whose art works are used within the Production. The writer, artist, the editors, everybody who had a hand in creating the final publication or short film gets a share of the Profits based on how much their contributions were valued (See below).

How is the Contributing Artists' Profit Pool' split up ?

It all depends on your contribution to the projects as well the score factor which means how you engage at MayaiDA.com, the score comes from the likes of your posts, gallery, and reviewing new artist as well participation in art projects. At the end of the day, MayaiDA.com will make the final allocation decisions because someone has to have final sign off, but our decisions will be informed by and based upon community feedback as well.

Are the example book cover and book pages subject to change?

Yup.

For Further Questions and Queries

info@mayaida.com

M.iDA : Inspiring & Making New Artist To Change The World Through The Power Of Art
story_txt:
A dynamic platform conceived to discover, inspire, support and establish opportunities for talented artists from around the world to create "Cause Art".
 
Three Simple Approches



PORTFOLIO
artist.mayaida.com
With high user experience, it will be easy to upload multiple files, connect and engage with your follower.
1. Online Presence & Connections





 






ART PROJECTS
projects.mayaida.com
Enhance your offline presence with products specifically established to create maximum exposure within the entertainment industry and beyond.
2. Offline Presence & Profit Share


 



CAUSE ART
causes.mayaida.com
Creating groundswell support we can envisage the societies of tomorrow, today, through the power of art.
3. Social Change & Public Presence





 


Maya iDA was established as a democratic platform to source, discover, inspire and support talented artists from around the world. In introducing opportunities for artists to collaborate with other exciting talent, Maya iDA will support its community in harnessing and utilizing their skills and imaginations for positive social action by creating ‘Cause Art’. The resulting publications and activity will explore the issues, fears, hopes and dreams for change that populates the contemporary human condition.  Artists have always been at the forefront of driving change and their desire to explore and understand their own world is key to the advancement of culture and civilization in all forms and this is central to the ethos of Maya iDA.
 
In addition to the Cause Art initiative Maya iDA will offer a number of services and resources including self-publishing tools and access to financial support, all complimented by a vibrant community that supports both fledgling and seasoned artists alike.

Our First Art Book - 2050:REBIRTH
2050:REBIRTH - Art Book

A view of a possible future, topics and themes explored will include - Quantum Physics, Nano bots, Parallel Universe, Beyond Black Holes, Spaceships, Advanced Human Entertainment, Advance Fashion Designs, Major Changes in Human Culture, Alien & Human Collaboration, Advance Communication & Languages, Artificial Intelligence, Singularity, Augmented Reality, Bio-Mechanics and Robots For Daily Life.
Although present in our lives today, 2050 will extrapolate on nascent and emerging technology, providing the blueprint for the future. By 2050, many of our natural instincts and activities, as well as our technology and lifestyle, will have changed. For example, Will men still need women to fulfill their fantasies? Will the natural reproduction of children have altered altogether? Will women still need men for fertilization? Perhaps a bio-mech alternative may take their place.
Imagine the food and entertainment of the future. .. What species will exist in 2050. What path will humanity take? Genetic mutation will certainly be a reality, but will it be a perversion of nature and science or part of evolution.  Within this new world what kind of new species will be born and how does the climate affect their development. What will the effects be on our society? Have robots taken control of our security systems and become our national guard? Will men be needed at all?
Maybe the future will become too much for men to handle, perhaps the changes that will most
certainly occur will be too much for us. What effect would that have on our society?
Imagine if Earth gave up its struggle against mankind and fought back? Would humanity be forced to find a new home? What possible planets will there be? If there was to be an Exodus in 2050 what form would it take? Would the focus be on discovering and developing new technology or the pursuit of a more spiritual path?
What will we be of value in the Year 2050?
 

More Features at Maya iDA



NEAR YOU
artist.mayaida.com
A global feature that will inform you of events, exhibitions and opportunities in your geographic region or further afield. This service is also designed to be a consistently updated service and resource for art schools, art jobs or studios near you.  
CHALLENGES   ART SCHOOLS  STUDIOS





 






SECURE
artist.mayaida.com
With Maya iDA Security features your art will be safer than ever. Each time your work is downloaded or shared, there will be water marks, portfolio links and copyright information alongside it. Security is a key value at Maya iDA and we will be constantly updating these features.
COPYRIGHT   BACKLINK   WATERMARK


 



REPORT
artist.mayaida.com
Unfortunately, scams and fraudulent  clients, as well as artists, have grown within online communities and the professional environment, but now it is going to end with the specially designed REPORT PAGE, where you can report about scammers and easily tell the world about them. As this is a key concern within the community and Maya iDA we will be constantly updating this feature.
REPORT SCAM   REPORT THEFT





 






NEWS FEED
artist.mayaida.com
The news feed feature provides constant updates where the user is informed of the latest and popular posts. Share, like or comment on everything in one place, with the easy and sexy UI.
LATEST POSTS   POPULAR POSTS


 



VOTE
artist.mayaida.com
Inspiration and motivation derives from a vibrant, conducive and competitive environment. Voting lets you choose the best artist, best jury and beyond.
PEOPLE'S CHOICE  BEST OF ALL TIME





 






STORE
store.mayaida.com
Our online store will provide the opportunity for you to BUY or SELL art prints, 3D prints, art books, tutorials, plugins, brushes and much, much more.
BUY  SELL  SHARE  CRITIQUE


 

Who Are We?
The Maya IDA team consists of artists, designers, developers, entrepreneurs, writers, enthusiasts and lovers of art. We live what we preach; priding ourselves on our imaginative and creative brains that strive to develop art and artist communities through the multiple opportunities and avenues. story:
Hi, my name is Katy and I would like help with funding the set up and continued running of a small home-based art business.

I am currently a private tutor who teaches mainly Maths and English, visiting students in their own homes.  However, the reason that I would like to set up this business is that unfortunately my health has deteriorated over the last few years, due to a neurological disorder that causes me to lose my sight, hearing, causes severe nausea and can leave me at times completely paralysed and not to mention the pain and blinding headaches that comes with each attack.

Although I have tried a multitude of treatments and have seen 28 specialists in the last 3 years, they still haven’t been able to get these attacks under control.  However, I remain ever hopeful that I will soon get to the bottom of it.  But in the mean time, as my condition is so debilitating it means that I cannot always go out to work and continue with my tutoring business as normal.  So to find an alternative source of income I started making my own artwork by upcycling antique and vintage dictionary pages and printing vintage images onto them to create unique and beautiful prints suitable for any room in a house.  With the dawn of the e-book and its increasing popularity, I also take unwanted copies of contemporary books such as ‘Alice in Wonderland’ and ‘Harry Potter’ and put matching images on them to give them new life, as pieces of art.  

I would hopefully like to be able to continue to grow my business by making it completely internet based; selling through a variety of websites and also by setting up my own website so that if I am physically unable to go out to work I can still earn a living by doing something that I absolutely love and am passionate about.  This requires taking more time out of my regular day-to-day work to be able to put in the time and effort required to build this business up to full strength, obviously this means that I will be earning a lot less – so your donations will definitely help in buying more equipment and supporting the build up of this business and making it a success.

 

In return for your donations I would like to be able to share my artwork with you through the perks I offer. 

You can see my full range of prints to choose from at: http://www.flickr.com/photos/vintagereflectionz/

Each print will be completely unique and one-of-a-kind as no print is exactly the same.

 

Please note:

  • All donations include p&p.
  • Art prints do not include framing and matting - just the print.
  • You will not receive the actual print as shown in the pictures but the same image will be printed on a page from the same dictionary or book.

 

If you have any further questions before you would like to donate then you can contact me at: vintagereflectionz@yahoo.com

And once you have donated contact me at this email to let me know which prints you would like (please copy the link from the ‘flicker’ image/s and give me the code number of the print to ensure you get the exact one/s you would like). 

 

Please continue to check my 'Flicker' account as new prints/images are added regularly:  http://www.flickr.com/photos/vintagereflectionz/

 

Hope you enjoy looking at my artwork and that you able to help me in this endeavour :) and even if you cannot donate - please spread the word.

Many thanks and appreciation,

Katy – ‘Vintage Reflectionz’ © 2013

story:
I am a writer and involved with the arts on many levels.  Celebrating and supporting these slam poets is a celebration of the best St. Louis has to offer.  Representation at the regional competition will be possible because of this campaign.

The registration is paid.  This campaign will be used to cover the travel expenses for the team members.  100%.  All of it.  These gifted poets have cultivated their craft and battled their way to win the spots.  Travel expenses are all that remain between them and regional competition.  

Each of the poets have dynamic sites with video clips.  Listen to the pieces for yourself and root for your favorite team member!  

Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this talented team!

story:
The Story

Peter Max Lawrence has been invited to perform at Treefort Fest( http://treefortmusicfest.com/ ) in Boise, ID the weekend of March 23rd-25th and recently had transportation plans fall through.   Please help him raise funds to purchase a train/bus ticket.

 

The Impact

I am already on the bill and have a few friends flying in to see the show.  I need these funds to get me there and back.  If i don't get the funds i won't be able to go and that will be that.  I will be very disappointed as every night before bed for the past few weeks a handsome voice whispers in my ear "If you come to Boise, you will enjoy yourself immensely and your performance will go over very well and wouldn't hanging out with Of Montreal just be splendid?"

Did i mention it is my 35th Birthday?

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is a last minute campaign and don't really have any other option than to plead to my people.

 

I need $400 for a plane ticket and the rest is just cream (this site has a $500 minimum).

I have been offered a $75 matching grant by a sweet and anonymous donor.

I have a have been offered free places to sleep.

 

$7 - signed postcard from At War exhibition and an original post-it doodle just for you

$15 - original 8"x11" charcoal drawing made just for you

$30 - original 9"x12" ink drawing from the drawing box (preselected)

$50 - you name the theme and I will whip up an original 9"x12" ink drawings of said theme and mail it to you.

$100 - you name the theme and I'll whip up two original 9"x12" ink drawings of said theme and mail them to you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you can't help, please help me by getting the word out. all help is genuinely appreciated.

story:
We are the Flying V's! Kitchener-Waterloo first ever poetry slam team elected by the community through scored slams in our first official season last year (2011-2012). The national championship called the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word is being held in Saksatoon, Saskatchewan of October this year. We will compete against about 20 other teams from across Canada, and participate in the symposium of poets through workshops and other performances that week.

We need about $5000 to make this trip happen. We have about half of that already through grants we've successfully received and from performance fees we've collected as independent artists. We are counting on our community to buy our merchandise in advance to help us raise the rest of the money!


This money will help pay for:
- Plane tickets
- A family-owned bed and breakfast we have booked for our stay in Saskatoon
- Our food (which we are going to prepare at the B&B and cook ourselves. Where we stay has been a big thoughful discussion. With our assortment of food intolerances and not wanting to be extravagant, this B&B close to the competition is a great place, rather than the more expensive Hotel. No $16 orange juices for us!)
- Putting money down to record our team album and printing T-shirts and posters
- Paying our visual artists who are going to design our poetry art posters

Lovers and supporters of poetry, help put KW on the national map, and support local artists!

You can reserve yourself
- Our poetry CD (probably around 20 tracks)
- Our poetry chapbook if you like to see the words on paper. There will also be poems in the chapbook that are not on the Album.
- Poetry art posters designed by local visual artists to put on your walls. Quotes from our poets with illustrations by talented visual artists. Our visual artists inclue Leahjane Robinson, Zinta A.A. and Fig!
- the Flying V's KWPS Team T-shirt
- A performance

(Note for contributors: Please enter your full mailing address if merch needs to be mailed to you. And if you want to contribute in cash, please send us an email at kwpoetryslam@gmail.com)


We appreciate your support so much, and hope that this year kicks off a long tradition of KW sending a team to nationals every year,


1, 2, 3...
Raise it!

--The Flying V's, Lindsay Jack, Janice Lee, JT Jones, Beth Murch, Jessalyn Broadfoot

story:
#PFriends Fall Exhibit Season Fundraiser 

Have our backs and we'll put a t-shirt on yours! Simply put: Public Functionary's fall season is quickly approaching, and to make it happen we need your support. As an organization, we strive to present contemporary art experiences that are attainable to all, and with this fundraising campaign we're using the same approach. In lieu of focusing on large donations (though we'll certainly take those too!), we're asking our community to contribute small, feasible amounts that won't break the bank. In exchange, you'll score some choice Public Functionary swag, so you can rep in style wherever you go. 

Since our Kickstarter campaign in 2012, we've been hard at work keeping the doors to our space open and accessible to the community. That accessibility has resulted in a pretty magical thing: a revolving door of ambitious experimenters and creative producers with grand ideas -- all of whom consider Public Functionary home. In the spirit of collaboration and big ideas that extend outside of our walls, we've asked 5 organizations in the PF family to contribute custom t-shirt designs using our logo in some way, shape or form. And just like we share our space, we share the love -- $5 of every t-shirt sale will go back to the independent creative business that designed it, further building investment in our community. 
NOTE: In the spirit of community engagement, there will be no local shipping -- we request you come to Public Functionary during an opening or regular gallery hours on or after October 3rd to pick up your t-shirt! 

HOTROCITY x Public Functionary
Fashion and lifestyle brand HOTROCITY has collaborated with PF on a number of events and performances. They support and promote independent makers and designers through their uber-chic online shop and create eclectic experiences that range from dance performances to epic parties to pop up shops. $5 from each HOTROCITY x PF t-shirt sold will go back to them so they can continue making stylish magic! 


BRLSQ x Public Functionary 
Longtime PF besties and screen print crew extraordinare Burlesque of North America have been an institution in the Twin Cities and beyond for years. From founding the famed Life Sucks Die magazine to designing official posters for top indie bands to running award-winning gallery CO Exhibitions, the BRLSQ boys are some of the hardest working kids in the art game. $5 from each BRLSQ x PF t-shirt sold will go back to their organization. 


Greenroom Magazine x Public Functionary 
Some of the most memorable events at PF have been collaborations with our BFFs at Greenroom Magazine, a lifestyle brand and bi-annual publication. Known for their deep community roots and party-throwing proficiency, the Greenroom crew curates impactful, energetic events with majorly positive vibes and celebrates culture, wellness and artists in their beautifully designed print mag. $5 from each Greenroom x PF t-shirt sold will be donated back to them so they can continue to kill it!


MajiMani X Public Functionary
Talented brothers Jendayi and Amani are the heart and soul behind local art and fashion brand MajiMani. Their mission? To create visual arts products with the power to voice inspirational stories. From throwing down live art at PF to collaborating with other organizations and causes to bring awareness to social issues, MajiMani aims to make powerful statements through art. $5 from each MajiMani x PF t-shirt sold will be reinvested into their organization. 


Anthem Heart x Public Functionary Mini Logo Tee
A supporter and friend for years, Ken Hannigan of Anthem Heart is a born collaborator if we've ever known one. From screen printing to graphic design to dynamic event production, Anthem Heart has most definitely served major coolness to the Twin Cities over the years. In fact, Ken's the one hand-printing all of the t-shirts for this campaign! $5 from each Anthem Heart x PF t-shirt sold will be given back so Anthem Heart can make more awesome stuff!


Classic Public Functionary T-shirt
The  PF classic tee displays our iconic logo in large-scale, front and center like a boss. Created with a discharge technique reminiscent of a bleach imprint, each shirt is one-of-a-kind, with varying levels of splatter and bleed. All proceeds from the classic tee go directly to Public Functionary so we can keep bringing awesome art experiences to the community.


Kevin O'Meara x Public Functionary: The Photo Shoot 
We asked photographer Kevin O'Meara to apply his signature, visceral street style to a photo shoot featuring some of our favorite friends, staffers and cohorts wearing PF tees. In lieu of a polished fashion editorial approach, we chose Kevin specifically because we knew he'd bring the contemporary art realness -- work we'd be proud to show on our gallery walls. True to form, Kevin delivered, capturing candid interactions, hilariously awkward moments, amazing energy AND some pretty snazzy PF t-shirts. 

About the Photographer: 

 Kevin O’Meara is a self-taught contemporary art photographer that lives and works in Minneapolis, MN. His black and white documentation photography explores sociological and subcultural topics in Minnesota and beyond. He has been shooting seriously for 6+ years and is a member of Elephant Gun, a global independent photo collective that delivers compelling visual stories and focuses on humanitarian, reportage, street and fine art photography.
story_txt:
#PFriends Fall Exhibit Season Fundraiser 

Have our backs and we'll put a t-shirt on yours! Simply put: Public Functionary's fall season is quickly approaching, and to make it happen we need your support. As an organization, we strive to present contemporary art experiences that are attainable to all, and with this fundraising campaign we're using the same approach. In lieu of focusing on large donations (though we'll certainly take those too!), we're asking our community to contribute small, feasible amounts that won't break the bank. In exchange, you'll score some choice Public Functionary swag, so you can rep in style wherever you go. 

Since our Kickstarter campaign in 2012, we've been hard at work keeping the doors to our space open and accessible to the community. That accessibility has resulted in a pretty magical thing: a revolving door of ambitious experimenters and creative producers with grand ideas -- all of whom consider Public Functionary home. In the spirit of collaboration and big ideas that extend outside of our walls, we've asked 5 organizations in the PF family to contribute custom t-shirt designs using our logo in some way, shape or form. And just like we share our space, we share the love -- $5 of every t-shirt sale will go back to the independent creative business that designed it, further building investment in our community. 

NOTE: In the spirit of community engagement, there will be no local shipping -- we request you come to Public Functionary during an opening or regular gallery hours on or after October 3rd to pick up your t-shirt! 

HOTROCITY x Public Functionary
Fashion and lifestyle brand HOTROCITY has collaborated with PF on a number of events and performances. They support and promote independent makers and designers through their uber-chic online shop and create eclectic experiences that range from dance performances to epic parties to pop up shops. $5 from each HOTROCITY x PF t-shirt sold will go back to them so they can continue making stylish magic! 




BRLSQ x Public Functionary 
Longtime PF besties and screen print crew extraordinare Burlesque of North America have been an institution in the Twin Cities and beyond for years. From founding the famed Life Sucks Die magazine to designing official posters for top indie bands to running award-winning gallery CO Exhibitions, the BRLSQ boys are some of the hardest working kids in the art game. $5 from each BRLSQ x PF t-shirt sold will go back to their organization. 



Greenroom Magazine x Public Functionary 


Some of the most memorable events at PF have been collaborations with our BFFs at Greenroom Magazine, a lifestyle brand and bi-annual publication. Known for their deep community roots and party-throwing proficiency, the Greenroom crew curates impactful, energetic events with majorly positive vibes and celebrates culture, wellness and artists in their beautifully designed print mag. $5 from each Greenroom x PF t-shirt sold will be donated back to them so they can continue to kill it!




MajiMani X Public Functionary

Talented brothers Jendayi and Amani are the heart and soul behind local art and fashion brand MajiMani. Their mission? To create visual arts products with the power to voice inspirational stories. From throwing down live art at PF to collaborating with other organizations and causes to bring awareness to social issues, MajiMani aims to make powerful statements through art. $5 from each MajiMani x PF t-shirt sold will be reinvested into their organization. 



Anthem Heart x Public Functionary Mini Logo Tee

A supporter and friend for years, Ken Hannigan of Anthem Heart is a born collaborator if we've ever known one. From screen printing to graphic design to dynamic event production, Anthem Heart has most definitely served major coolness to the Twin Cities over the years. In fact, Ken's the one hand-printing all of the t-shirts for this campaign! $5 from each Anthem Heart x PF t-shirt sold will be given back so Anthem Heart can make more awesome stuff!







Classic Public Functionary T-shirt
The  PF classic tee displays our iconic logo in large-scale, front and center like a boss. Created with a discharge technique reminiscent of a bleach imprint, each shirt is one-of-a-kind, with varying levels of splatter and bleed. All proceeds from the classic tee go directly to Public Functionary so we can keep bringing awesome art experiences to the community.




Kevin O'Meara x Public Functionary: The Photo Shoot 

We asked photographer Kevin O'Meara to apply his signature, visceral street style to a photo shoot featuring some of our favorite friends, staffers and cohorts wearing PF tees. In lieu of a polished fashion editorial approach, we chose Kevin specifically because we knew he'd bring the contemporary art realness -- work we'd be proud to show on our gallery walls. True to form, Kevin delivered, capturing candid interactions, hilariously awkward moments, amazing energy AND some pretty snazzy PF t-shirts. 






About the Photographer: 
 Kevin O’Meara is a self-taught contemporary art photographer that lives and works in Minneapolis, MN. His black and white documentation photography explores sociological and subcultural topics in Minnesota and beyond. He has been shooting seriously for 6+ years and is a member of Elephant Gun, a global independent photo collective that delivers compelling visual stories and focuses on humanitarian, reportage, street and fine art photography.

story:
Our Story

 

 

I am asking you to help artists everywhere create more work.  

 

I am Joseph Kinnebrew (http://www.josephkinnebrew.com).  I created an idea that would offer a variety of options to serve artists and others who were passionate about art.

 

I am very committed to helping others and for 2 years have personally financed the building of this idea.  It is AcquisitionArt.com.  It is about artists flourishing by using their special form of creativity and while much of this starts and depends upon selling their work I can assure you after 45 years of surviving as an artist it is about a lot more than just selling work.

 

We are much more than an on line gallery.  The idea of AcquisitionArt.com is evolving into a multilayered web based service business.  We are still in the early stages but our idea is functional(ing) and has been in beta test since February.  There are many things we would like to share with you.  When you visit the site you can read more about how we pursue our unique mission.  This goes far beyond the usual approach to selling art.  This is an artist's idea about what artists need to work effectively.

 

The cornerstone of our idea is that it is uncommonly personal and very flexible. When offering art for sale we create a one on one conversation between the owner of the art and an interested buyer. When artists tell their story they are far more apt to sell their work.  I started with what I know to be true from years of experience.  Stories create provenance.  Provenance instills pride of ownership and that builds collections.

 

We want to reach out everywhere the Internet does.  Yes, we want to converse with the world and yes we believe this is a 3rd new way to sell art. 

 

We have devoted months of research to the many things we can offer to help artists survive by reflecting their highly individual needs.   We also include others who simply own art and want to sell it.  On our functioning prototype website (new design coming soon) you can read about many of these services and we are deeply involved in developing others, particularly in the areas of higher education, webcasts with information on demand, logistical support and corporate sponsorship.

 

It is just all this important because history teaches us that:          

 

With no art there will be no memory of us.

 

The Impact

We are past the idea stage with a small team and have over 25 prototype artist participants, 7 distinguished advisory professionals (you can read about them on line) and 3 art advisors.  We have been live on the web testing our idea since February.


This is an evolving project and like many it moves in fits and starts as we gain expertise, insight, funding and develop new partnerships and relationships.  It is well known that getting artists to act on their own behalf is difficult.  We have many aspects of AqA to fund in the months ahead but specifically at this stage and in this project we are seeking funding to reach out to artists virtually everywhere and have them present their work in one of our categories to sell it.  These  categories can be seen in the sections on line which are currently limited to "The Collection" and The MarketPlace" but more have been programed such as photography, prints, student work  and ceramics.  They are ready as soon as we have listings.  Our initial goal is to have 2500 works of art and fine crafts offered for sale.  Before we can invite (actively solicit) buyers we must have a sufficient number of art objects for them to look at, or in other words, have and exciting collection!


We have concluded from the initial prototype that in this next stage, offering an incentive to existing sellers to bring other sellers to the project, is a realistic and accelerated way to grow.  The object of having many new works is to create sales which establishes credibility and creates it's own momentum.


There are many aspects of survival that we will address, but we believe that selling work is the most important place to start.  Once we can point to sales many other things will follow.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are seeking $7,500 for a reward program.   We will use any and all of these funds to administer and offer $2.50 to a current project participant for every accepted listed item by a new artist they bring to AcquisitionArt.com.  This will help us "stock our shelves with inventory" (listed items are listed for 6 months at no charge).


I feel the time has come to reach out to others for funding.  To date I have funded this project personally. This includes site design (which needs to be redone), programing, web site, administrative, office, salary and marketing expenses.  I have done this for nearly 2 years because I think it is important.


All of us here know how to say thanks and share.


For all our benefactors pledging over $25 we waive the 15% admin fee for purchases (see below) and say thank you.  We also offer gifts for various levels of contribution... thank you.


I am and we are volunteers with a passion and know the most important thing you get is more art in your life and that of others.  That is our mission and you can join us.  In this economy and in these times of turbulent change artists have traditionally brought forth the gifts of insight into things up close and far away.  We need more art and we should not have to subject it to only the uncertainly of generosity and  charity.


We are anxious to tell you more about our vision and what we have done.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

AcquisitionArt is not a charity or non-profit. We act and operate as a business that looks to the future.  I know from years of personal experience the art business needs affordable, easily accessible and centralized services.   To date we cannot find such encompassing and often critical services elsewhere. 

There are many projects for us to undertake and we hope you will want to hear more from us about these as we get to know each other.  This is a wonderful and eminently worthy journey.  We want to bring greater dignity and opportunity to artists.  We hope that fewer of them won't have to have second and third jobs that they use to support a few stolen moments in the studio to share and create works for everyone.

On the web site http://www.acquisitionart.com there is an important menu item referring to partnerships.  Please read this as it can be very useful to various cultural institutions, which you may have an interest in.  We believe by sharing there will be more art.  

..and you can help with your ideas and suggestions... we can all share in many ways

story:
Welcome to MINT!

MINT is a collaborative, multidisciplinary space founded and operated by artists located in Columbus, Ohio. Abidingly fresh, adaptable, and dynamic, our mission at MINT is to support underrepresented and developing artists, to cultivate relationships within the community, to embrace alternative projects, and to remain persistently disobedient to traditional thinking.

In this campaign we are seeking your support in order to be able to continue bringing diverse programming with wide reaching community involvement and support, as well as to work on the building in order to make it more secure and make our presence and gallery more enjoyable for our patrons and neighbors. 
With your support in this campaign and in the upcoming year we can continue to bring programming in music, performance, dance, and visual arts as well as make ourselves more sustainable and thrive as a gallery. In this upcoming year we would like to open a public dark room, wood shop, and art book and zine store but we cannot accomplish these projects without your help!

The Impact

  • In the past year MINT has brought you noteworthy art shows such as Glory Bead, My Body Your Surface, and Joint Crux with international artists who have also shown at NADA, Frieze, and Art Basel, performances from Other Girls and ATOM-R, as well as diverse music ranging from Counterfeit Madison to the BUILD crew. We are looking forward to continuing this programming and also hope that we can offer more art programs through new workshops and classes in our darkroom and wood shop as well as continued community outreach.
  • During last year's fundraiser after our unfortunate break-in, we were able to replace most equipment that was stolen and a new security system was donated to us (Thank You!!!). Since then we have remained vigilant in our own security and sustainability, however we are asking for a little more help in order to remain secure and make our space more enjoyable for our friends and patrons!

The Breakdown:

We are asking for $5,000 and are applying for matching grants that require proof of community support, so if we meet our goal we could potentially raise $10,000! For every dollar you donate that could be a two dollar difference to us!

  • We have perks that include MINT 'swag' as well as art prints and original art works, please see our perks page!
  • Here is our list of needs along with their associated cost in list of priority:
  • fire extinguishers: ($500) 
  • exit signs ($250) 
  • electric repairs: ($1500) 
  • two new doors to exterior ($150)
  • seal the floor & paint walls and ceiling of gallery ($500) 
  • dehumidifier and air filtration ($500) 
  • fixing plumbing ($200) 
  • bandsaw? compound mitre saw, hammer drill ($600) 
  • mess sink ($100) 
  • darkroom ($700) 
  • This adds up to our goal, if we are able to raise money past this or to be awarded grants we will invest that in the following
  • drywall and insulation ($1,000) 
  • track lighting ($3,000)
  • building bookstore ($500)
  • building climate controlled art storage space ($500)

Risks & Challenges

We are so grateful to have a diverse group of members and supporters who can offer their assistance in maintaining the building and continuing our programming. We keep costs down by depending on our friends and peers and look forward to continuing our new partnerships and increased community presence!

  • With the money that's donated we will focus first on improving the building, then on expanding our resources in order to share our new opportunities with the community through events and workshops. If we do not meet our goal we will still apply for matching grants and continue to do the best with what we have!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute during this campaign, there are other ways you can help us!
  • If you are able to volunteer for any events please let us know! Feel free to write on the event page and our event coordinator will contact you (this would mean so much to us!)
  • You can also contribute a 100% tax-deductible amount of your choosing (through Fractured Atlas, our non-profit fiscal sponsor) at:  https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/profile?id=13694

Thanks again so much for your continued support and interest in us, please visit our facebook page to keep up on what's going on as well as our instagram!

https://www.facebook.com/MINTcolumbus/

https://www.instagram.com/mmmintcollective/

Mint Collective is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Mint Collective must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
About Me

Vanessa Turner is a charcoal and pastel artist born in and working in Bermuda. Vanessa has been drawing for as long as she can remember, back in the days of colouring books, Crayola Crayons & mom’s white walls.

The Red Carpet Intro

What happened to all those amazing dreams you had a child? Do you remember them? You wanted to climb mountains, trek through the rainforest, sail a huge boat, plant your own garden, sing on broadway, etc. We had tons didn’t we? 

But as we grew up, many of those dreams faded. Some of those dreams held on though, and are still with us aren’t they?

So what are you doing about them? Have you pushed your dreams aside claiming that they are unrealistic and buried them under a pile of excuses, “I don’t have enough money”, “I don’t have time”, “It just won’t work”, “I’m only setting myself up for failure”, “I can’t because I have children”, “People will talk about me”… Well just in case you forgot, we only live once, so if not now then when?

I’m putting a little “S” on my chest and finally doing a solo art exhibition! I’ve made a commitment and have been working steadily all year to share something beautiful with you. I'm committing to my passion in a way that I never have before, taking a chance, exposing my spirit and hoping for the best.

"And the day came when the risk to remain tight in the bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom" - Anais Nin

You can check out my artwork online: http://vanessaturner.com 

About Commonplace Beauty

Show Title: Commonplace Beauty 
Location: Bermuda Society of Arts, City Hall Arts Centre (free entry) 
Schedule: September 20th - October 9th, 2013 
Grand Opening: September 20th, 2013 5:30pm - 7:30pm

My show and artwork focuses on finding beauty in everyday objects and being grateful for the beauty around us.

"Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it" - Confucius

Do we perceive beauty in a commonplace? We have developed a culture in which, through familiarity, we take for granted the value and beauty of life's most basic and fundamental offerings. There is truly beauty in the commonplace, for those that dare take the time to observe and appreciate it.

"Do not blame the thistle that you see no beauty" -  Johnathan Lockwood Huie

I'm intrigued by what is – but rarely noticed. By remaining highly sensitive to the subtleties of light and shadow, I create intimate reflections of everyday life, objects and people. Finding beauty in the common place is important to me as a form of reflection, appreciation and gratitude... And that in itself... gratitude is one of life's greatest healers. 

When I’m painting, each piece of artwork goes through numerous stages as it is built up in layers. Each layer has a different purpose and presents new challenges and struggles. At these stages I constantly remind myself not to feel defeated or give up. Instead, I press on through the difficulty to reveal the end product, a beautiful painting that would not have come to be without the underlying struggle. The process is interestingly reflective of life’s journeys.

They often say, “When you look outside, you dream. When you look within, you awaken”. My art is a voice motivating you and me to do both. 

What I Need & What You'll Receive

All funding received will go towards the exhibition's expenses as follows:

  • Venue Rental & Display - $350.00
  • Fine Art Framing Costs - $2800.00 <--- The Big Monty
  • Exhibition Invitations - $100.00
  • Advertising - $50.00
  • Fine Art Catalogues & Posters (published catalogues of the exhibited work)- $250.00
  • Misc. (i.e. shipping) - $200.00

The art industry can be very difficult to survive in. So I am forever grateful for the support received that enables me push my passion to another level. In return for your support and kindness, I have some amazing thank-you gifts for various contribution levels are listed below:

  • Shout Out: You can receive a shout out on my facebook page and twitter letting everyone knows how appreciative I am of your support.
  • Hand Written Thank-You: You can receive a personal, handwritten fine art notecard from me thanking you for your support.
  • Limited Edition Poster Print: You can receive a signed limited edition poster of the exhibited works.
  • Art Catalogue: You can receive a signed limited edition copy of my first fine art catalogue.
  • Personal Tour: You can receive a personal tour of the exhibit by me as we discuss the exhibit in more depth.
  • Gift Certificate: You can receive a $100-$350 gift certificate toward your purchase of artwork or a commission.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone will be in a position to contribute but the fact that you've even taken the time to read about my campaign and view my work says a lot about your spirit. Please feel free to contribute in these other ways: 

  • Share this campaign on facebook and/or twitter
  • Spread the word, my exhibition runs from September 20th - October 9th, 2013 at the Bermuda Society of Arts

Thank-you with all my heart !!!!

I would LOVE to hear from you. Please feel free to email me: info@vanessaturner.com
story_txt:
About Me
Vanessa Turner is a charcoal and pastel artist born in and working in Bermuda. Vanessa has been drawing for as long as she can remember, back in the days of colouring books, Crayola Crayons & mom’s white walls.

The Red Carpet Intro
What happened to all those amazing dreams you had a child? Do you remember them? You wanted to climb mountains, trek through the rainforest, sail a huge boat, plant your own garden, sing on broadway, etc. We had tons didn’t we? 
But as we grew up, many of those dreams faded. Some of those dreams held on though, and are still with us aren’t they?
So what are you doing about them? Have you pushed your dreams aside claiming that they are unrealistic and buried them under a pile of excuses, “I don’t have enough money”, “I don’t have time”, “It just won’t work”, “I’m only setting myself up for failure”, “I can’t because I have children”, “People will talk about me”… Well just in case you forgot, we only live once, so if not now then when?
I’m putting a little “S” on my chest and finally doing a solo art exhibition! I’ve made a commitment and have been working steadily all year to share something beautiful with you. I'm committing to my passion in a way that I never have before, taking a chance, exposing my spirit and hoping for the best.
"And the day came when the risk to remain tight in the bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom" - Anais Nin
You can check out my artwork online: http://vanessaturner.com 
About Commonplace Beauty
Show Title: Commonplace Beauty Location: Bermuda Society of Arts, City Hall Arts Centre (free entry) Schedule: September 20th - October 9th, 2013 Grand Opening: September 20th, 2013 5:30pm - 7:30pm
My show and artwork focuses on finding beauty in everyday objects and being grateful for the beauty around us.
"Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it" - Confucius
Do we perceive beauty in a commonplace? We have developed a culture in which, through familiarity, we take for granted the value and beauty of life's most basic and fundamental offerings. There is truly beauty in the commonplace, for those that dare take the time to observe and appreciate it.
"Do not blame the thistle that you see no beauty" -  Johnathan Lockwood Huie
I'm intrigued by what is – but rarely noticed. By remaining highly sensitive to the subtleties of light and shadow, I create intimate reflections of everyday life, objects and people. Finding beauty in the common place is important to me as a form of reflection, appreciation and gratitude... And that in itself... gratitude is one of life's greatest healers. 
When I’m painting, each piece of artwork goes through numerous stages as it is built up in layers. Each layer has a different purpose and presents new challenges and struggles. At these stages I constantly remind myself not to feel defeated or give up. Instead, I press on through the difficulty to reveal the end product, a beautiful painting that would not have come to be without the underlying struggle. The process is interestingly reflective of life’s journeys.
They often say, “When you look outside, you dream. When you look within, you awaken”. My art is a voice motivating you and me to do both. 



What I Need & What You'll Receive
All funding received will go towards the exhibition's expenses as follows:

Venue Rental & Display - $350.00
Fine Art Framing Costs - $2800.00 <--- The Big Monty

Exhibition Invitations - $100.00
Advertising - $50.00
Fine Art Catalogues & Posters (published catalogues of the exhibited work)- $250.00
Misc. (i.e. shipping) - $200.00

The art industry can be very difficult to survive in. So I am forever grateful for the support received that enables me push my passion to another level. In return for your support and kindness, I have some amazing thank-you gifts for various contribution levels are listed below:


Shout Out: You can receive a shout out on my facebook page and twitter letting everyone knows how appreciative I am of your support.

Hand Written Thank-You: You can receive a personal, handwritten fine art notecard from me thanking you for your support.

Limited Edition Poster Print: You can receive a signed limited edition poster of the exhibited works.

Art Catalogue: You can receive a signed limited edition copy of my first fine art catalogue.

Personal Tour: You can receive a personal tour of the exhibit by me as we discuss the exhibit in more depth.

Gift Certificate: You can receive a $100-$350 gift certificate toward your purchase of artwork or a commission.



Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that not everyone will be in a position to contribute but the fact that you've even taken the time to read about my campaign and view my work says a lot about your spirit. Please feel free to contribute in these other ways: 

Share this campaign on facebook and/or twitter
Spread the word, my exhibition runs from September 20th - October 9th, 2013 at the Bermuda Society of Arts


Thank-you with all my heart !!!!
I would LOVE to hear from you. Please feel free to email me: info@vanessaturner.com

story:
I’m back with another dream project: a graphic novella about driving across Canada and thinking about life. Several years ago, with the help of many funders, I was able to make a book of watercolours, and it has honestly been the highlight of my career. But it got me thinking about a lot of other ideas and other ways to tell a story. And a graphic novella seems like a logical next step. And as these things seem to go, a perfect storm is brewing. In October, I am doing a three week residency in northern B.C at Cassiar Cannery near Prince Rupert. It’s the perfect opportunity to start a new project. I am planning to drive there, all the while making drawings and notes of my misadventures, of sights and sounds, and of thoughts and small epiphanies, while also recording tips and suggestions for staying sober (fingers crossed) while on such a long, lonely journey. I’ll then use my time at the residency to put it all together: a lyrical road of tangents connected one to the next across the country. If it sounds a little ambitious, just remember, it’s only a novella and anything is possible.

 

And of course I have some fun perks. The graphic novella/comic book of course. But also a digital drawing profile pic, a watercolour profile pic, and even a larger commission for the truly brave at heart. I haven’t quite cracked the code yet for how to survive as an artist, but at least I’m having fun making the truest work of my life as I figure it out, and I am truly grateful to all who have helped on the way. Xo

story:
Konferencja larpowa (“KOLA”), ze swoją sześcioletnią tradycją na stałe wpisała się w życie polskiego środowiska larpowego. “KOLA” jest miejscem, w którym organizatorzy, twórcy i gracze wymieniają się wiedzą i doświadczeniem. Tutaj ogłaszane są najnowsze projekty i inicjatywy larpowe, promuje się najnowsze trendy.  Tegoroczna edycja jest już 8 w historii “KOLI”. Przewidujemy na niej ponad 100 uczestników oraz gości polskich, a także zagranicznych.

Tradycyjnie, udział w KOLI jest bezpłatny dla uczestników. Dzięki temu pozostaje ona możliwie otwarta na wszystkich uczestników. Bardzo zależy nam na utrzymaniu tego aspektu, stwarza on jednak organizacyjne wyzwania. Mimo współpracy z partnerami, organizacja konferencji wymaga pewnych wydatków. Koszt sali na afterparty, napojów dla prelegentów, bufetu z kawą i ciasteczkami składają się na konkretny budżet. Nie za wysoki, ale jednak trudny do sfinansowania ze środków stowarzyszenia larpowego jakim jest Argos. Dlatego zwracamy się do środowiska larpowego z prośba o pomoc.

Dla sfinansowania KOLI uruchomimy akcję crowdfundingową, za pośrednictwem której każdy chętny będzie mógł wesprzeć konferencję. Pomogli nam tu organizatorzy kilku doskonałych polskich larpów, oferując bilety które stały się nagrodami w naszej akcji. Dzięki temu możesz jednocześnie pomóc sfinansować KOLĘ, jak i zaopatrzyć się w bilet na ulubioną grę!


Nasi partnerzy:
