story:
The Basic Idea.

The goal of this fundraiser is to get a photographic book published. I plan to meet with everyone from the industry, the girls, the bouncers, the owners, the dj's, and anyone else involved in the business, and use pictures and stories to create a photographic narrative that is interesting, fun, and compelling for the readers.

Before We Get Into The Details!

I want to acknowledge that I know that this seems like a ridiculous idea, but I also think it's a good idea, an idea that I believe in, and one I will do regardless if this project gets funded or not. I believe there will be a lot of people who say I am just trying to get funded to go to strip clubs and have fun, but I would hope that those people have yet to see my work, and have yet to see what I do. 

I am fascinated by strippers. I find it extremely interesting when someones is so attractive they can command money for their attention based solely on how they look, and that it then can become their job. It's a very foreign lifestyle and mindset to my own, and I find it confusing and fun to think about. This book is sort of going to be my exploration of trying to understand that for myself. And out of that I'm hoping some wonderful pictures and stories come to life. I hope you understand that that is my main agenda, to produce work or art or material or whatever the fuck you want to call it, that moves you, and that connects with you.

That being said, there really is no set game plan for the material that will go into the book, I'm not trying to save them, I'm not trying to make them look good or look bad, I'm not trying to get them naked and shoot a book of porn, I'm just trying discover interesting stories and people and go where that takes me. To be honest this idea spawned from my relationships with strippers in the past. Which has been some of the most mind bending and fascinating points in my life. These woman are at times insanely unique, complicated, loving, interesting human beings, and their story needs to be told, because meeting them to me has been both beautiful and valuable for who I am today. 

I want to share that feeling with you in my pictures

I want to share that feeling with you in my stories

I want you to take a ride with me and see what happens.

I want you to trust me that I can do this, and that I can create something you will be proud to own and have a part of your life.

I will do it by myself if I have to, but it will be so much better if you join in this crazy adventure with me.

I'm I Must Be Dead, and you should give me money.

My Work.

Here is a small sample of my photography to get you familiar! After this we will get into the details of this project and why I need your help!

Also here is a link to my last project that was successfully funded!

Burn



OK now that you have the gist! Why I need money, and what you get for funding me!

The main goal of this project is two things. 

  •  To get a book published and produce merchandise for funders. There will be a large 13x11 hardcover image wrap version of the book, and a smaller 7x7 softcover version. I am hoping to get a publisher to do this, but will most likely end up self publishing, which is costly and time consuming. I project this will take 50% or even more of the funds. In addition to the book we will be printing shirts, cell phone covers, stickers, key chains, coffee mugs, and other cool stuff you guys get for donating. This will be the bulk of the cost for this project, which I will not even be able to have made if we don't get funded.
  • To launch isupportstrippers.com which will be a portal for this book, and any information one could possibly want on the stripper industry. Unbiased and informational on both sides of the story. For people wanting to get in, for people wanting to get out, for girls, guys, bouncers, owners, and everything and anything we can think of that goes into the business. At first it will be small and simple, but I hope with some time it will grow into something really unique and interesting for the stripper community, or just for your average person who is curious about this world.

The Perks

T- Shirt 1 - $30 - Also available in bundle packages

T - Shirt 2 - $30 - Also available in bundle packages

Cell Phone Cover- IPhone (4/4s 5/5s) - $30 - Also available in bundle packages

Cell Phone Cover - Galaxy S3/S4) - $30 - Also available in bundle packages

Mug - $30 - Comes with stickers - Available in bundle packages

Key Chain - Comes with stickers - $15 - Comes in most bundle packages

Poster and sticker designs

Booty Shorts! - $40


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Blast us around on Facebook!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Jesús Briceño Reyes

En Español abajo!

I am an Artist-Teacher from Caracas, Venezuela. I am currently based in London, were I have developed as an artist and want to do so as a Teacher. By doing the 

MA in Artist Teachers & Contemporary Practices at Goldsmiths University of London.

This campaign is to fund my tuition fees to enable me to be a more proficient artist and tutor, I want to fulfil this dream of becoming a teacher. By doing the two things that I love most, making art and tutoring others to finding their way. As teaching is not only a skill in which I learn everyday by challenging myself and helping others, it also supports my personal practice by not compromising as it allows me to express myself freely.


I want to give back to the community what it has given to me: invaluable experience. As it will enable me to study in one of the most important art and teaching universities worldwide. This project would not be possible without the support of others all the steps of the away, during, before and after this campaign.

Your contribution will not be for me, it will be for all of us! 


I am managing to cover my living expenses out of a part time job and commissions now and then. We all might be aware that London living costs can be quite high compared to other cities worldwide. 

That is why I am offering my original works, all the paintings and drawings are signed unique pieces. 


Why is it important

I have had the experience to see how art-education can change lives, I did more than 5 years of volunteer work across 3 different government and non-government institutions. Without a doubt Art-education can change the life of people and of youth worldwide. The provision of tools can set a person free and reach distant futures that go beyond expectations.

As a person who has learnt the values of life experience used with the balance of education, I too live this dream and share with the community what I have learnt and will learn.

  • I recognise this as a long shoot, I am not even counting that I am on the reserve list for my tuition fees scholarship, as it covers £ 5000 and it remains unknown until enrolment, one months time!
  • As an international student, I have no money loans in my country to study in the UK, my parents and elder sister help me with what they can. All I can say is that I have my works to give in exchange for you to help me, support myself to help others.




Every little counts

It does not have to be monetary donation, spread the word out!

Use the Indie Go Go tools to share my campaign with your unique link, by doing so I will recompense your help with unique perks.

If you share your campaign with more than 500 people, I will make an ipad drawing of you and e-mail it to you live.


If your friends contribute with:

50 pounds= I will send you an original postcard.

500 pounds = I will make a drawing on paper and mail it to you.

1000 pounds = I will make you a water colour on ph neutral professional paper.

2500 pounds= I will make you a portrait painting.



Thank you very much for your support!



Soy un artista de Caracas, Venezuela. Resido actualmente en Londres, donde he crecido como artista y quiere hacerlo también como profesor. 

Esta campaña es para financiar mis gastos de matrícula para formarme y llegar a ser un artista y tutor más especializado , quiero cumplir este sueño de ser maestro. Al hacer las dos cosas que más amo en la vida: el arte y ayudar a otros a encontrar su camino a través de él. La enseñanza no es sólo una habilidad en la que aprendo cada día, desafiándome a mí mismo y ayudando a otros, sino que también apoya mi práctica personal en un espacio de reflexión, ya que me permite expresarme libremente. 

Quiero devolverle a la comunidad lo que me ha dado: una experiencia invaluable. Ya que me permitirá estudiar en una de las universidades de arte y educación más importantes del mundo. Este proyecto no sería posible sin el apoyo de todos ustedes, antes, durante, y después de esta campaña.

Su contribución no será por mí, ¡será para todos nosotros!

He podido costear mis viáticos con mi trabajo de medio tiempo y las comisiones que recibo de vez en cuando. Tomando en cuenta que Londres es una de las cuidades con los costos de vida más elevados en el mundo.
Es por ello que estoy ofreciendo mis obras originales, todas las pinturas y los dibujos son piezas únicas firmadas.

¿Por qué es importante ?

He tenido la oportunidad de ver cómo el arte-educación puede transformar vidas, al tener más de cinco años de experiencia en trabajo voluntario a través de 3 instituciones diferentes,  gubernamentales y no gubernamentales. Sin lugar a duda el arte-educación puede cambiar la vida de jóvenes en todo el mundo. La provisión de herramientas puede ayudarnos a liberar nuestras mentes y alcanzar metas que superan cualquier expectativa. 

Siendo una persona que ha aprendido el valor del arte como experiencia de vida y su uso en balance con la educación, yo también vivo este sueño y  deseo compartir con la comunidad lo que he aprendido y aprenderé. 

Reconozco que es una meta alta, ni siquiera estoy contando que estoy en la lista de reserva de  la beca internacional de la matrícula de Goldsmiths - para la Maestría de Artistas Docentes y Prácticas Contempóraneas, ya que cubre £ 5000 y que aún se desconoce hasta la inscripción, dentro de un  mes! Como estudiante internacional, no tengo los préstamos de dinero en mi país para estudiar en el Reino Unido, mis padres y mi hermana mayor  me ayuda con lo que pueden. Todo lo que puedo decir es que tengo mis obras para dar a cambio, apoyame para poder ayudar a otros. 

Cada paso iniciativa cuenta¡

  No tiene que una colaboración monetaría, difunde mi campaña! Utiliza las herramientas Indie Go Go para compartir mi campaña con tu enlace único, al hacerlo, yo te recompenzare con premios únicos.

 Si comparte la campaña con más de 500 personas, voy a hacer un dibujo del ipad de usted y enviarlo por correo electrónico.

 Si tus amigos contribuyen con: £ 50 = Yo le enviará una postal original. 

£ 500 = haré un dibujo en papel y enviare por correo.

 1.000 libras  te haré una acuarela en papel profesional de artista.

 2.500 libras  te pintaré un retrato.

¡Muchas gracias por su apoyo!

story:
My name is Andy Moore and I like to build strange artsy things. I have run the Voted Best Camp theme camp at Burning Man since its inception. This strange artsy thing happens to be a roller coaster located in Austin, TX. Bringing a roller coaster to the Burning Man arts festival has been a goal for a very long time and now is my opportunity to do so.
Originally intended for the Burning Flipside event, ridiculous weather put the kibosh on that. We are now faced with the daunting task of disassembly, transport, reassembly, and burning of the roller coaster at the Burning Man event.
With your help we can bring an extremely interactive sculpture to the event and hopefully terrify and thrill many an attendee!

Our funding Breaks down into 5 categories.
Transport: Truck rental, fuel for the truck, 2 nights motel stay, and food for the road trip.
Completion of Roller Coaster: Paint, a better winch, lumber for proper staircase, screws, roller coaster hardware, and lights.
Scwhag: All of the rad perks that we are offering!
Burning of Sculpture: Decomposed Granite, metal rakes, trashcans, and landfill costs.
Camp Costs: Lumber for structure, food, generator fuel, and landfill costs.

Our perks cover a wide spectrum. Some let the contributor proudly display where their money has been well spent. Some grant the generous contributor preview rides here in Austin, TX. And a few lucky and wonderfully generous contributors will be given all access passes to the running of the roller coaster and accompanying Voted Best Camp.  

If we do not reach our goal our funds will be put towards the Voted Best Camp art project which has been showering the Burning Man art festival with laughter and fun for many years.


This is the first year that the core Voted Best Camp team will be venturing into the open playa with their building skills. Having brought 11 successful skateboard halfpipes to the desert, this team knows curvy wooden structure building well. The roller coaster is an evolution on the skateboard ramp. It's already totally built, too! We just need to polish it up a bit, break it down, and get this thing out to the desert!


One of our main risks is the transport of the coaster across the country. We plan to allow ourselves plenty of time for flat tires and weather delays. We have the team with which to transport it, just not the transport itself. Another risk is that of bodily injury moving the pieces of the roller coaster. There needs to be sufficient hands on big pieces to avoid getting hurt. These hands then require food, lodging, and transport. Additionally, this thing promises to make a big mess in the desert. Sufficient persons will be required to clean it up properly and they require the same things as the movers and builders. Allowing ourselves enough people and time will make overcoming these challenges much easier.


Even if you can't give any money you can still help us out very much so! Spread the word around the internet and shamelessly help Voted Best Camp promote their roller coaster! Thank you for your time.- Andy

story:
UPDATE! 12.29.15

We've had a generous donor step up and offer to match the next $500 in contributions, dollar for dollar. Your $15 donation is now worth $30! Your $100 donation is worth $200! 

Only 60 hours left in the campaign...now is the time!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Still don't have a Christmas gift for that special someone? Give the gift of art, social justice...and fashion. For your $100 contribution in your name or that of a loved one, you'll receive a beautiful scarf or bag woven by Karen refugees. (We will contact you for your choice of bag or scarf.)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE! AjA in the news! 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

There are so many debates happening right now about refugees and immigrants...but how often do you hear directly from refugees and immigrants themselves about their experiences? In San Diego alone, almost one out of every four people is an immigrant or refugee. Each person has a story to tell, and a contribution to make to our city. Their voices are a critical part of the political conversations happening today, and yet their voices often go unheard.  

We have a tremendous opportunity to use photography to elevate the voices of refugees and immigrants.

The San Diego International Airport is allowing us to install a 26 foot by 8 foot mural right at the entrance of Terminal 2, for an entire year. 17 million people travel through in that time. The mural will feature the portraits of refugees and immigrants, along with their stories of coming to the United States. We’ve already had a couple really successful community-based workshops to create the images and narratives, and the stories are incredibly powerful. 

The mural will tell a story of resilience, of strength, and of hope. Even more importantly, it’ll serve as an inspiration for empathy, reflection, and conversation for millions of travelers from around the world. 

But We Need Your Financial Support.

We're trying to raise $5000 by New Year’s eve in order to get the mural up by January 15th. Your support of $5 or more will ensure we can make it happen.

All the money raised through this campaign will support AjA's 2016 Public Art Fund, of which Flight+Paths will be the centerpiece installation. Please give $5 or more now to support this important cause.

"When I first came to the US, my speaking was unexplainable to people around me. They don’t even know what I talk. That was a big strange event of my life. But changing is never ending, and I met The AjA Project. They teach me how to use photography to express myself. I was afraid to talk but I was not scared to take picture. That’s how I start changing my life.” - Cuc, from Vietnam

Ways We Can Say Thank You For Your Gift

$5 - For the cost of a Starbucks latte, you'll have good karma for an entire day!

$15 - In addition to good karma, we'll send you a postcard featuring a photograph from AjA's permanent photography collection, taken by an AjA participant

$25 - A beautiful 5x7 lustre print from AjA's permanent photography collection, taken by an AjA participant, plus recognition in an AjA newsletter (good karma included)

$75 - In addition to a 5x7 lustre print from AjA's permanent collection and recognition in an AjA newsletter, you'll receive a listing on AjA's website

$100 - A scarf or bag (your choice) created by Karen refugees living in refugee camps on the border of Thailand (a great holiday gift!) plus the perks already listed above

$200 - A 12-month wall calendar featuring prints from AjA's permanent photography collection (plus good karma and a shout out on Facebook and the AjA website)

$350 - Your name will be listed on a plaque next to the mural (plus a 12-month wall calendar featuring prints from AjA's  permanent photography collection, good karma, and a Facebook/AjA website shout out)

$500 - In addition to the items for the $350 perk, you'll receive a framed 8x10 print from AjA's permanent photography collection(image of your choice), plus your name listed on a plaque next to the mural, a personal letter from someone featured in the mural, and good karma for year! 

$1000 - A 16x24 canvas print from AjA's  permanent photography collection (image of your choice), plus your name listed on a plaque next to the mural, a personal letter from someone featured in the mural, and good karma for a year! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially to the Flight+Paths campaign, you can still help! Here's how:

  • Get the word out about our campaign by sharing via Facebook and Twitter
  • "Like" the Facebook AjA page and stay up-to-date on our work
  • Volunteer at AjA: we are always looking for people to support our work

From all of us at AjA, thank you. We couldn't do what we do without you.

More About The AjA Project's Large Scale Installations

The AjA Project has been using using photography installations to elevate the voices of San Diego’s marginalized communities for a long time. To do so, we work with a team of professional local artists to create stunning large-scale art pieces. These pieces showcase the images and narrative created by immigrants, refugees and other marginalized populations through AjA’s community-based photography programs. We purposefully install the finished pieces in parts of San Diego where immigrant and refugee voices are often left out of the community conversation; in this way, we use art to raise the awareness about marginalized people living right here in San Diego, and spark critical community dialogue around important social issues.

Past Large Scale Installations

Inter+Sections | 2005

Re+COLLECT | 2006

In+GraIN | 2007

underSTAND | 2009

City Heights Community Mural | 2012

Story+LINES | 2015

But AjA is about much more than just public art.

AjA was founded in 2000 (15 years ago!), and we've been providing tools and opportunities for at-risk youth and marginalized communities to reclaim and tell their own stories. Why is this important? Because if you've been told the same story all your life about who you are, and who you will become, you'll begin to believe it. For the people AjA works with, they've been told that their fate is to join a gang, do drugs, struggle in school, and live a life of poverty. But they are more than this, and have so much more to offer. 

Through our in-school and after-school programs, AjA provides a safe space in which young people can examine their realities, strengths, and aspirations. They are inspired to identify and create positive changes individually and in their communities. In this way, AjA programming is a catalyst for self-reflection, identity creation, community development, and, ultimately, social justice. 

“Photography is a way for me to make something permanent and beautiful, a way to create a different world. - Beto, AjA Participant

Meet The AjA Project Staff

MELINDA CHIMENT, PhD 
Executive Director
Born and raised in San Diego, California Melinda has always been curious about the intersections and interplay of culture, identity and opportunity. through her work with migrant farmworkers in Central California, teen mothers in San Diego, refugee youth in Australia and Women in post-conflict Liberia, this curiosity has blossomed into a passion and catalyst for a profession in research and community development. Melinda graduated with a BA from the University of California, Santa Cruz and recently completed her PhD in Sociology from the University of Queensland.
SHINPEI TAKEDA
Co-Founder/Creative Director
Mr. Takeda has initiated and taught participatory photography programs in refugee camps in Thailand, Colombia and San Diego. He is a published photojournalist and experienced videographer. Mr. Takeda graduated from Duke University with a B.S. degree and received his M.A. in Leadership Studies with a focus in Nonprofit Leadership and Management from the University of San Diego.
CHRISTINA CHOMUT
Education Specialist
As a journalist by profession, Christina Chomut found photography to be a powerful medium to communicate and create dialog while documenting a rising feminista political party during the 2003 elections in Mexico. The New York City native spent a semester living in Ensenada and participating in an anthropological research program while completing her B.A. at the Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communications at Arizona State University. During this time, Christina found a direct correlation between her ability to successfully document a population of people photographically and her deeper understanding of that population. This concept resonated through her style of reporting, yielding a position as a daily newspaper reporter for a subsidiary of the San Diego Union-Tribune in 2004. Since 2009, Christina has been working with The AjA Project, both inside and outside the classroom. The effectiveness of AjA’s multi-tiered, theme-based programming served as an impetus for Christina to launch a new international initiative (The Znymka Project) through AjA to work with at-risk and orphaned youth in Ukraine.
JOSEMAR GONZALEZ LIZARRAGA
Graphic Artist
Josemar Gonzalez Lizarraga a Visual Artist, and musician, has extensive experience in both the Tijuana and San Diego communities. He currently works with various Independent Artistic Organizations in Mexico to enrich and communicate the diversity of the Tijuana culture. Josemar incorporates these skills as well as a personal conviction and excitement, to express the personal experiences of youth to others in a way that connects them to a shared consciousness.
DAVE MATHISEN 
Operations and Communications Manager 
Growing up in upstate New York, Dave Mathisen discovered photography through the cheap plastic lenses of disposable cameras. Whether in his make-shift closet darkroom or traveling with his DLSR strapped tightly to his wrist, photography has always been an integral part of his life. Graduating from the University of Pittsburgh with a BSBA in Marketing and International Business, Dave’s career has taken him through Marketing, Human Resources, Education, Photography and eventually settling in the Nonprofit Sector. Dave began his involvement with The AjA Project as a volunteer for the Journey Program in the winter of 2014 and is excited to continue working for an organization he’s so passionate about.

next to the mural (plus a 12-month wall calendar featuring prints from AjA's  permanent
photography collection, good karma, and a Facebook/AjA website shout
out)
$500 - In addition to the items for the $350
perk, you'll receive a framed 8x10 print from AjA's permanent
photography collection(image
of your choice), plus your name listed on a plaque next to the mural, a
personal letter from someone featured in the mural, and good karma for
year! 
$1000 - A 16x24 canvas print from AjA's  permanent
photography collection (image of your choice), plus your name
listed on a plaque next to the mural, a personal letter from someone featured
in the mural, and good karma for a year! 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute financially to the Flight+Paths campaign, you can still help! Here's how:

Get the word out about our campaign by sharing via Facebook and Twitter
"Like" the Facebook AjA page and stay up-to-date on our work
Volunteer at AjA: we are always looking for people to support our work


From all of us at AjA, thank you. We couldn't do what we do without you.
More About The AjA Project's Large Scale Installations
The AjA Project has been using using photography installations to elevate the voices of San Diego’s marginalized communities for a long time. To do so, we work with a team of professional local artists to create stunning large-scale art pieces. These pieces showcase the images and narrative created by immigrants, refugees and other marginalized populations through AjA’s community-based photography programs. We purposefully install the finished pieces in parts of San Diego where immigrant and refugee voices are often left out of the community conversation; in this way, we use art to raise the awareness about marginalized people living right here in San Diego, and spark critical community dialogue around important social issues.
Past Large Scale Installations
Inter+Sections | 2005



Re+COLLECT | 2006


In+GraIN | 2007


underSTAND | 2009


City Heights Community Mural | 2012


Story+LINES | 2015


But AjA is about much more than just public art.
AjA was founded in 2000 (15 years ago!), and we've been providing tools and opportunities for at-risk youth and marginalized communities to reclaim and tell their own stories. Why is this important? Because if you've been told the same story all your life about who you are, and who you will become, you'll begin to believe it. For the people AjA works with, they've been told that their fate is to join a gang, do drugs, struggle in school, and live a life of poverty. But they are more than this, and have so much more to offer. 

Through our in-school and after-school programs, AjA provides a safe space in which young people can examine their realities, strengths, and aspirations. They are inspired to identify and create positive changes individually and in their communities. In this way, AjA programming is a catalyst for self-reflection, identity creation, community development, and, ultimately, social justice. 


“Photography is a way for me to make something permanent and beautiful, a way to create a different world. - Beto, AjA Participant


Meet The AjA Project Staff
MELINDA CHIMENT, PhD Executive DirectorBorn and raised in San Diego, California Melinda has always been curious about the intersections and interplay of culture, identity and opportunity. through her work with migrant farmworkers in Central California, teen mothers in San Diego, refugee youth in Australia and Women in post-conflict Liberia, this curiosity has blossomed into a passion and catalyst for a profession in research and community development. Melinda graduated with a BA from the University of California, Santa Cruz and recently completed her PhD in Sociology from the University of Queensland.

SHINPEI TAKEDACo-Founder/Creative DirectorMr. Takeda has initiated and taught participatory photography programs in refugee camps in Thailand, Colombia and San Diego. He is a published photojournalist and experienced videographer. Mr. Takeda graduated from Duke University with a B.S. degree and received his M.A. in Leadership Studies with a focus in Nonprofit Leadership and Management from the University of San Diego.
CHRISTINA CHOMUTEducation SpecialistAs a journalist by profession, Christina Chomut found photography to be a powerful medium to communicate and create dialog while documenting a rising feminista political party during the 2003 elections in Mexico. The New York City native spent a semester living in Ensenada and participating in an anthropological research program while completing her B.A. at the Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communications at Arizona State University. During this time, Christina found a direct correlation between her ability to successfully document a population of people photographically and her deeper understanding of that population. This concept resonated through her style of reporting, yielding a position as a daily newspaper reporter for a subsidiary of the San Diego Union-Tribune in 2004. Since 2009, Christina has been working with The AjA Project, both inside and outside the classroom. The effectiveness of AjA’s multi-tiered, theme-based programming served as an impetus for Christina to launch a new international initiative (The Znymka Project) through AjA to work with at-risk and orphaned youth in Ukraine.JOSEMAR GONZALEZ LIZARRAGAGraphic ArtistJosemar Gonzalez Lizarraga a Visual Artist, and musician, has extensive experience in both the Tijuana and San Diego communities. He currently works with various Independent Artistic Organizations in Mexico to enrich and communicate the diversity of the Tijuana culture. Josemar incorporates these skills as well as a personal conviction and excitement, to express the personal experiences of youth to others in a way that connects them to a shared consciousness.DAVE MATHISEN Operations and Communications Manager Growing up in upstate New York, Dave Mathisen discovered photography through the cheap plastic lenses of disposable cameras. Whether in his make-shift closet darkroom or traveling with his DLSR strapped tightly to his wrist, photography has always been an integral part of his life. Graduating from the University of Pittsburgh with a BSBA in Marketing and International Business, Dave’s career has taken him through Marketing, Human Resources, Education, Photography and eventually settling in the Nonprofit Sector. Dave began his involvement with The AjA Project as a volunteer for the Journey Program in the winter of 2014 and is excited to continue working for an organization he’s so passionate about.

story:
My Story

In 1982, I had a dream in which I was told that I would be receiving an inheritance of great value from an unknown ancestor. Within a few days after that dream, through a series of synchronisic events, I realized that my inheritance was the Tarot and I received a deck as a gift from a friend. I had known about the Tarot before this but the magical events that were initiated by my dream focused my attention on the Tarot as never before and I came to see the deck as part of my personal spiritual journey. From that day on the Tarot has become the primary focus of my work as an artist, a scholar, and a philosopher.



In 1987, while studying an alchemical illustration representing the Philosopher's Stone, I had a revelation that this image was symbolically interchangeable with the Tarot's World card. This realization was like a key that opened a lock to a forgotten door. I sat mesmerized as images poured out of this new portal in my mind, forming a parade of alchemical illustrations that were spontaneously paired with Tarot trumps. It became obvious that the trumps can be alchemical, and that the series of trumps describes the alchemical Opus. This insight led me into more research, writing, and drawing and after eight years the result was the Alchemical Tarot The Alchemical Tarot was originally published by Harper/Collins in London, in 1995. That edition is now out of print but it became world famous and copies have sold for over $2,000. I recovered the rights to the deck and self-published two new editions (the last edition was funded by my previous campaign on Indiegogo). I have also rewritten the companion book, expanding greatly on the historic background and insights into symbolism. I self-published it as, Alchemy and the Tarot. The Art from the deck has been exhibited at the Tarot Museum in Riola, Italy and at the LA Craft and Folkart Museum, and appeared on numerous television shows.

Meanwhile, I continued to work on new decks and books, I designed and authored the Tarot of the Saints, The Angels Tarot, the Buddha Tarot, and the Vampire Tarot. I authored The Tarot: History, Symbolism, and Divination, which the American Library Association said may be the best book ever written on the subject. I have taught about the Tarot at Omega, the NY Open Center, and the Readers Studio, curated a Tarot exhibition for the LA Craft and Folkart Museum, lectured regularly on the Tarot at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, appeared in documentaries produced by the BBC and independent film makers, and cut the ribbon at opening of the Tarot Museum in Italy. I have become recognized as an expert and a scholar of the Tarot. Through all of this activity, however, I was working in my spare time on a new Tarot deck that would be the culmination and synthesis of all my art and scholarship. This is the Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery, a deck that I have been working on for at least ten years and that is now ready for publication.



The Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery

I started on The Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery because of my love of the 19th century Pre-Raphaelite paintings of Edward Burne-Jones, with their melancholy, otherworldly settings, peopled by tall, pale, stunningly beautiful women and equally memorable heroic men. Burne-Jones and the Pre-Raphaelites believed that art was a spiritual or magical endeavor and toward this end they formed a mystical brotherhood of English artists dedicated to recapturing the sincerity of the art of the early Renaissance-the same period that gave us the Tarot. Burne-Jones was one of the most prominent artists in this movement and it was the work of these artists and mystics that created the fertile soil in which the Golden Dawn took root.

 

Burne-Jones based his tall female “stunners” and melancholy heroes on the paintings of Botticelli and Michelangelo, two artists whose works are considered primary examples of Renaissance Neoplatonic mysticism. His work expresses the Renaissance ideal that physical beauty and spiritual beauty are linked in one continuum that can lead to the mystical experience of beauty itself, as a timeless, underlying reality. Plato described this reality as a radiant light that is the true food of the soul. He said that this light is made of the true essence of Virtue, a higher quality of virtue, beyond mere codes of behavior. In the Renaissance, artists, like Botticelli, symbolized this spiritual essence as an ideal female nude and my studies have shown that it is this ideal that allowed early Tarot artists to place a nude on the World card as a symbol of the primary beauty.

 

Because Burne-Jones was inspired by the beauty and symbolism of the 15th century, it is not surprising that he painted many of the same themes that we find in the Tarot, such as Temperance, Lovers, and the Wheel of Fortune. It seemed to me that he was creating a Tarot but he never finished it. I started this deck with a desire to finish Burne-Jones's Tarot for him. I wanted to see what a deck would look like if it were done in his style and with his sense of sensuality and symbolism. I also realized that it would express the Neoplatonic ideal that I believed was expressed in the Tarot from its origin. By proceeding with this intent, this deck became a bridge between the art and occult symbolism of the 19th century and the iconography and mystical philosophy of the 15th century. It shows that they are both rooted in the perennial mystery that is like a golden thread running through Western History.

 

In Neoplatonic mysticism, numbers are used as symbols and the numbers three and seven are of primary importance. As testament to its Neoplatonic origin, the Tarot has a 5th suit composed of an unnumbered Fool and three times seven trumps. Plato theorized that each person has three souls: the Sole of Appetite, the Soul of Will, and the Soul of Reason, which he symbolized as a chariot with two winged horses and a driver. These three represented a spiritual hierarchy and as individuals developed and balanced each soul through the practice of virtue they were able to advance spiritually and operate at a higher soul level. The keys to spiritual advancement were the Cardinal Virtues. Plato and later philosophers assigned three virtues, one to each of the soul levels, and these are the same three that are depicted in the Tarot: Temperance to the Soul of Appetite, Strength to the Soul of Will, and Justice to the Soul of Reason. If we divide the twenty-one trumps into three groups of seven we find the theme of each group corresponds sequentially to these three soul levels and the sequence also depicts the three virtues that are necessary to bring them into balance.

 

In Plato's theory the complete set of Cardinal Virtues contained a forth called Prudence. In the late Middle Ages and Renaissance, philosophers theorized that the forth virtue. Prudence, contained the other three. So that Temperance, Strength, and Justice were the three virtues necessary to develop the totality that was Prudence. In this view, Prudence represented not just wisdom but a mystical state of enlightenment that was reached when the lesser three virtues brought the soul levels into balance and health. In the Tarot, Prudence is represented by the World card, which represents Prudence as a Botticelli-like beautiful nude. Philosophers equated her with the Soul of the World, which helps to explain the title of the trump. Her Christian counterpart was Sophia, the wisdom of God, who was said to be the mother of the three Christian virtues: Faith, Hope, and Charity. With these three the total number of virtues is brought up to seven and this is the sevenfold mystery.

 

The importance of the number seven was derived from its role in ancient cosmology. From the ancient world until the late Renaissance, the Earth was believed to be the unmoving center of the universe and the fixed stars, formed into constellations, revolved around the Earth from east to west. Between the fixed stars and the Earth, there were believed to be a series of seven crystal spheres, forming seven layers each one closer to the stars as they ascended. On each sphere the ancients placed a planet that orbited independently from the fixed stars. When the sky is viewed with the naked eye, the planets are the only celestial objects that seem to do this. The planets were each named after a god; from the bottom up, they were: Luna, Mercury, Venus, Sol, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. The planets were, also, believed to from a ladder between Heaven and Earth that the soul would descend at birth and at each planet the soul was given certain qualities by the god of the planet. These qualities are the source of the lists or seven virtues and seven vices.

 

The seven planets were thought of as the soul centers of the cosmos and corresponding soul centers could be found ascending the spine, from the sacrum to the crown of the head, in the microcosm of the human body. Pythagoras developed the diatonic music scale with seven notes to capture the sound that each planet made as it orbited the Earth. This was called the music of the spheres. He marked each note with one of the seven vowels of the Greek alphabet and through a musical treatment used this scale to bring the human soul centers into harmony with the planets. These notes functioned as virtues meant to heal each soul center. Later, lists of seven virtues meant to cure seven vices-each associated with a soul center-began to appear in Hermetic, Gnostic, and mystical Christian philosophy. I believe that the Tarot’s trumps depict Virtue driving an ascent through the seven soul centers depicted repeatedly on three levels, corresponding to the three Platonic soul levels. The final achievement of this ascent is illustrated on the Soul of the World card, which depicts Prudence/Sophia as the light of higher consciousness and the true food of the soul.

 

My Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery is designed to illustrate and clarify this mystical heritage found in the series of the trumps. The four minor suits are based on the work I did for the Alchemical Tarot but in a Pre-Raphaelite style and with a stronger connection with traditional decks. The deck will come with a little white book and eventually there will be a companion book. Meanwhile, the philosophy of the trumps is explained fully in chapter four of my Alchemy and the Tarot, and the descriptions of the alchemical minor suits in chapter seven will be applicable to this new deck.

 

You can see more images from the deck at my websites:

thealchemicalegg.com

www.alchemicaltarot.com

 

To learn more about the deck, read this interview that I did with Tarot author, James Ricklef: 

http://jamesricklef.wordpress.com/2012/09/06/deck-creator-forum-sevenfold-mystery/



 



What I Need and What You Get

This edition is ready to print and I need $6,000 for printing costs. If I do not receive all of this money, I can print a smaller edition and I will make up any balance in the payment myself. If you contribute you will receive your premiums. If I receive more funds I will be able to do a larger printing and any donations over the amount needed for printing will function as preorders. After the deck is in print, I will be selling it through my websites



Donate $25 and you'll get a 8.5” by 11” signed archival gyclee print of your choice of one of The Sevenfold Mystery illustrations. These prints sell for $30 plus shipping on my website.



Donate $40 and you'll receive a signed copy of The Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery

 

Donate $75 and you'll receive the signed Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery, and a signed copy of the book, Alchemy and the Tarot.



Donate $110 and you'll receive the signed Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery, a copy of the Alchemical Tarot, and a signed copy of the book, Alchemy and the Tarot.



Donate $175 and you will receive the archival print, the signed Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery, a copy of the Alchemical Tarot, a signed copy of the book, Alchemy and the Tarot, and my book, The Fool's Journey, with large illustrations of the annotated version of the Sevenfold Mystery trumps.

 

Donate $225 and you will receive the signed Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery, a copy of the Alchemical Tarot, a signed copy of the book, Alchemy and the Tarot, and a one hour Tarot reading with the deck (in person if possible or otherwise over the phone).



Donate $600 and you will receive an art edition of the Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery. This deck will be a gyclee printing on archival cotton paper with archival ink and comes in a handmade archival box. It will be similar to the art edition of the Alchemical Tarot displayed on my website. You will also receive a copy of Alchemy and the Tarot.

 

 

I have also added some new perks - see the list on the right.





Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to see the Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery in print, please spread the word. Tweet, post to Facebook, your Wordpress blog, Aeclectic Tarot Forum, or any other media you have access to. Thank you for your encouragement and support.
